On_IN the_AT other_AP hand_NN ,_, the_AT new_JJ authority_NN of_IN $3,825_NNS million_CD proposed_VBN for_IN missile_NN procurement_NN (_( excluding_IN research_NN and_CC construction_NN )_) in_IN 1961_CD is_BEZ $581_NNS million_CD high_JJR than_CS for_IN 1960_CD ._. These_DTS contrasting_VBG trend_NNS in_IN procurement_NN reflect_VB the_AT anticipated_VBN change_NNS in_IN the_AT composition_NN and_CC mission_NNS of_IN our_PP$ Armed_VBN Forces_NNS in_IN the_AT year_NNS ahead_RB ._. The_AT Department_NN of_IN Defense_NN appropriation_NN act_NNS for_IN the_AT past_AP several_AP year_NNS have_HV contained_VBN a_AT rider_NN which_WDT limit_VBZ competitive_JJ bidding_NN by_IN firm_NNS in_IN other_AP country_NNS on_IN certain_AP military_JJ supply_NN item_NNS ._. As_CS I_PPSS have_HV repeatedly_RB stated_VBN ,_, this_DT provision_NN is_BEZ much_QL more_QL restrictive_JJ than_CS the_AT general_JJ law_NN ,_, popularly_RB known_VBN a_CS the_AT Buy_VB American_JJ Act_NN ._. I_PPSS urge_VB once_RB again_RB that_CS the_AT Congress_NP not_* reenact_VB this_DT rider_NN ._. The_AT task_NN of_IN providing_VBG a_AT reasonable_JJ level_NN of_IN military_JJ strength_NN ,_, without_IN endangering_VBG other_AP vital_JJ aspect_NNS of_IN our_PP$ security_NN ,_, is_BEZ greatly_RB complicated_VBN by_IN the_AT swift_JJ pace_NN of_IN scientific_JJ progress_NN ._. The_AT last_AP few_AP year_NNS have_HV witnessed_VBN what_WDT have_HV been_BEN perhaps_RB the_AT most_QL rapid_JJ advance_NNS in_IN military_JJ technology_NN in_IN history_NN ._. Some_DTI weapon_NNS system_NNS have_HV become_VBN obsolescent_JJ while_CS still_RB in_IN production_NN ,_, and_CC some_DTI while_CS still_RB under_IN development_NN ._. Furthermore_RB ,_, unexpectedly_RB rapid_JJ progress_NN or_CC a_AT technological_JJ break-through_NN on_IN any_DTI one_CD weapon_NN system_NN ,_, in_IN itself_PPL ,_, often_RB diminishes_VBZ the_AT relative_JJ importance_NN of_IN other_AP competitive_JJ system_NNS ._. This_DT ha_HVZ necessitated_VBN a_AT continuous_JJ review_NN and_CC reevaluation_NN of_IN the_AT defense_NN program_NN in_IN order_NN to_TO redirect_VB resource_NNS to_IN the_AT new_JJR and_CC more_QL important_JJ weapon_NNS system_NNS and_CC to_TO eliminate_VB or_CC reduce_VB effort_NN on_IN weapon_NNS system_NNS which_WDT have_HV been_BEN overtaken_VBN by_IN event_NNS ._. Thus_RB ,_, in_IN the_AT last_AP few_AP year_NNS ,_, a_AT number_NN of_IN program_NNS which_WDT looked_VBD very_QL promising_JJ at_IN the_AT time_NN their_PP$ development_NN wa_BEDZ commenced_VBN have_HV since_RB been_BEN completely_RB eliminated_VBN ._. For_IN example_NN ,_, the_AT importance_NN of_IN the_AT Regulus_NP 2_CD ,_, a_AT very_QL promising_JJ aerodynamic_JJ ship-to-surface_JJ missile_NN designed_VBN to_TO be_BE launched_VBN by_IN surfaced_VBN submarine_NNS ,_, wa_BEDZ greatly_RB diminished_VBN by_IN the_AT successful_JJ acceleration_NN of_IN the_AT much_QL more_QL advanced_VBN Polaris_NP ballistic_JJ missile_NN launched_VBN by_IN submerged_VBN submarine_NNS ._. Another_DT example_NN is_BEZ the_AT recent_JJ cancellation_NN of_IN the_AT F-108_NN ,_, a_AT long-range_NN interceptor_NN with_IN a_AT speed_NN three_CD time_NNS a_QL great_JJ a_CS the_AT speed_NN of_IN sound_NN ,_, which_WDT wa_BEDZ designed_VBN for_IN use_NN against_IN manned_VBN bomber_NNS in_IN the_AT period_NN of_IN the_AT mid-1960's_NNS ._. The_AT substantial_JJ progress_NN being_BEG made_VBN in_IN ballistic_JJ missile_NN technology_NN is_BEZ rapidly_RB shifting_VBG the_AT main_JJS threat_NN from_IN manned_VBN bomber_NNS to_IN missile_NNS ._. Considering_IN the_AT high_JJ cost_NN of_IN the_AT F-108_NN system_NN --_-- over_IN $4_NNS billion_CD for_IN the_AT force_NN that_WPS had_HVD been_BEN planned_VBN --_-- and_CC the_AT time_NN period_NN in_IN which_WDT it_PPS would_MD become_VB operational_JJ ,_, it_PPS wa_BEDZ decided_VBN to_TO stop_VB further_AP work_NN on_IN the_AT project_NN ._. Meanwhile_RB ,_, other_AP air_NN defense_NN force_NNS are_BER being_BEG made_VBN effective_JJ ,_, a_CS described_VBN later_RBR in_IN this_DT message_NN ._. The_AT size_NN and_CC scope_NN of_IN other_AP important_JJ program_NNS have_HV been_BEN reduced_VBN from_IN early_JJR plan_NNS ._. This_DT project_NN wa_BEDZ started_VBN at_IN a_AT time_NN when_WRB there_EX wa_BEDZ a_AT critical_JJ need_NN for_IN a_AT high-energy_NN fuel_NN to_TO provide_VB an_AT extra_JJ margin_NN of_IN range_NN for_IN high_JJ performance_NN aircraft_NN ,_, particularly_RB our_PP$ heavy_JJ bomber_NNS ._. As_CS a_AT result_NN ,_, the_AT scope_NN of_IN this_DT project_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN sharply_RB curtailed_VBN ._. These_DTS example_NNS underscore_VB the_AT importance_NN of_IN even_QL more_QL searching_VBG evaluation_NNS of_IN new_JJ major_JJ development_NN program_NNS and_CC even_QL more_QL penetrating_JJ and_CC far-ranging_JJ analysis_NNS of_IN the_AT potentiality_NNS of_IN future_JJ technology_NN ._. Strategic_JJ force_NNS ._. --_-- The_AT deterrent_NN power_NN of_IN our_PP$ Armed_VBN Forces_NNS come_VBZ from_IN both_ABX their_PP$ nuclear_JJ retaliatory_JJ capability_NN and_CC their_PP$ capability_NN to_TO conduct_VB other_AP essential_JJ operation_NNS in_IN any_DTI form_NN of_IN war_NN ._. The_AT second_OD capability_NN is_BEZ represented_VBN by_IN our_PP$ deployed_VBN ground_NN ,_, naval_JJ ,_, and_CC air_NN force_NNS in_IN essential_JJ forward_JJ area_NNS ,_, together_RB with_IN ready_JJ reserve_NNS capable_JJ of_IN effecting_VBG early_JJ emergency_NN reinforcement_NN ._. The_AT Strategic_JJ Air_NN Command_NN is_BEZ the_AT principal_JJS element_NN of_IN our_PP$ long-range_NN nuclear_JJ capability_NN ._. One_CD of_IN the_AT important_JJ and_CC difficult_JJ decision_NNS which_WDT had_HVD to_TO be_BE made_VBN in_IN this_DT budget_NN concerned_VBD the_AT role_NN of_IN the_AT B-70_NN ,_, a_AT long-range_NN supersonic_JJ bomber_NN ._. (_( C_NP )_) For_IN loan_NN to_IN the_AT Government_NN of_IN India_NP under_IN subsection_NN (_( G_NP )_) of_IN Section_NN 104_CD of_IN the_AT Act_NN ,_, the_AT rupee_NN equivalent_JJ of_IN not_* more_AP than_IN $538_NNS million_CD for_IN financing_VBG such_JJ project_NNS to_TO promote_VB balanced_VBN economic_JJ development_NN a_CS may_MD be_BE mutually_RB agreed_VBN ._. (_( 2_CD )_) The_AT Government_NN of_IN India_NP shall_MD maintain_VB or_CC cause_VB to_TO be_BE maintained_VBN book_NNS and_CC record_NNS adequate_JJ to_TO identify_VB the_AT good_NNS and_CC service_NNS financed_VBN for_IN agreed_VBN project_NNS pursuant_JJ to_IN paragraph_NNS 1_CD (_( B_NP )_) and_CC 1_CD (_( C_NP )_) of_IN Article_NN 2_CD ,_, of_IN the_AT Agreement_NN ,_, to_TO disclose_VB the_AT use_NN thereof_RB in_IN the_AT project_NNS and_CC to_TO record_VB the_AT progress_NN of_IN the_AT project_NNS (_( including_IN the_AT cost_NN thereof_RB )_) ._. The_AT two_CD Governments_NNS shall_MD have_HV the_AT right_NN at_IN all_ABN reasonable_JJ time_NNS to_TO examine_VB such_JJ book_NNS and_CC record_NNS and_CC all_ABN other_AP document_NNS ,_, correspondence_NN ,_, memoranda_NNS and_CC other_AP record_NNS involving_VBG transaction_NNS relating_VBG to_IN agreed_VBN project_NNS ._. The_AT Government_NN of_IN India_NP shall_MD enable_VB the_AT authorized_VBN representative_NNS of_IN the_AT United_VBN States_NNS to_TO observe_VB and_CC review_VB agreed_VBN project_NNS and_CC the_AT utilization_NN of_IN good_NNS and_CC service_NNS financed_VBN under_IN the_AT project_NNS ,_, and_CC shall_MD furnish_VB to_IN the_AT United_VBN States_NNS all_ABN such_JJ information_NN a_CS it_PPS shall_MD reasonably_RB request_VB concerning_IN the_AT above-mentioned_JJ matter_NNS and_CC the_AT expenditure_NNS related_VBN thereto_RB ._. This_DT broad_JJ delegation_NN leaf_VBZ within_IN our_PP$ discretion_NN (_( subject_JJ to_IN the_AT always-present_JJ criterion_NN of_IN the_AT public_JJ interest_NN )_) both_ABX the_AT determination_NN of_IN what_WDT degree_NN of_IN interference_NN shall_MD be_BE considered_VBN excessive_JJ ,_, and_CC the_AT method_NNS by_IN which_WDT such_JJ excessive_JJ interference_NN shall_MD be_BE avoided_VBN ._. 3_CD ._. The_AT present_JJ proceeding_NN is_BEZ concerned_VBN with_IN the_AT standard_JJ broadcast_NN (_( AM_NP )_) band_NN ,_, from_IN 540_CD kc._NNS to_IN 1600_CD kc._NNS ._. Whenever_WRB two_CD or_CC more_AP standard_JJ broadcast_NN station_NNS operate_VB simultaneously_RB on_IN the_AT same_AP or_CC closely_RB adjacent_JJ frequency_NNS ,_, each_DT interferes_VBZ to_IN some_DTI extent_NN with_IN reception_NN of_IN the_AT other_AP ._. The_AT extent_NN of_IN such_JJ interference_NN --_-- which_WDT may_MD be_BE so_QL slight_JJ a_CS to_TO be_BE undetectable_JJ at_IN any_DTI point_NN where_WRB either_DTX of_IN the_AT station_NNS render_VBZ a_AT usable_JJ signal_NN ,_, or_CC may_MD be_BE so_QL great_JJ a_CS to_TO virtually_RB destroy_VB the_AT service_NN area_NNS of_IN both_ABX station_NNS --_-- depends_VBZ on_IN many_AP factor_NNS ,_, among_IN the_AT principal_JJS one_NNS being_BEG the_AT distance_NN between_IN the_AT station_NNS ,_, their_PP$ respective_JJ radiated_VBN power_NN ,_, and_CC ,_, of_IN particular_JJ significance_NN here_RB ,_, the_AT time_NN of_IN day_NN ._. Other_AP factor_NNS playing_VBG a_AT part_NN in_IN the_AT extent_NN of_IN AM_NN service_NN and_CC interference_NN are_BER the_AT frequency_NN involved_VBN ,_, the_AT time_NN of_IN year_NN ,_, the_AT position_NN of_IN the_AT year_NN in_IN the_AT sunspot_NN cycle_NN ,_, ground_NN conductivity_NN along_IN the_AT transmission_NN path_NN ,_, atmospheric_JJ and_CC manmade_JJ noise_NN ,_, and_CC others_NNS ._. With_IN the_AT existence_NN of_IN these_DTS many_AP factor_NNS ,_, some_DTI of_IN them_PPO variable_JJ ,_, it_PPS obviously_RB ha_HVZ never_RB been_BEN and_CC is_BEZ not_* now_RB possible_JJ for_IN the_AT Commission_NN to_TO make_VB assignment_NNS of_IN AM_NN station_NNS on_IN a_AT case-to-case_JJ basis_NN which_WDT will_MD insure_VB against_IN any_DTI interference_NN in_IN any_DTI circumstance_NNS ._. Rather_RB ,_, such_JJ assignment_NNS are_BER made_VBN ,_, a_CS they_PPSS must_MD be_BE ,_, on_IN the_AT basis_NN of_IN certain_JJ overall_JJ rule_NNS and_CC standard_NNS ,_, representing_VBG to_IN some_DTI extent_NN a_AT statistical_JJ approach_NN to_IN the_AT problem_NN ,_, taking_VBG into_IN account_NN for_IN each_DT situation_NN some_DTI of_IN the_AT variable_NNS (_( e.g._RB ,_, power_NN and_CC station_NN separation_NNS )_) and_CC averaging_VBG out_RP others_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO achieve_VB the_AT balance_NN which_WDT must_MD be_BE struck_VBN between_IN protection_NN against_IN destructive_JJ interference_NN and_CC the_AT assignment_NN of_IN a_AT number_NN of_IN station_NNS large_JJ enough_QLP to_TO afford_VB optimum_JJ radio_NN service_NN to_IN the_AT Nation_NN ._. An_AT example_NN of_IN the_AT overall_JJ standard_NNS applied_VBN is_BEZ the_AT 20-to-1_CD ratio_NN established_VBN for_IN the_AT determination_NN of_IN that_DT degree_NN of_IN cochannel_NN interference_NN which_WDT is_BEZ regarded_VBN a_CS objectionable_JJ ._. By_IN this_DT standard_NN ,_, it_PPS is_BEZ determined_VBN that_CS where_WRB two_CD station_NNS operating_VBG on_IN the_AT same_AP frequency_NN are_BER involved_VBN ,_, objectionable_JJ interference_NN from_IN station_NN A_NN exists_VBZ at_IN any_DTI point_NN within_IN the_AT service_NN area_NN of_IN station_NN B_NN where_WRB station_NN A's_NN$ signal_NN is_BEZ of_IN an_AT intensity_NN one-twentieth_NN or_CC more_AP of_IN the_AT strength_NN of_IN station_NN B's_NN signal_NN at_IN that_DT point_NN ._. 4_CD ._. The_AT 20-to-1_CD ratio_NN for_IN cochannel_NN interference_NN embodies_VBZ one_CD of_IN the_AT fundamental_JJ limiting_VBG principle_NNS which_WDT we_PPSS must_MD always_RB take_VB into_IN account_NN in_IN AM_NN assignment_NNS and_CC allocation_NNS --_-- that_CS signal_NNS from_IN a_AT particular_JJ station_NN are_BER potential_JJ source_NNS of_IN objectionable_JJ interference_NN over_IN an_AT area_NN much_QL great_JJR than_CS that_DT within_IN which_WDT they_PPSS provide_VB useful_JJ service_NN ._. A_AT second_OD fundamental_JJ principle_NN is_BEZ that_DT involved_VBN particularly_RB in_IN the_AT present_JJ proceeding_NN --_-- the_AT difference_NN between_IN nighttime_JJ and_CC daytime_JJ propagation_NN condition_NNS with_IN respect_NN to_IN the_AT standard_JJ broadcast_NN frequency_NNS ._. This_DT is_BEZ a_AT phenomenon_NN familiar_JJ to_IN all_ABN radio_NN listener_NNS ,_, resulting_VBG from_IN reflection_NN of_IN skywave_NN signal_NNS at_IN night_NN from_IN the_AT ionized_VBN layer_NN in_IN the_AT upper_JJ atmosphere_NN known_VBN a_CS the_AT ionosphere_NN ._. All_ABN AM_NN station_NNS radiate_VB both_ABX skywave_NN and_CC groundwave_NN signal_NNS ,_, at_IN all_ABN hour_NNS ;_. ;_. but_CC during_IN the_AT middle_JJ daytime_JJ hour_NNS these_DTS skywave_NN radiation_NNS are_BER not_* reflected_VBN in_IN any_DTI substantial_JJ quantity_NN ,_, and_CC during_IN this_DT portion_NN of_IN the_AT day_NN both_ABX skywave_NN service_NN and_CC skywave_NN interference_NN are_BER ,_, in_IN general_JJ ,_, negligible_JJ ._. But_CC during_IN nighttime_JJ hour_NNS the_AT skywave_NN radiation_NNS are_BER reflected_VBN from_IN the_AT ionosphere_NN ,_, thereby_RB creating_VBG the_AT possibility_NN of_IN one_CD station's_NN$ rendering_VBG service_NN ,_, via_IN skywave_NN ,_, at_IN a_AT much_QL great_JJR distance_NN than_CS it_PPS can_MD through_IN it_PP$ groundwave_NN signal_NN ,_, and_CC at_IN the_AT same_AP time_NN vastly_RB complicating_VBG the_AT interference_NN problem_NN because_RB of_IN the_AT still_RB great_JJR distance_NN over_IN which_WDT these_DTS skywave_NN signal_NNS may_MD cause_VB interference_NN to_IN the_AT signal_NNS of_IN station_NNS on_IN the_AT same_AP and_CC closely_RB adjacent_JJ frequency_NNS ._. Because_RB of_IN the_AT difference_NN between_IN daytime_JJ and_CC nighttime_JJ propagation_NN condition_NNS ,_, it_PPS ha_HVZ been_BEN necessary_JJ to_TO evolve_VB different_JJ allocation_NN structure_NNS for_IN daytime_JJ and_CC nighttime_JJ broadcasting_NN in_IN the_AT AM_NN band_NN ,_, with_IN many_QL more_AP station_NNS operating_VBG during_IN the_AT day_NN than_CS at_IN night_NN ._. 5_CD ._. It_PPS wa_BEDZ recognized_VBN year_NNS ago_RB that_CS the_AT transition_NN from_IN daytime_JJ to_IN nighttime_JJ propagation_NN condition_NNS ,_, and_CC vice_RB versa_RB ,_, is_BEZ not_* an_AT instantaneous_JJ process_NN ,_, but_CC take_VBZ place_NN over_IN period_NNS of_IN time_NN from_IN roughly_RB 2_CD hour_NNS before_IN sunset_NN until_IN about_RB 2_CD hour_NNS after_IN sunset_NN ,_, and_CC again_RB from_IN roughly_RB 2_CD hour_NNS before_IN sunrise_NN until_IN some_RB 2_CD hour_NNS after_IN sunrise_NN ._. During_IN the_AT period_NN of_IN about_RB 4_CD hour_NNS around_IN sunset_NN ,_, skywave_NN transmission_NN condition_NNS are_BER building_VBG up_RP until_CS full_JJ nighttime_JJ condition_NNS prevail_VB ;_. ;_. during_IN the_AT same_AP period_NN around_IN sunrise_NN ,_, skywave_NN transmission_NN is_BEZ declining_VBG ,_, until_CS at_IN about_RB 2_CD hour_NNS after_IN sunrise_NN it_PPS reach_VBZ a_AT point_NN where_WRB it_PPS becomes_VBZ of_IN little_AP practical_JJ significance_NN ._. However_RB ,_, in_IN this_DT case_NN a_CS elsewhere_RB it_PPS wa_BEDZ necessary_JJ to_TO arrive_VB at_IN a_AT single_AP standard_NN to_TO be_BE applied_VBN to_IN all_ABN situation_NNS ,_, representing_VBG an_AT averaging_NN of_IN condition_NNS ,_, and_CC thus_RB to_TO fix_VB particular_JJ point_NNS in_IN time_NN which_WDT would_MD be_BE considered_VBN the_AT dividing_VBG point_NNS between_IN daytime_JJ and_CC nighttime_JJ condition_NNS ._. It_PPS wa_BEDZ determined_VBN that_CS the_AT hour_NNS of_IN sunrise_NN and_CC sunset_NN ,_, respectively_RB ,_, should_MD be_BE used_VBN for_IN this_DT purpose_NN ._. Accordingly_RB ,_, the_AT 1938-39_CD rule_NNS adopted_VBD these_DTS hour_NNS a_CS limitation_NNS upon_IN the_AT operation_NN of_IN daytime_JJ station_NNS ._. Class_NN 2_CD ,_, station_NNS operating_VBG on_IN clear_JJ channel_NNS are_BER required_VBN to_TO cease_VB operation_NN or_CC operate_VB under_IN nighttime_JJ restriction_NNS beginning_VBG either_CC at_IN local_JJ sunset_NN (_( for_IN daytime_JJ class_NN 2_CD ,_, station_NNS )_) or_CC sunset_NN at_IN the_AT location_NN of_IN the_AT dominant_JJ class_NN 1_CD ,_, station_NN where_WRB located_VBN west_NR of_IN the_AT class_NN 2_CD ,_, station_NN (_( for_IN limited-time_NN class_NN 2_CD ,_, station_NNS )_) ._. The_AT same_AP restriction_NNS apply_VB after_IN local_JJ sunset_NN in_IN the_AT case_NN of_IN class_NN 3_CD ,_, station_NNS operating_VBG on_IN regional_JJ channel_NNS ,_, which_WDT after_IN that_DT time_NN are_BER required_VBN to_TO operate_VB under_IN nighttime_JJ restriction_NNS in_IN order_NN to_TO protect_VB each_DT other_AP ._. With_IN respect_NN to_TO nighttime_JJ assignment_NNS ,_, the_AT degree_NN of_IN skywave_NN service_NN and_CC interference_NN is_BEZ determined_VBN by_IN skywave_NN curve_NNS (_( figs._NNS 1_CD and_CC 2_CD of_IN sec._NN 3.190_CD of_IN the_AT rule_NNS )_) giving_VBG average_JJ skywave_NN value_NNS ._. These_DTS curve_NNS were_BED derived_VBN by_IN an_AT analysis_NN of_IN extensive_JJ skywave_NN measurement_NN data_NN ._. It_PPS wa_BEDZ recognized_VBN that_CS skywave_NN signal_NNS ,_, because_RB of_IN their_PP$ reflected_VBN nature_NN ,_, are_BER of_IN great_JJ variability_NN and_CC subject_JJ to_IN wide_JJ fluctuation_NNS in_IN strength_NN ._. For_IN this_DT reason_NN ,_, the_AT more_QL uncertain_JJ skywave_NN service_NN wa_BEDZ denominated_VBN ``_`` secondary_JJ ''_'' in_IN our_PP$ rule_NNS ,_, a_CS compared_VBN to_IN the_AT steady_JJR ,_, more_QL reliable_JJ groundwave_NN ``_`` primary_JJ service_NN ''_'' ,_, and_CC ,_, for_IN both_ABX skywave_NN service_NN and_CC skywave_NN interference_NN ,_, signal_NN strength_NN is_BEZ expressed_VBN in_IN term_NNS of_IN percentage_NN of_IN time_NN a_AT particular_JJ signal-intensity_NN level_NN is_BEZ exceeded_VBN --_-- 50_CD percent_NN of_IN the_AT time_NN for_IN skywave_NN service_NN ,_, 10_CD percent_NN of_IN the_AT time_NN for_IN skywave_NN interference_NN ._. Allocation_NN policy_NNS 6_CD ._. As_CS mentioned_VBN ,_, the_AT allocation_NN of_IN AM_NN station_NNS represents_VBZ a_AT balance_NN between_IN protection_NN against_IN interference_NN and_CC the_AT provision_NN of_IN opportunity_NN for_IN an_AT adequate_JJ number_NN of_IN station_NNS ._. The_AT rule_NNS and_CC policy_NNS to_TO be_BE applied_VBN in_IN this_DT process_NN of_IN course_NN must_MD be_BE based_VBN on_IN objective_NNS which_WDT represent_VB what_WDT is_BEZ to_TO be_BE desired_VBN if_CS radio_NN service_NN is_BEZ to_TO be_BE of_IN maximum_JJ use_NN to_IN the_AT Nation_NN ._. Our_PP$ objective_NNS ,_, a_CS we_PPSS have_HV stated_VBN many_AP time_NNS ,_, are_BER --_-- (_( 1_CD )_) To_TO provide_VB some_DTI service_NN to_IN all_ABN listener_NNS ;_. ;_. (_( 2_CD )_) To_TO provide_VB a_QL many_AP choice_NNS of_IN service_NN to_IN a_QL many_AP listener_NNS a_CS possible_JJ ;_. ;_. (_( 3_CD )_) To_TO provide_VB service_NN of_IN local_JJ origin_NN to_IN a_QL many_AP listener_NNS a_CS possible_JJ ._. Since_CS broadcast_NN frequency_NNS are_BER very_QL limited_VBN in_IN number_NN ,_, these_DTS objective_NNS are_BER to_IN some_DTI extent_NN inconsistent_JJ in_IN that_CS not_* all_ABN of_IN them_PPO can_MD be_BE fully_RB realized_VBN ,_, and_CC to_IN the_AT extent_NN that_CS each_DT is_BEZ realized_VBN ,_, there_EX is_BEZ a_AT corresponding_JJ reduction_NN of_IN the_AT possibility_NNS for_IN full_JJT achievement_NN of_IN the_AT others_NNS ._. Accordingly_RB ,_, the_AT Commission_NN ha_HVZ recognized_VBN that_CS an_AT optimum_JJ allocation_NN pattern_NN for_IN one_CD frequency_NN doe_DOZ not_* necessarily_RB represent_VB the_AT best_JJT pattern_NN for_IN other_AP frequency_NNS ,_, and_CC ha_HVZ assigned_VBN different_JJ frequency_NNS for_IN use_NN by_IN different_JJ class_NNS of_IN station_NNS ._. Some_RB 45_CD frequency_NNS are_BER assigned_VBN for_IN use_NN primarily_RB by_IN dominant_JJ Class_NN 1_CD ,_, --_-- A_NN or_CC Class_NN 1_CD ,_, --_-- B_NN clear-channel_JJ station_NNS ,_, designed_VBN to_TO operate_VB with_IN adequate_JJ power_NN and_CC to_TO provide_VB service_NN --_-- both_ABX groundwave_NN and_CC (_( at_IN night_NN )_) skywave_NN --_-- over_IN large_JJ area_NNS and_CC at_IN great_JJ distance_NNS ,_, being_BEG protected_VBN against_IN interference_NN to_IN the_AT degree_NN necessary_JJ to_TO achieve_VB this_DT objective_NN ._. In_IN dealing_VBG with_IN these_DTS frequency_NNS ,_, the_AT objective_NN listed_VBN first_RB above_RB --_-- provision_NN of_IN service_NN to_IN all_ABN listener_NNS --_-- wa_BEDZ predominant_JJ ;_. ;_. the_AT other_AP objective_NNS were_BED subordinated_VBN to_IN it_PPO ._. The_AT class_NN 1_CD ,_, station_NNS on_IN these_DTS clear_JJ channel_NNS are_BER protected_VBN to_IN their_PP$ 0.1-mv./m._NN groundwave_NN contour_NNS against_IN daytime_JJ cochannel_NN interference_NN ._. With_IN respect_NN to_IN skywave_NN service_NN rendered_VBN at_IN night_NN ,_, class_NN 1_CD ,_, --_-- A_NN station_NNS are_BER the_AT only_AP station_NNS permitted_VBN to_TO operate_VB in_IN the_AT United_VBN States_NNS on_IN clear_JJ channel_NNS specified_VBN for_IN class_NN 1_CD ,_, --_-- A_NN operation_NN ,_, and_CC so_RB render_VB skywave_NN service_NN free_JJ from_IN cochannel_NN interference_NN whereever_WRB they_PPSS may_MD be_BE received_VBN ;_. ;_. class_NN 1_CD ,_, --_-- B_NN station_NNS are_BER protected_VBN at_IN night_NN to_IN their_PP$ 0.5-mv./m._NN 50-percent_NN time_NN skywave_NN contour_NNS against_IN cochannel_NN interference_NN ._. Since_CS the_AT provision_NN of_IN skywave_NN service_NN requires_VBZ adequate_JJ freedom_NN from_IN interference_NN ,_, only_AP class_NN 1_CD ,_, station_NNS are_BER capable_JJ of_IN rendering_VBG skywave_NN service_NN ._. But_CC nighttime_JJ operation_NN by_IN station_NNS of_IN other_AP class_NNS of_IN course_NN entail_VBZ skywave_NN interference_NN to_IN groundwave_NN service_NN ,_, interference_NN which_WDT is_BEZ substantial_JJ unless_CS step_NNS are_BER taken_VBN to_TO minimize_VB it_PPO ._. 7_CD ._. With_IN respect_NN to_IN other_AP frequency_NNS ,_, these_DTS are_BER designated_VBN a_CS regional_JJ or_CC local_JJ ,_, and_CC assigned_VBN for_IN use_NN by_IN class_NN 3_CD ,_, and_CC class_NN 4_CD ,_, station_NNS ,_, respectively_RB ,_, station_NNS operating_VBG generally_RB with_IN low_JJR power_NN ._. In_IN the_AT allocation_NN pattern_NN worked_VBN out_RP for_IN these_DTS frequency_NNS ,_, the_AT provision_NN of_IN long-range_NN service_NN ha_HVZ to_IN some_DTI extent_NN been_BEN subordinated_VBN to_IN the_AT other_AP two_CD objective_NNS --_-- assignment_NN of_IN multiple_JJ facility_NNS ,_, and_CC assignment_NN of_IN station_NNS in_IN a_QL many_AP community_NNS a_CS possible_JJ ._. 8_CD ._. As_CS mentioned_VBN ,_, the_AT primary_JJ allocation_NN objective_NN to_TO be_BE followed_VBN in_IN the_AT allocation_NN of_IN station_NNS on_IN clear_JJ channel_NNS is_BEZ the_AT provision_NN of_IN widespread_JJ service_NN ,_, free_JJ from_IN destructive_JJ interference_NN ._. During_IN nighttime_JJ hour_NNS ,_, because_RB of_IN the_AT intense_JJ skywave_NN propagation_NN then_RB prevailing_VBG ,_, no_AT large_JJ number_NN of_IN station_NNS can_MD be_BE permitted_VBN to_TO operate_VB on_IN one_CD of_IN these_DTS channel_NNS ,_, if_CS the_AT wide_JJ area_NN service_NN for_IN which_WDT these_DTS frequency_NNS are_BER assigned_VBN is_BEZ to_TO be_BE rendered_VBN satisfactorily_RB by_IN the_AT dominant_JJ station_NNS which_WDT must_MD be_BE relied_VBN upon_RB to_TO render_VB it_PPO ._. Therefore_RB ,_, under_IN our_PP$ longstanding_JJ allocation_NN rule_NNS ,_, on_IN some_DTI of_IN these_DTS channel_NNS no_AT station_NN other_AP than_CS the_AT dominant_JJ (_( class_NN 1_CD )_) --_-- A_NN )_) station_NN is_BEZ permitted_VBN to_TO operate_VB at_IN night_NN ,_, so_CS that_CS the_AT 1_CD ,_, --_-- A_NN station_NN can_MD render_VB service_NN ,_, interference_NN free_JJ ,_, wherever_WRB it_PPS can_MD be_BE received_VBN ._. On_IN the_AT remainder_NN of_IN the_AT clear_JJ channel_NNS ,_, the_AT dominant_JJ (_( class_NN 1_CD )_) --_-- B_NN station_NNS are_BER protected_VBN a_CS described_VBN above_RB ,_, and_CC the_AT relatively_QL small_JJ number_NN of_IN secondary_JJ (_( class_NN 2_CD )_) )_) station_NNS permitted_VBN to_TO operate_VB on_IN these_DTS channel_NNS at_IN night_NN are_BER required_VBN to_TO operate_VB directionally_RB and/or_CC with_IN reduced_VBN power_NN so_CS a_CS to_TO protect_VB the_AT class_NN 1_CD ,_, station_NNS ._. In_IN the_AT daytime_NN ,_, on_IN the_AT other_AP hand_NN ,_, since_CS skywave_NN transmission_NN is_BEZ relatively_QL inefficient_JJ ,_, it_PPS is_BEZ possible_JJ to_TO assign_VB a_AT substantially_RB large_JJR number_NN of_IN station_NNS on_IN these_DTS channel_NNS ._. Additional_JJ class_NN 2_CD ,_, assignment_NNS for_IN daytime_JJ operation_NN can_MD be_BE made_VBN without_IN causing_VBG destructive_JJ interference_NN to_IN the_AT class_NN 1_CD ,_, station_NNS or_CC to_IN each_DT other_AP ,_, and_CC by_IN their_PP$ operation_NN provide_VB additional_JJ service_NN on_IN these_DTS channel_NNS and_CC additional_JJ local_JJ outlet_NNS for_IN a_AT large_JJ number_NN of_IN community_NNS ._. Such_JJ additional_JJ daytime_JJ class_NN 2_CD ,_, assignment_NNS are_BER appropriate_JJ if_CS optimum_JJ use_NN is_BEZ to_TO be_BE made_VBN of_IN these_DTS frequency_NNS ,_, and_CC the_AT Commission_NN ha_HVZ over_IN the_AT year_NNS made_VBN a_AT large_JJ number_NN of_IN them_PPO ._. Similarly_RB ,_, on_IN the_AT regional_JJ channel_NNS many_AP class_NN 3_CD ,_, station_NNS have_HV been_BEN assigned_VBN either_CC to_TO operate_VB daytime_RB only_RB or_CC to_TO operate_VB nighttime_RB with_IN directional_JJ antenna_NNS and/or_CC low_JJR power_NN ._. 9_CD ._. Essentially_RB ,_, the_AT question_NN presented_VBN for_IN decision_NN in_IN the_AT present_JJ Daytime_NN Skywave_NN proceeding_NN is_BEZ whether_CS our_PP$ decision_NN (_( in_IN 1938-1939_CD )_) to_TO assign_VB station_NNS on_IN the_AT basis_NN of_IN daytime_JJ condition_NNS from_IN sunrise_NN to_IN sunset_NN ,_, is_BEZ sound_JJ a_CS a_AT basis_NN for_IN AM_NN allocation_NNS ,_, or_CC whether_CS ,_, in_IN the_AT light_NN of_IN late_JJR development_NNS and_CC new_JJ understanding_NN ,_, skywave_NN transmission_NN is_BEZ of_IN such_JJ significance_NN during_IN the_AT hour_NNS immediately_RB before_IN sunset_NN and_CC after_IN sunrise_NN that_CS this_DT condition_NN should_MD be_BE taken_VBN into_IN account_NN ,_, and_CC some_DTI station_NNS required_VBN to_TO afford_VB protection_NN to_IN other_AP station_NNS during_IN these_DTS hour_NNS ._. The_AT history_NN of_IN the_AT proceeding_NN 10_CD ._. The_AT decision_NN reached_VBN in_IN 1938-39_CD wa_BEDZ made_VBN after_IN the_AT accumulation_NN of_IN a_AT large_JJ amount_NN of_IN data_NN and_CC thorough_JJ study_NN thereof_RB ._. Since_IN then_RB ,_, there_EX ha_HVZ been_BEN a_AT notable_JJ increase_NN in_IN the_AT number_NN of_IN station_NNS and_CC also_RB the_AT accumulation_NN of_IN additional_JJ data_NN and_CC the_AT development_NN of_IN new_JJ technique_NNS for_IN using_VBG it_PPO ,_, leading_VBG to_IN a_AT good_JJR understanding_NN of_IN propagation_NN phenomenon_NNS ._. In_IN 1947_CD ,_, affidavit_NNS were_BED filed_VBN with_IN the_AT Commission_NN by_IN various_JJ clear-channel_JJ station_NNS alleging_VBG that_CS extensive_JJ interference_NN wa_BEDZ being_BEG caused_VBN to_IN the_AT service_NN area_NNS of_IN these_DTS station_NNS during_IN daylight_NN hour_NNS ,_, from_IN class_NN 2_CD ,_, station_NNS whose_WP$ signal_NNS were_BED being_BEG reflected_VBN from_IN the_AT ionosphere_NN so_CS a_CS to_TO create_VB skywave_NN intereference_NN ._. If_CS you_PPSS elect_VB to_TO use_VB the_AT Standard_JJ Deduction_NN or_CC the_AT Tax_NN Table_NN ,_, and_CC later_RBR find_VB you_PPSS should_MD have_HV itemized_VBN your_PP$ deduction_NNS ,_, you_PPSS may_MD do_DO so_RB by_IN filing_VBG an_AT amended_VBN return_NN within_IN the_AT time_NN prescribed_VBN for_IN filing_VBG a_AT claim_NN for_IN refund_NN ._. See_VB You_PPSS May_MD Claim_VB A_AT Refund_NN ,_, Page_NN 135_CD ._. The_AT same_AP is_BEZ true_JJ if_CS you_PPSS have_HV itemized_VBN your_PP$ deduction_NNS and_CC later_RBR decide_VB you_PPSS should_MD have_HV used_VBN the_AT Standard_JJ Deduction_NN or_CC Tax_NN Table_NN ._. The_AT word_NNS amended_VBN return_NN should_MD be_BE plainly_RB written_VBN across_IN the_AT top_NN of_IN such_JJ return_NN ._. When_WRB and_CC where_WRB to_TO file_VB April_NP 15_CD is_BEZ usually_RB the_AT final_JJ date_NN for_IN filing_VBG income_NN tax_NN return_NNS for_IN most_AP people_NNS because_CS they_PPSS use_VB the_AT calendar_NN year_NN ending_VBG on_IN December_NP 31_CD ._. Saturday_NR ,_, Sunday_NR ,_, or_CC holiday_NN ._. If_CS the_AT last_AP day_NN (_( due_JJ date_NN )_) for_IN performing_VBG any_DTI act_NN for_IN tax_NN purpose_NNS ,_, such_JJ a_CS filing_VBG a_AT return_NN or_CC making_VBG a_AT tax_NN payment_NN ,_, etc._RB ,_, fall_VBZ on_IN Saturday_NR ,_, Sunday_NR ,_, or_CC a_AT legal_JJ holiday_NN ,_, you_PPSS may_MD perform_VB that_DT act_NN on_IN the_AT next_AP succeeding_VBG day_NN which_WDT is_BEZ not_* a_AT Saturday_NR ,_, Sunday_NR ,_, or_CC legal_JJ holiday_NN ._. Since_CS April_NP 15_CD ,_, 1962_CD ,_, is_BEZ on_IN Sunday_NR your_PP$ return_NN for_IN the_AT calendar_NN year_NN 1961_CD will_MD be_BE timely_RB filed_VBN if_CS it_PPS is_BEZ filed_VBN on_IN or_CC before_IN Monday_NR ,_, April_NP 16_CD ,_, 1962_CD ._. Declaration_NN of_IN estimated_VBN tax_NN ._. The_AT filing_VBG of_IN an_AT original_JJ or_CC amended_VBN declaration_NN ,_, otherwise_RB due_JJ on_IN January_NP 15_CD ,_, 1962_CD ,_, is_BEZ also_RB waived_VBN ,_, if_CS you_PPSS file_VB your_PP$ Form_NN 1040_CD for_IN 1961_CD and_CC pay_VB the_AT full_JJ tax_NN by_IN January_NP 31_CD ,_, 1962_CD ._. Farmers_NNS ,_, for_IN these_DTS purpose_NNS ,_, have_HV until_IN February_NP 15_CD ,_, 1962_CD ,_, to_TO file_VB Form_NN 1040_CD and_CC pay_VB the_AT tax_NN in_IN full_JJ for_IN the_AT calendar_NN year_NN 1961_CD ._. Fiscal_JJ year_NN taxpayer_NNS have_HV until_IN the_AT last_AP day_NN of_IN the_AT first_OD month_NN following_VBG the_AT close_NN of_IN the_AT fiscal_JJ year_NN (_( farmer_NNS until_IN the_AT 15th_OD day_NN of_IN the_AT 2d_OD month_NN )_) ._. See_VB Chapter_NN 38_CD ._. Nonresident_JJ alien_NNS living_VBG in_IN Canada_NP or_CC Mexico_NP who_WPS earn_VB wage_NNS in_IN the_AT United_VBN States_NNS may_MD be_BE subject_JJ to_IN withholding_VBG of_IN tax_NN on_IN their_PP$ wage_NNS ,_, the_AT same_AP a_CS if_CS they_PPSS were_BED citizen_NNS of_IN the_AT United_VBN States_NNS ._. Their_PP$ United_VBN States_NNS tax_NN return_NNS are_BER due_JJ April_NP 16_CD ,_, 1962_CD ._. However_RB ,_, if_CS their_PP$ United_VBN States_NNS income_NN is_BEZ not_* subject_JJ to_IN the_AT withholding_NN of_IN tax_NN on_IN wage_NNS ,_, their_PP$ return_NNS are_BER due_JJ June_NP 15_CD ,_, 1962_CD ,_, if_CS they_PPSS use_VB a_AT calendar_NN year_NN ,_, or_CC the_AT 15th_OD day_NN of_IN the_AT 6th_OD month_NN after_IN the_AT close_NN of_IN their_PP$ fiscal_JJ year_NN ._. Nonresident_JJ alien_NNS in_IN Puerto_NP Rico_NP ._. If_CS A_AT taxpayer_NN dy_VBZ ,_, the_AT executor_NN ,_, administrator_NN ,_, or_CC legal_JJ representative_NN must_MD file_VB the_AT final_JJ return_NN for_IN the_AT decedent_NN on_IN or_CC before_IN the_AT 15th_OD day_NN of_IN the_AT 4th_OD month_NN following_VBG the_AT close_NN of_IN the_AT deceased_JJ taxpayer's_NN$ normal_JJ tax_NN year_NN ._. Suppose_VB John_NP Jones_NP ,_, who_WPS ,_, for_IN 1960_CD ,_, filed_VBD on_IN the_AT basis_NN of_IN a_AT calendar_NN year_NN ,_, died_VBD June_NP 20_CD ,_, 1961_CD ._. Extensions_NNS of_IN time_NN for_IN filing_VBG ._. Adjusted_VBN gross_JJ income_NN ._. The_AT deduction_NNS allowed_VBN in_IN determining_VBG Adjusted_VBN Gross_JJ Income_NN put_VB all_ABN taxpayer_NNS on_IN a_AT comparable_JJ basis_NN ._. (_( See_VB Chapter_NN 6_CD ._. )_) From_IN this_DT amount_NN deduct_VB the_AT item_NNS indicated_VBN below_RB ._. (_( See_VB Chapter_NN 9_CD ._. )_) income_NN from_IN estate_NNS and_CC trust_NNS ._. (_( See_VB Chapters_NNS 30_CD through_IN 37_CD ._. )_) 2_CD ._. Minors_NNS minor_NNS must_MD also_RB file_VB return_NNS if_CS they_PPSS earn_VB $600_NNS or_CC more_AP during_IN the_AT year_NN ._. See_VB Chapter_NN 5_CD ._. Example_NN ._. Your_PP$ 16_CD year_NN old_JJ son_NN earned_VBD $720_NNS in_IN 1961_CD ._. You_PPSS spent_VBD $800_NNS for_IN his_PP$ support_NN ._. Joseph_NP R._NP Brown_NP grew_VBD up_RP in_IN the_AT bustle_NN and_CC enterprise_NN of_IN New_JJ England_NP between_IN 1810_CD and_CC 1830_CD ._. That_DT development_NN ,_, in_IN turn_NN ,_, formed_VBD the_AT foundation_NN of_IN still_QL more_QL significant_JJ expansion_NNS in_IN late_JJR year_NNS --_-- in_IN gear_NN cutting_NN ,_, in_IN circular_JJ graduating_NN ,_, in_IN index_NN drilling_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN many_AP other_AP field_NNS where_WRB accuracy_NN wa_BEDZ a_AT paramount_JJS requirement_NN ._. This_DT machine_NN wa_BEDZ demonstrated_VBN in_IN two_CD textile_NN machinery_NN exhibition_NNS last_AP year_NN and_CC wa_BEDZ well_RB received_VBN by_IN the_AT industry_NN ._. The_AT Uniconer_NP ha_HVZ several_AP outstanding_JJ feature_NNS --_-- it_PPS operates_VBZ with_IN much_QL great_JJR efficiency_NN than_CS existing_VBG equipment_NN ;_. ;_. it_PPS incorporates_VBZ an_AT automatic_JJ knot-tying_JJ device_NN on_IN each_DT spindle_NN ,_, and_CC it_PPS will_MD knot_VB a_AT break_NN in_IN the_AT yarn_NN in_IN 10_CD second_NNS a_QL well_RB a_CS tie_VB in_RP new_JJ bobbin_NNS a_CS the_AT running_VBG end_NN is_BEZ exhausted_VBN ._. Because_CS the_AT bobbin-to-cone_JJ winding_VBG process_NN is_BEZ a_AT relatively_QL high-cost_NN operation_NN for_IN the_AT mill_NN ,_, the_AT almost_QL complete_JJ automation_NN provided_VBN by_IN the_AT Uniconer_NP can_MD mean_VB important_JJ economy_NNS in_IN textile_NN production_NN ,_, at_IN the_AT same_AP time_NN upgrading_VBG quality_NN ._. I_PPSS believe_VB a_AT further_AP gain_NN is_BEZ in_IN prospect_NN for_IN 1961_CD ._. Home_NR entertainment_NN sale_NNS up_RP Reflecting_VBG the_AT large_JJT percentage_NN of_IN high-end_NN set_NNS such_JJ a_CS console_NNS and_CC combination_NNS since_IN 1953_CD ,_, dollar_NN value_NN of_IN home_NR entertainment_NN electronics_NN in_IN 1960_CD wa_BEDZ about_RB $1.9_NNS billion_CD ,_, compared_VBN to_IN $1.7_NNS billion_CD in_IN 1959_CD ._. I_PPSS therefore_RB believe_VB it_PPS is_BEZ realistic_JJ to_TO assume_VB a_AT modest_JJ drop_NN in_IN the_AT total_JJ value_NN of_IN home_NR entertainment_NN electronics_NN to_IN about_RB $1.8_NNS million_CD ,_, slightly_RB below_IN 1960_CD ,_, but_CC above_IN 1959_CD ._. Military_JJ electronics_NN to_TO grow_VB 1960_CD witnessed_VBD another_DT substantial_JJ increase_NN in_IN our_PP$ industry's_NN$ shipment_NNS of_IN military_JJ electronics_NN ,_, which_WDT totalled_VBD about_RB $5.4_NNS billion_CD compared_VBN to_IN $4.9_NNS billion_CD in_IN 1959_CD ._. It_PPS is_BEZ interesting_JJ to_TO note_VB that_CS the_AT present_JJ level_NN of_IN military_JJ electronics_NN procurement_NN is_BEZ great_JJR than_CS the_AT industry's_NN$ total_JJ sale_NNS to_IN all_ABN market_NNS in_IN 1950-1953_CD ,_, which_WDT were_BED good_JJ year_NNS for_IN our_PP$ industry_NN with_IN television_NN enjoying_VBG it_PP$ initial_JJ period_NN of_IN rapid_JJ consumer_NN acceptance_NN ._. Among_IN the_AT item_NNS scheduled_VBN for_IN acceleration_NN in_IN the_AT near_JJ future_NN are_BER the_AT Polaris_NP and_CC B70_NN program_NNS ,_, strengthening_NN of_IN the_AT airborne_JJ alert_NN system_NN of_IN the_AT Strategic_JJ Air_NN Command_NN ,_, and_CC improved_VBN battlefield_NN surveillance_NN system_NNS ._. Research_NN ,_, development_NN test_NN and_CC evaluation_NN fund_NNS ,_, devoted_VBN to_IN missile_NNS in_IN 1960_CD were_BED 3_CD to_IN 4_CD time_NNS a_QL large_JJ a_CS those_DTS devoted_VBN to_IN aircraft_NN ,_, and_CC actual_JJ missile_NN procurement_NN is_BEZ expected_VBN to_TO exceed_VB aircraft_NN procurement_NN by_IN 1963_CD ._. Still_RB later_RBR ,_, the_AT realm_NN of_IN space_NN technology_NN will_MD show_VB substantial_JJ gain_NNS ;_. ;_. it_PPS ha_HVZ been_BEN estimated_VBN that_CS spending_VBG by_IN the_AT National_JJ Aeronautics_NN and_CC Space_NN Administration_NN will_MD rise_VB from_IN le_AP than_IN $500_NNS million_CD in_IN fiscal_JJ 1960_CD to_IN more_AP than_IN $2_NNS billion_CD by_IN 1967_CD ,_, and_CC that_CS the_AT electronic_JJ industry's_NN$ share_NN of_IN these_DTS expenditure_NNS will_MD be_BE closer_RBR to_IN 50%_NN than_CS the_AT current_JJ 20%_NN ._. The_AT stepped-up_JJ defense_NN procurement_NN called_VBN for_IN in_IN the_AT 1961_CD Budget_NN ha_HVZ already_RB begun_VBN to_TO make_VB itself_PPL felt_VBN in_IN an_AT upturn_NN in_IN order_NNS for_IN military_JJ electronic_JJ equipment_NN and_CC the_AT component_NNS that_WPS go_VB into_IN it_PPO ,_, and_CC it_PPS ha_HVZ been_BEN suggested_VBN that_CS an_AT additional_JJ $2_NNS billion_CD increase_NN in_IN total_JJ defense_NN spending_NN may_MD be_BE requested_VBN for_IN fiscal_JJ 1962_CD ._. Introduction_NN It_PPS ha_HVZ recently_RB become_VBN practical_JJ to_TO use_VB the_AT radio_NN emission_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN and_CC planet_NNS a_CS a_AT new_JJ source_NN of_IN information_NN about_IN these_DTS body_NNS and_CC their_PP$ atmosphere_NNS ._. The_AT result_NNS of_IN present_JJ observation_NNS of_IN the_AT thermal_JJ radio_NN emission_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN are_BER consistent_JJ with_IN the_AT very_QL low_JJ thermal_JJ conductivity_NN of_IN the_AT surface_NN layer_NN which_WDT wa_BEDZ derived_VBN from_IN the_AT variation_NN in_IN the_AT infrared_JJ emission_NN during_IN eclipse_NNS (_( e.g._RB ,_, Garstung_NP ,_, 1958_CD )_) ._. When_WRB sufficiently_QL accurate_JJ and_CC complete_JJ measurement_NNS are_BER available_JJ ,_, it_PPS will_MD be_BE possible_JJ to_TO set_VB limit_NNS on_IN the_AT thermal_JJ and_CC electrical_JJ characteristic_NNS of_IN the_AT surface_JJ and_CC subsurface_JJ material_NNS of_IN the_AT moon_NN ._. Observations_NNS of_IN the_AT radio_NN emission_NN of_IN a_AT planet_NN which_WDT ha_HVZ an_AT extensive_JJ atmosphere_NN will_MD probe_VB the_AT atmosphere_NN to_IN a_AT great_JJR extent_NN than_CS those_DTS using_VBG short_JJR wave_NN length_NNS and_CC should_MD in_IN some_DTI case_NNS give_VB otherwise_RB unobtainable_JJ information_NN about_IN the_AT characteristic_NNS of_IN the_AT solid_JJ surface_NN ._. Radio_NN observation_NNS of_IN Venus_NP and_CC Jupiter_NP have_HV already_RB supplied_VBN unexpected_JJ experimental_JJ data_NN on_IN the_AT physical_JJ condition_NNS of_IN these_DTS planet_NNS ._. The_AT observed_VBN intensity_NN of_IN the_AT radio_NN emission_NN of_IN Venus_NP is_BEZ much_QL high_JJR than_CS the_AT expected_VBN thermal_JJ intensity_NN ,_, although_CS the_AT spectrum_NN indicated_VBN by_IN measurement_NNS at_IN wave_NN length_NNS near_IN 3_CD cm_NN and_CC 10_CD cm_NN is_BEZ like_CS that_DT of_IN a_AT black_JJ body_NN at_IN about_RB 600-degrees_NNS ._. This_DT result_NN suggests_VBZ a_AT very_QL high_JJ temperature_NN at_IN the_AT solid_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_AT planet_NN ,_, although_CS there_EX is_BEZ the_AT possibility_NN that_CS the_AT observed_VBN radiation_NN may_MD be_BE a_AT combination_NN of_IN both_ABX thermal_JJ and_CC non-thermal_JJ component_NNS and_CC that_CS the_AT observed_VBN spectrum_NN is_BEZ that_DT of_IN a_AT black_JJ body_NN merely_RB by_IN coincidence_NN ._. For_IN the_AT case_NN of_IN Jupiter_NP ,_, the_AT radio_NN emission_NN spectrum_NN is_BEZ definitely_RB not_* like_CS the_AT spectrum_NN of_IN a_AT black-body_NN radiator_NN ,_, and_CC it_PPS seems_VBZ very_QL likely_JJ that_CS the_AT radiation_NN reaching_VBG the_AT earth_NN is_BEZ a_AT combination_NN of_IN thermal_JJ radiation_NN from_IN the_AT atmosphere_NN and_CC non-thermal_JJ component_NNS ._. Of_IN the_AT remaining_VBG planet_NNS ,_, only_AP Mars_NP and_CC Saturn_NP have_HV been_BEN observed_VBN a_CS radio_NN source_NNS ,_, and_CC not_* very_QL much_AP information_NN is_BEZ available_JJ ._. Mars_NP ha_HVZ been_BEN observed_VBN twice_RB at_IN about_RB 3-cm_NN wave_NN length_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT intensity_NN of_IN the_AT observed_VBN radiation_NN is_BEZ in_IN reasonable_JJ agreement_NN with_IN the_AT thermal_JJ radiation_NN which_WDT might_MD be_BE predicted_VBN on_IN the_AT basis_NN of_IN the_AT known_VBN temperature_NN of_IN Mars_NP ._. The_AT low_JJ intensity_NN of_IN the_AT radiation_NN from_IN Saturn_NP ha_HVZ limited_VBN observation_NNS ,_, but_CC again_RB the_AT measured_VBN radiation_NN seems_VBZ to_TO be_BE consistent_JJ with_IN a_AT thermal_JJ origin_NN ._. No_AT attempt_NNS to_TO measure_VB the_AT radio_NN emission_NN of_IN the_AT remaining_VBG planet_NNS have_HV been_BEN reported_VBN ,_, and_CC ,_, because_RB of_IN their_PP$ distance_NNS ,_, small_JJ diameter_NNS ,_, or_CC low_JJ temperature_NNS ,_, the_AT thermal_JJ radiation_NN at_IN radio_NN wave_NN length_NNS reaching_VBG the_AT earth_NN from_IN these_DTS source_NNS is_BEZ expected_VBN to_TO be_BE of_IN very_QL low_JJ intensity_NN ._. In_IN spite_NN of_IN this_DT ,_, the_AT very_QL large_JJ radio_NN reflector_NNS and_CC improved_VBN amplifying_VBG technique_NNS which_WDT are_BER now_RB becoming_VBG available_JJ should_MD make_VB it_PPO possible_JJ to_TO observe_VB the_AT radio_NN emission_NN of_IN most_AP of_IN the_AT planet_NNS in_IN a_AT few_AP year_NNS ._. The_AT study_NN of_IN the_AT radio_NN emission_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN and_CC planet_NNS began_VBD with_IN the_AT detection_NN of_IN the_AT thermal_JJ radiation_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN at_IN 1.25-cm_NN wave_NN length_NN by_IN Dicke_NP and_CC Beringer_NP (_( 1946_CD )_) ._. This_DT wa_BEDZ followed_VBN by_IN a_AT comprehensive_JJ series_NN of_IN observation_NNS of_IN the_AT 1.25-cm_NN emission_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN over_IN three_CD lunar_JJ cycle_NNS by_IN Piddington_NP and_CC Minnett_NP (_( 1949_CD )_) ._. They_PPSS deduced_VBD from_IN their_PP$ measurement_NNS that_CS the_AT radio_NN emission_NN from_IN the_AT whole_JJ disk_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN varied_VBD during_IN a_AT lunation_NN in_IN a_AT roughly_QL sinusoidal_JJ fashion_NN ;_. ;_. that_CS the_AT amplitude_NN of_IN the_AT variation_NN wa_BEDZ considerably_QL le_AP than_CS the_AT amplitude_NN of_IN the_AT variation_NN in_IN the_AT infrared_JJ emission_NN a_CS measured_VBN by_IN Pettit_NP and_CC Nicholson_NP (_( 1930_CD )_) and_CC Pettit_NP (_( 1935_CD )_) ;_. ;_. and_CC that_CS the_AT maximum_NN of_IN the_AT radio_NN emission_NN came_VBD about_RB 3-1/2_CD day_NNS after_IN Full_JJ Moon_NN ,_, which_WDT is_BEZ again_RB in_IN contrast_NN to_IN the_AT infrared_JJ emission_NN ,_, which_WDT reach_VBZ it_PP$ maximum_NN at_IN Full_JJ Moon_NN ._. Piddington_NP and_CC Minnett_NP explained_VBD their_PP$ observation_NNS by_IN pointing_VBG out_RP that_CS rocklike_JJ material_NNS which_WDT are_BER likely_JJ to_TO make_VB up_RP the_AT surface_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN would_MD be_BE partially_QL transparent_JJ to_IN radio_NN wave_NNS ,_, although_CS opaque_JJ to_IN infrared_JJ radiation_NN ._. The_AT infrared_JJ emission_NN could_MD then_RB be_BE assumed_VBN to_TO originate_VB at_IN the_AT surface_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN ,_, while_CS the_AT radio_NN emission_NN originates_VBZ at_IN some_DTI depth_NN beneath_IN the_AT surface_NN ,_, where_WRB the_AT temperature_NN variation_NN due_JJ to_IN solar_JJ radiation_NN is_BEZ reduced_VBN in_IN amplitude_NN and_CC shifted_VBN in_IN phase_NN ._. Since_CS the_AT absorption_NN of_IN radio_NN wave_NNS in_IN rocklike_JJ material_NN varies_VBZ with_IN wave_NN length_NN ,_, it_PPS should_MD be_BE possible_JJ to_TO sample_VB the_AT temperature_NN variation_NN at_IN different_JJ depth_NNS beneath_IN the_AT surface_NN and_CC possibly_RB detect_VB change_NNS in_IN the_AT structure_NN or_CC composition_NN of_IN the_AT lunar_JJ surface_NN material_NN ._. The_AT radio_NN emission_NN of_IN a_AT planet_NN wa_BEDZ first_RB detected_VBN in_IN 1955_CD ,_, when_WRB Burke_NP and_CC Franklin_NP (_( 1955_CD )_) identified_VBN the_AT origin_NN of_IN interference-like_JJ radio_NN noise_NN on_IN their_PP$ record_NNS at_IN about_RB 15_CD meter_NNS wave_NN length_NN a_CS emission_NN from_IN Jupiter_NP ._. This_DT sporadic_JJ type_NN of_IN planetary_JJ radiation_NN is_BEZ discussed_VBN by_IN Burke_NP (_( chap._NN 13_CD )_) and_CC Gallet_NP (_( chap._NN 14_CD )_) ._. Steady_JJ radiation_NN which_WDT wa_BEDZ presumably_RB of_IN thermal_JJ origin_NN wa_BEDZ observed_VBN from_IN Venus_NP at_IN 3.15_CD and_CC 9.4_CD cm_NN ,_, and_CC from_IN Mars_NP and_CC Jupiter_NP at_IN 3.15_CD cm_NN in_IN 1956_CD (_( Mayer_NP ,_, McCullough_NP ,_, and_CC Sloanaker_NP ,_, 1958_CD ,_, A_NP ,_, B_NP ,_, C_NP )_) ,_, and_CC from_IN Saturn_NP at_IN 3.75_CD cm_NN in_IN 1957_CD (_( Drake_NP and_CC Ewen_NP ,_, 1958_CD )_) ._. In_IN the_AT relatively_QL short_JJ time_NN since_IN these_DTS early_JJ observation_NNS ,_, Venus_NP ha_HVZ been_BEN observed_VBN at_IN additional_JJ wave_NN length_NNS in_IN the_AT range_NN from_IN 0.8_CD to_IN 10.2_CD cm_NN ,_, and_CC Jupiter_NP ha_HVZ been_BEN observed_VBN over_IN the_AT wave-length_NN range_NN from_IN 3.03_CD to_IN 68_CD Aj_NN ._. The_AT observable_JJ characteristic_NNS of_IN planetary_JJ radio_NN radiation_NN are_BER the_AT intensity_NN ,_, the_AT polarization_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT direction_NN of_IN arrival_NN of_IN the_AT wave_NNS ._. The_AT maximum_JJ angular_JJ diameter_NN of_IN any_DTI planetary_JJ disk_NN a_CS observed_VBN from_IN the_AT earth_NN is_BEZ about_RB 1_CD minute_NN of_IN arc_NN ._. This_DT is_BEZ much_QL small_JJR than_CS the_AT high_JJT resolution_NN of_IN even_RB the_AT very_QL large_JJ reflector_NNS now_RB under_IN construction_NN ,_, and_CC consequently_RB the_AT radio_NN emission_NN of_IN different_JJ region_NNS of_IN the_AT disk_NN cannot_MD* be_BE resolved_VBN ._. It_PPS should_MD be_BE possible_JJ ,_, however_RB ,_, to_TO put_VB useful_JJ limit_NNS on_IN the_AT diameter_NNS of_IN the_AT radio_NN source_NNS by_IN observing_VBG with_IN large_JJ reflector_NNS or_CC with_IN interferometer_NNS ._. Measurements_NNS of_IN polarization_NN are_BER presently_RB limited_VBN by_IN apparatus_NN sensitivity_NN and_CC will_MD remain_VB difficult_JJ because_RB of_IN the_AT low_JJ intensity_NN of_IN the_AT planetary_JJ radiation_NN at_IN the_AT earth_NN ._. There_EX have_HV been_BEN few_AP measurement_NNS specifically_RB for_IN the_AT determination_NN of_IN the_AT polarization_NN of_IN planetary_JJ radiation_NN ._. The_AT measurement_NNS made_VBN with_IN the_AT NRL_NN 50-foot_JJ reflector_NN ,_, which_WDT is_BEZ altitude-azimuth-mounted_JJ ,_, would_MD have_HV shown_VBN a_AT systematic_JJ change_NN with_IN local_JJ hour_NN angle_NN in_IN the_AT measured_VBN intensity_NNS of_IN Venus_NP and_CC Jupiter_NP if_CS a_AT substantial_JJ part_NN of_IN the_AT radiation_NN had_HVD been_BEN linearly_RB polarized_VBN ._. Recent_JJ interferometer_NN measurement_NNS (_( Radhakrishnan_NP and_CC Roberts_NP ,_, 1960_CD )_) have_HV shown_VBN the_AT 960-mc_NN emission_NN of_IN Jupiter_NP to_TO be_BE partially_RB polarized_VBN and_CC to_TO originate_VB in_IN a_AT region_NN of_IN large_JJR diameter_NN than_CS the_AT visible_JJ disk_NN ._. Other_AP than_CS this_DT very_QL significant_JJ result_NN ,_, most_AP of_IN the_AT information_NN now_RB available_JJ about_IN the_AT radio_NN emission_NN of_IN the_AT planet_NNS is_BEZ restricted_VBN to_IN the_AT intensity_NN of_IN the_AT radiation_NN ._. The_AT concept_NN of_IN apparent_JJ black-body_NN temperature_NN is_BEZ used_VBN to_TO describe_VB the_AT radiation_NN received_VBN from_IN the_AT moon_NN and_CC the_AT planet_NNS ._. The_AT received_VBN radiation_NN is_BEZ compared_VBN with_IN the_AT radiation_NN from_IN a_AT hypothetical_JJ black_JJ body_NN which_WDT subtends_VBZ the_AT same_AP solid_JJ angle_NN a_CS the_AT visible_JJ disk_NN of_IN the_AT planet_NN ._. The_AT apparent_JJ black-body_NN disk_NN temperature_NN is_BEZ the_AT temperature_NN which_WDT must_MD be_BE assumed_VBN for_IN the_AT black_JJ body_NN in_IN order_NN that_CS the_AT intensity_NN of_IN it_PP$ radiation_NN should_MD equal_VB that_DT of_IN the_AT observed_VBN radiation_NN ._. The_AT use_NN of_IN this_DT concept_NN doe_DOZ not_* specify_VB the_AT origin_NN of_IN the_AT radiation_NN ,_, and_CC only_RB if_CS the_AT planet_NN really_RB radiates_VBZ a_CS a_AT black_JJ body_NN ,_, will_MD the_AT apparent_JJ black-body_NN temperature_NN correspond_VB to_IN the_AT physical_JJ temperature_NN of_IN the_AT emitting_VBG material_NN ._. The_AT radio_NN radiation_NN of_IN the_AT sun_NN which_WDT is_BEZ reflected_VBN from_IN the_AT moon_NN and_CC planet_NNS should_MD be_BE negligible_JJ compared_VBN with_IN their_PP$ thermal_JJ emission_NN at_IN centimeter_NN wave_NN length_NNS ,_, except_IN possibly_RB at_IN time_NNS of_IN exceptional_JJ outburst_NNS of_IN solar_JJ radio_NN noise_NN ._. The_AT quiescent_JJ level_NN of_IN centimeter_NN wave-length_NN solar_JJ radiation_NN would_MD increase_VB the_AT average_JJ disk_NN brightness_NN temperature_NN by_IN le_AP than_IN 1-degree_NN ._. At_IN meter_NN wave_NN length_NNS an_AT increase_NN of_IN the_AT order_NN of_IN 10-degrees_NNS in_IN the_AT average_JJ disk_NN temperature_NNS of_IN the_AT near_JJR planet_NNS would_MD be_BE expected_VBN ._. Therefore_RB ,_, neglecting_VBG the_AT extreme_JJ outburst_NNS ,_, reflected_VBN solar_JJ radiation_NN is_BEZ not_* expected_VBN to_TO cause_VB sizable_JJ error_NNS in_IN the_AT measurement_NNS of_IN planetary_JJ radiation_NN in_IN the_AT centimeter-_NN and_CC decimeter-wave-length_NN range_NN ._. 2_CD ._. The_AT moon_NN 2.1_CD observation_NNS Radio_NN observation_NNS of_IN the_AT moon_NN have_HV been_BEN made_VBN over_IN the_AT range_NN of_IN wave_NN length_NNS from_IN 4.3_CD mm_NN to_IN 75_CD cm_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT result_NNS are_BER summarized_VBN in_IN Table_NN 1_CD ._. Observations_NNS have_HV also_RB been_BEN made_VBN at_IN 1.5_CD mm_NN using_VBG optical_JJ technique_NNS (_( Sinton_NP ,_, 1955_CD ,_, 1956_CD ,_, ;_. ;_. see_VB also_RB chap._NN 11_CD )_) ._. Not_* all_ABN the_AT observer_NNS have_HV used_VBN the_AT same_AP procedure_NNS or_CC made_VBN the_AT same_AP assumption_NNS about_IN the_AT lunar_JJ brightness_NN distribution_NN when_WRB reducing_VBG the_AT data_NN ,_, and_CC this_DT ,_, together_RB with_IN difference_NNS in_IN the_AT method_NNS of_IN calibrating_VBG the_AT antenna_NNS and_CC receiver_NNS ,_, must_MD account_VB for_IN much_AP of_IN the_AT disagreement_NN in_IN the_AT measured_VBN radio_NN brightness_NN temperature_NNS ._. In_IN the_AT observation_NNS at_IN 4.3_CD mm_NN (_( Coates_NP ,_, 1959_CD )_) ,_, the_AT diameter_NN of_IN the_AT antenna_NN beam_NN ,_, 6'.7_NN ,_, wa_BEDZ small_JJ enough_QLP to_TO allow_VB resolution_NN of_IN some_DTI of_IN the_AT large_JJR feature_NNS of_IN the_AT lunar_JJ surface_NN ,_, and_CC contour_NN diagram_NNS have_HV been_BEN made_VBN of_IN the_AT lunar_JJ brightness_NN distribution_NN at_IN three_CD lunar_JJ phase_NNS ._. These_DTS observation_NNS indicate_VB that_CS the_AT lunar_JJ maria_NNS heat_VB up_RP more_QL rapidly_RB and_CC also_RB cool_VB off_RP more_QL rapidly_RB than_CS do_DO the_AT mountainous_JJ region_NNS ._. Mare_NN Imbrium_NP seems_VBZ to_TO be_BE an_AT exception_NN and_CC remains_VBZ cool_JJR than_CS the_AT region_NNS which_WDT surround_VB it_PPO ._. These_DTS contour_NN diagram_NNS also_RB suggest_VB a_AT rather_QL rapid_JJ falloff_NN in_IN the_AT radio_NN brightness_NN with_IN latitude_NN ._. Very_QL recently_RB ,_, observation_NNS have_HV been_BEN made_VBN at_IN 8-mm_NN wave_NN length_NN with_IN a_AT reflector_NN 22_CD meter_NNS in_IN diameter_NN with_IN a_AT resultant_JJ beam_NN width_NN of_IN only_RB about_RB 2'_NNS (_( Amenitskii_NP ,_, Noskova_NP ,_, and_CC Salomonovich_NP ,_, 1960_CD )_) ._. The_AT constant-temperature_NN contour_NNS are_BER much_QL smooth_JJR than_CS those_DTS observed_VBN at_IN 4.3_CD mm_NN by_IN Coates_NP (_( 1959_CD )_) and_CC apparently_RB the_AT emission_NN at_IN 8_CD mm_NN is_BEZ not_* nearly_RB so_QL sensitive_JJ to_IN difference_NNS in_IN surface_JJ feature_NNS ._. Such_JJ high-resolution_NN observation_NNS a_CS these_DTS are_BER needed_VBN at_IN several_AP wave_NN length_NNS in_IN order_NN that_CS the_AT radio_NN emission_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN can_MD be_BE properly_RB interpreted_VBN ._. The_AT observation_NNS of_IN Mayer_NP ,_, McCullough_NP ,_, and_CC Sloanaker_NP at_IN 3.15_CD cm_NN and_CC of_IN Sloanaker_NP at_IN 10.3_CD cm_NN have_HV not_* previously_RB been_BEN published_VBN and_CC will_MD be_BE briefly_RB described_VBN ._. Measurements_NNS at_IN 3.15_CD cm_NN were_BED obtained_VBN on_IN 11_CD day_NNS spread_VBN over_IN the_AT interval_NN May_NP 3_CD to_IN June_NP 19_CD ,_, 1956_CD ,_, using_VBG the_AT 50-foot_JJ reflector_NN at_IN the_AT U._NP S._NP Naval_JJ Research_NN Laboratory_NN in_IN Washington_NP ._. The_AT half-intensity_NN diameter_NN of_IN the_AT antenna_NN beam_NN wa_BEDZ about_RB 9'_NNS ,_, and_CC the_AT angle_NN subtended_VBN by_IN the_AT moon_NN included_VBD the_AT entire_JJ main_JJS beam_NN and_CC part_NN of_IN the_AT first_OD side_JJ lobe_NNS ._. The_AT antenna_NN pattern_NNS and_CC the_AT power_NN gain_NN at_IN the_AT peak_NN of_IN the_AT beam_NN were_BED both_ABX measured_VBN (_( Mayer_NP ,_, McCullough_NP ,_, and_CC Sloanaker_NP ,_, 1958_CD )_) ,_, so_CS that_CS the_AT absolute_JJ power_NN sensitivity_NN of_IN the_AT antenna_NN beam_NN over_IN the_AT solid_JJ angle_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN wa_BEDZ known_VBN ._. The_AT ratio_NN of_IN the_AT measured_VBN antenna_NN temperature_NN change_NN during_IN a_AT drift_NN scan_NN across_IN the_AT moon_NN to_IN the_AT average_JJ brightness_NN temperature_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN over_IN the_AT antenna_NN beam_NN (_( assuming_VBG that_CS the_AT brightness_NN temperature_NN of_IN the_AT sky_NN is_BEZ negligible_JJ )_) wa_BEDZ found_VBN ,_, by_IN graphical_JJ integration_NN of_IN the_AT antenna_NN directivity_NN diagram_NN ,_, to_TO be_BE 0.85_CD ._. The_AT measured_VBN brightness_NN temperature_NN is_BEZ a_AT good_JJ approximation_NN to_IN the_AT brightness_NN temperature_NN at_IN the_AT center_NN of_IN the_AT lunar_JJ disk_NN because_RB of_IN the_AT narrow_JJ antenna_NN beam_NN and_CC because_CS the_AT temperature_NN distribution_NN over_IN the_AT central_JJ portion_NN of_IN the_AT moon's_NN$ disk_NN is_BEZ nearly_QL uniform_JJ ._. The_AT result_NN of_IN the_AT observation_NNS is_BEZ Af_NN where_WRB the_AT phase_NN angle_NN ,_, Q_NP ,_, is_BEZ measured_VBN in_IN degree_NNS from_IN new_JJ moon_NN and_CC the_AT probable_JJ error_NNS include_VB absolute_JJ a_QL well_RB a_CS relative_JJ error_NNS ._. This_DT result_NN is_BEZ plotted_VBN along_RB with_IN the_AT 8.6-mm_NN observation_NNS of_IN Gibson_NP (_( 1958_CD )_) in_IN figure_NN 1_CD ,_, A_NP ._. The_AT variation_NN in_IN the_AT 3-cm_NN emission_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN during_IN a_AT lunation_NN is_BEZ very_QL much_QL le_AP than_CS the_AT variation_NN in_IN the_AT 8.6-mm_NN emission_NN ,_, a_CS would_MD be_BE expected_VBN from_IN the_AT explanation_NN of_IN Piddington_NP and_CC Minnett_NP (_( 1949_CD )_) ._. In_IN the_AT discussion_NN which_WDT follows_VBZ ,_, the_AT time_NN average_NN of_IN the_AT radio_NN emission_NN will_MD be_BE referred_VBN to_IN a_CS the_AT constant_JJ component_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT superimposed_VBN periodic_JJ variation_NN will_MD be_BE called_VBN the_AT variable_JJ component_NN ._. The_AT 10.3-cm_NN observation_NN of_IN Sloanaker_NP wa_BEDZ made_VBN on_IN May_NP 20_CD ,_, 1958_CD ,_, using_VBG the_AT 84-foot_NN reflector_NN at_IN the_AT Maryland_NP Point_NN Observatory_NN of_IN the_AT U._NP S._NP Naval_JJ Research_NN Laboratory_NN ._. The_AT age_NN of_IN the_AT moon_NN wa_BEDZ about_RB 2_CD day_NNS ._. The_AT half-intensity_NN diameter_NN of_IN the_AT main_JJS lobe_NN of_IN the_AT antenna_NN wa_BEDZ about_RB 18'.5_NNS ,_, and_CC the_AT brightness_NN temperature_NN wa_BEDZ reduced_VBN by_IN assuming_VBG a_AT Gaussian_JJ shape_NN for_IN the_AT antenna_NN beam_NN and_CC a_AT uniformly_RB bright_JJ disk_NN for_IN the_AT moon_NN ._. Abstract_JJ Experiments_NNS were_BED made_VBN on_IN an_AT electric_JJ arc_NN applying_VBG a_AT porous_JJ graphite_NN anode_NN cooled_VBN by_IN a_AT transpiring_VBG gas_NN (_( Argon_NN )_) ._. Thus_RB ,_, the_AT energy_NN transferred_VBN from_IN the_AT arc_NN to_IN the_AT anode_NN wa_BEDZ partly_RB fed_VBN back_RB into_IN the_AT arc_NN ._. It_PPS wa_BEDZ shown_VBN that_CS by_IN proper_JJ anode_NN design_NN the_AT net_JJ energy_NN loss_NN of_IN the_AT arc_NN to_IN the_AT anode_NN could_MD be_BE reduced_VBN to_IN approximately_RB 15%_NN of_IN the_AT total_JJ arc_NN energy_NN ._. A_AT detailed_VBN energy_NN balance_NN of_IN the_AT anode_NN wa_BEDZ established_VBN ._. The_AT anode_NN ablation_NN could_MD be_BE reduced_VBN to_IN a_AT negligible_JJ amount_NN ._. The_AT dependence_NN of_IN the_AT arc_NN voltage_NN upon_IN the_AT mass_NN flow_NN velocity_NN of_IN the_AT transpirating_VBG gas_NN wa_BEDZ investigated_VBN for_IN various_JJ arc_NN length_NNS and_CC current_NNS between_IN 100_CD Amp_NN and_CC 200_CD Aj_NN ._. Qualitative_JJ observation_NNS were_BED made_VBN and_CC high-speed_NN motion_NN picture_NNS were_BED taken_VBN to_TO study_VB flow_NN phenomenon_NNS in_IN the_AT arc_NN at_IN various_JJ mass_NN flow_NN velocity_NNS ._. Introduction_NN The_AT high_JJ heat_NN flux_NNS existing_VBG at_IN the_AT electrode_NN surface_NNS of_IN electric_JJ arc_NNS necessitate_VB extensive_JJ cooling_NN to_TO prevent_VB electrode_NN ablation_NN ._. The_AT cooling_VBG requirement_NNS are_BER particularly_QL severe_JJ at_IN the_AT anode_NN ._. In_IN free-burning_JJ electric_JJ arc_NNS ,_, for_IN instance_NN ,_, approximately_RB 90%_NN of_IN the_AT total_JJ arc_NN power_NN is_BEZ transferred_VBN to_IN the_AT anode_NN giving_VBG rise_NN to_IN local_JJ heat_NN flux_NNS in_IN excess_NN of_IN Af_NN a_CS measured_VBN by_IN the_AT author_NNS --_-- the_AT exact_JJ value_NN depending_VBG on_IN the_AT arc_NN atmosphere_NN ._. In_IN plasma_NN generator_NNS a_CS currently_RB commercially_RB available_JJ for_IN industrial_JJ use_NN or_CC a_CS high_JJ temperature_NN research_NN tool_NNS often_RB more_AP than_IN 50%_NN of_IN the_AT total_JJ energy_NN input_NN is_BEZ being_BEG transferred_VBN to_IN the_AT cooling_VBG medium_NN of_IN the_AT anode_NN ._. The_AT high_JJR heat_NN transfer_NN rate_NNS at_IN the_AT anode_NN compared_VBN with_IN those_DTS at_IN the_AT cathode_NN can_MD be_BE explained_VBN by_IN the_AT physical_JJ phenomenon_NNS occurring_VBG in_IN free_RB burning_VBG arc_NNS ._. In_IN plasma_NN generator_NNS the_AT superimposed_VBN forced_VBN convection_NN may_MD modify_VB the_AT picture_NN somewhat_RB ._. The_AT heat_NN transfer_NN to_IN the_AT anode_NN is_BEZ due_JJ to_IN the_AT following_VBG effect_NNS :_: 1_CD ._. Heat_NN of_IN condensation_NN (_( work_NN function_NN )_) plus_CC kinetic_JJ energy_NN of_IN the_AT electron_NNS impinging_VBG on_IN the_AT anode_NN ._. This_DT energy_NN transfer_NN depends_VBZ on_IN the_AT current_NN ,_, the_AT temperature_NN in_IN the_AT arc_NN column_NN ,_, the_AT anode_NN material_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT condition_NNS in_IN the_AT anode_NN sheath_NN ._. 2_CD ._. Heat_NN transfer_NN by_IN molecular_JJ conduction_NN a_QL well_RB a_CS by_IN radiation_NN from_IN the_AT arc_NN column_NN ._. The_AT heat_NN transfer_NN to_IN the_AT anode_NN in_IN free_RB burning_VBG arc_NNS is_BEZ enhanced_VBN by_IN a_AT hot_JJ gas_NN jet_NN flowing_VBG from_IN the_AT cathode_NN towards_IN the_AT anode_NN with_IN velocity_NNS up_RP Af_NN ._. This_DT phenomenon_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN experimentally_RB investigated_VBN in_IN detail_NN by_IN Maecker_NP (_( Ref._NP 1_CD )_) ._. The_AT pressure_NN gradient_NN producing_VBG the_AT jet_NN is_BEZ due_JJ to_IN the_AT nature_NN of_IN the_AT magnetic_JJ field_NN in_IN the_AT arc_NN (_( rapid_JJ decrease_NN of_IN current_NN density_NN from_IN cathode_NN to_IN the_AT anode_NN )_) ._. Hence_RB ,_, the_AT flow_NN condition_NNS at_IN the_AT anode_NN of_IN free_RB burning_VBG arc_NNS resemble_VB those_DTS near_IN a_AT stagnation_NN point_NN ._. It_PPS is_BEZ apparent_JJ from_IN the_AT above_JJ and_CC from_IN experimental_JJ evidence_NN that_CS the_AT cooling_VBG requirement_NNS for_IN the_AT anode_NN of_IN free_RB burning_VBG arc_NNS are_BER large_JJ compared_VBN with_IN those_DTS for_IN the_AT cathode_NN ._. The_AT gas_NN flow_NN through_IN a_AT plasma_NN generator_NN will_MD modify_VB these_DTS condition_NNS ;_. ;_. however_RB ,_, the_AT anode_NN is_BEZ still_RB the_AT part_NN receiving_VBG the_AT large_JJT heat_NN flux_NN ._. An_AT attempt_NN to_TO improve_VB the_AT life_NN of_IN the_AT anode_NNS or_CC the_AT efficiency_NN of_IN the_AT plasma_NN generator_NNS must_MD ,_, therefore_RB ,_, aim_VB at_IN a_AT reduction_NN of_IN the_AT anode_NN loss_NN ._. The_AT following_VBG possibility_NNS exist_VB for_IN achieving_VBG this_DT :_: 1_CD ._. The_AT use_NN of_IN high_JJ voltage_NNS and_CC low_JJ current_NNS by_IN proper_JJ design_NN to_TO reduce_VB electron_NN heat_NN transfer_NN to_IN the_AT anode_NN for_IN a_AT given_VBN power_NN output_NN ._. 2_CD ._. Continuous_JJ motion_NN of_IN the_AT arc_NN contact_NN area_NN at_IN the_AT anode_NN by_IN flow_NN or_CC magnetic_JJ force_NNS ._. 3_CD ._. Feedback_NN of_IN the_AT energy_NN transferred_VBN to_IN the_AT anode_NN by_IN applying_VBG gas_NN transpiration_NN through_IN the_AT anode_NN ._. The_AT third_OD method_NN wa_BEDZ ,_, to_IN our_PP$ knowledge_NN ,_, successfully_RB applied_VBN for_IN the_AT first_OD time_NN by_IN C._NP Sheer_NP and_CC co-worker_NNS (_( Ref._NN 2_CD )_) ._. The_AT purpose_NN of_IN the_AT present_JJ study_NN is_BEZ to_TO study_VB the_AT thermal_JJ condition_NNS and_CC to_TO establish_VB an_AT energy_NN balance_NN for_IN a_AT transpiration_NN cooled_VBN anode_NN a_QL well_RB a_CS the_AT effect_NN of_IN blowing_VBG on_IN the_AT arc_NN voltage_NN ._. Gas_NN injection_NN through_IN a_AT porous_JJ anode_NN (_( transpiration_NN cooling_NN )_) not_* only_RB feed_VBZ back_RB the_AT energy_NN transferred_VBN to_IN the_AT anode_NN by_IN the_AT above_RB mentioned_VBN process_NNS ,_, but_CC also_RB modifies_VBZ the_AT condition_NNS in_IN the_AT arc_NN itself_PPL ._. A_AT detailed_VBN study_NN of_IN this_DT latter_AP phenomenon_NN wa_BEDZ not_* attempted_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN ._. Argon_NN wa_BEDZ used_VBN a_CS a_AT blowing_VBG gas_NN to_TO exclude_VB any_DTI effect_NNS of_IN dissociation_NN or_CC chemical_NN reaction_NN ._. The_AT anode_NN material_NN wa_BEDZ porous_JJ graphite_NN ._. Sintered_VBN porous_JJ metal_NNS should_MD be_BE usable_JJ in_IN principle_NN ._. However_RB ,_, technical_JJ difficulty_NNS arise_VB by_IN melting_VBG at_IN local_JJ hot_JJ spot_NNS ._. The_AT experimental_JJ arrangement_NN a_CS described_VBN below_RB is_BEZ based_VBN on_IN the_AT geometry_NN of_IN free_RB burning_VBG arc_NNS ._. Thus_RB ,_, direct_JJ comparison_NNS can_MD be_BE drawn_VBN with_IN free_RB burning_VBG arc_NNS which_WDT have_HV been_BEN studied_VBN in_IN detail_NN during_IN the_AT past_AP year_NNS and_CC decade_NNS by_IN numerous_JJ investigator_NNS (_( Ref._NN 3_CD )_) ._. Experimental_JJ apparatus_NN Figures_NNS 1_CD to_IN 3_CD show_VB photographic_JJ and_CC schematic_JJ view_NNS of_IN the_AT test_NN stand_NN and_CC of_IN two_CD different_JJ model_NNS of_IN the_AT anode_NN holder_NN ._. The_AT cathode_NN consisted_VBD of_IN a_AT 1/4''_NN ''_'' diameter_NN thoriated_VBN tungsten_NN rod_NN attached_VBN to_IN a_AT water_NN cooled_VBN copper_NN tube_NN ._. This_DT tube_NN could_MD be_BE adjusted_VBN in_IN it_PP$ axial_JJ direction_NN by_IN an_AT electric_JJ drive_NN to_TO establish_VB the_AT required_VBN electrode_NN spacing_NN ._. The_AT anode_NN in_IN figure_NN 2_CD wa_BEDZ mounted_VBN by_IN mean_NN of_IN the_AT anode_NN holder_NN which_WDT wa_BEDZ attached_VBN to_IN a_AT steel_NN plug_NN and_CC disk_NN ._. The_AT transpiring_VBG gas_NN ejected_VBN from_IN the_AT anode_NN formed_VBD a_AT jet_NN directed_VBN axially_RB towards_IN the_AT cathode_NN below_RB ._. Inflow_NN of_IN air_NN from_IN the_AT surrounding_VBG atmosphere_NN wa_BEDZ prevented_VBN by_IN the_AT two_CD disk_NNS shown_VBN in_IN figure_NN 2_CD ._. Argon_NN wa_BEDZ also_RB blown_VBN at_IN low_JJ velocity_NNS (_( mass_NN flow_NN rate_NN Af_NN )_) through_IN a_AT tube_NN coaxial_JJ with_IN the_AT cathode_NN a_CS an_AT additional_JJ precaution_NN against_IN contamination_NN of_IN the_AT arc_NN by_IN air_NN ._. The_AT anode_NN consisted_VBD of_IN a_AT 1/2_CD inch_NN diameter_NN porous_JJ graphite_NN plug_NN ,_, 1/4_CD inch_NN long_JJ ._. The_AT graphite_NN wa_BEDZ National_JJ Carbon_NN NC_NN 60_CD ,_, which_WDT ha_HVZ a_AT porosity_NN of_IN 50%_NN and_CC an_AT average_JJ pore_NN size_NN of_IN 30_CD ._. This_DT small_JJ pore_NN size_NN wa_BEDZ required_VBN to_TO ensure_VB uniformity_NN of_IN the_AT flow_NN leaving_VBG the_AT anode_NN ._. The_AT anode_NN plug_NN (_( Figure_NN 2_CD )_) wa_BEDZ inserted_VBN into_IN a_AT carbon_NN anode_NN holder_NN ._. A_AT shielded_VBN thermocouple_NN wa_BEDZ used_VBN to_TO measure_VB the_AT upstream_JJ temperature_NN of_IN the_AT transpiring_VBG gas_NN ._. It_PPS wa_BEDZ exposed_VBN to_IN a_AT high_JJ velocity_NN gas_NN jet_NN ._. A_AT plug_NN and_CC a_AT tube_NN with_IN hole_NNS in_IN it_PP$ cylindrical_JJ wall_NNS divided_VBD the_AT chamber_NN above_IN the_AT porous_JJ plug_NN into_IN two_CD part_NNS ._. This_DT arrangement_NN had_HVD the_AT purpose_NN to_TO prevent_VB heated_VBN gas_NN to_TO reach_VB the_AT thermocouple_NN by_IN natural_JJ convection_NN ._. Two_CD pyrometer_NNS shown_VBN in_IN figure_NN 1_CD and_CC 2_CD (_( Pyrometer_NN Instrument_NN Co._NN Model_NN 95_CD )_) served_VBD for_IN simultaneous_JJ measurement_NN of_IN the_AT anode_NN surface_NN temperature_NN and_CC the_AT temperature_NN distribution_NN along_IN the_AT anode_NN holder_NN ._. Three_CD thermocouple_NNS were_BED placed_VBN at_IN different_JJ location_NNS in_IN the_AT aluminum_NN disk_NN surrounding_VBG the_AT anode_NN holder_NN to_TO determine_VB it_PP$ temperature_NN ._. Another_DT anode_NN holder_NN used_VBN in_IN the_AT experiment_NNS is_BEZ shown_VBN in_IN figure_NN 3_CD ._. In_IN this_DT design_NN the_AT anode_NN holder_NN is_BEZ water_NN cooled_VBN and_CC the_AT heat_NN loss_NNS by_IN conduction_NN from_IN the_AT anode_NN were_BED determined_VBN by_IN measuring_VBG the_AT temperature_NN rise_NN of_IN the_AT coolant_NN ._. To_TO reduce_VB heat_NN transfer_NN from_IN the_AT hot_JJ gas_NN to_IN this_DT anode_NN holder_NN outside_IN the_AT regime_NN of_IN the_AT arc_NN ,_, a_AT carbon_NN shield_NN wa_BEDZ attached_VBN to_IN the_AT surface_NN providing_VBG an_AT air_NN gap_NN of_IN 1/16_CD inch_NN between_IN the_AT plate_NN and_CC the_AT surface_NN of_IN the_AT anode_NN holder_NN ._. In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_AT inner_JJ surface_NN of_IN the_AT carbon_NN shield_NN wa_BEDZ covered_VBN with_IN aluminum_NN foil_NN to_TO reduce_VB radiation_NN ._. Temperatures_NNS of_IN the_AT shield_NN and_CC of_IN the_AT surface_NN of_IN the_AT water-cooled_JJ anode_NN holder_NN were_BED measured_VBN by_IN thermocouple_NNS to_TO account_VB for_IN heat_NN received_VBN by_IN the_AT coolant_NN but_CC not_* originating_VBG from_IN the_AT anode_NN plug_NN ._. The_AT argon_NN flow_NN from_IN commercial_JJ bottle_NNS wa_BEDZ regulated_VBN by_IN a_AT pressure_NN regulator_NN and_CC measured_VBN with_IN a_AT gas_NN flow_NN rator_NN ._. The_AT power_NN source_NN wa_BEDZ a_AT commercial_JJ D._NP C._NP rectifier_NN ._. At_IN 100_CD Amp_NN the_AT 360_CD cycle_NN ripple_NN wa_BEDZ le_AP than_IN 0.5_CD V_NN (_( peak_NN to_IN peak_NN )_) with_IN a_AT resistive_JJ load_NN ._. The_AT current_NN wa_BEDZ regulated_VBN by_IN mean_NN of_IN a_AT variable_JJ resistor_NN and_CC measured_VBN with_IN a_AT 50_CD mV_NN shunt_NN and_CC millivoltmeter_NN ._. The_AT arc_NN voltage_NN wa_BEDZ measured_VBN with_IN a_AT voltmeter_NN whose_WP$ terminal_NNS were_BED connected_VBN to_IN the_AT anode_NN and_CC cathode_NN holder_NNS ._. Because_RB of_IN the_AT falling_VBG characteristic_NN of_IN the_AT rectifier_NN ,_, no_AT ballast_NN resistor_NN wa_BEDZ required_VBN for_IN stability_NN of_IN operation_NN ._. A_AT high_JJ frequency_NN starter_NN wa_BEDZ used_VBN to_TO start_VB the_AT arc_NN ._. Experimental_JJ procedure_NN and_CC error_NN analysis_NN 1_CD ._. Transpiration_NN cooled_VBN anode_NN with_IN carbon_NN anode_NN holder_NN The_AT anode_NN holder_NN shown_VBN in_IN figure_NN 2_CD wa_BEDZ designed_VBN with_IN two_CD goal_NNS in_IN mind_NN ._. The_AT heat_NN loss_NNS of_IN the_AT holder_NN were_BED to_TO be_BE reduced_VBN a_QL far_RB a_CS possible_JJ and_CC they_PPSS should_MD be_BE such_JJ that_CS an_AT accurate_JJ heat_NN balance_NN can_MD be_BE made_VBN ._. In_IN order_NN to_TO reduce_VB the_AT number_NN of_IN variable_JJ parameter_NNS ,_, all_ABN experiment_NNS were_BED made_VBN with_IN a_AT constant_JJ arc_NN length_NN of_IN 0.5''_NNS ''_'' and_CC a_AT current_NN of_IN 100_CD Aj_NN ._. The_AT argon_NN flow_NN through_IN the_AT porous_JJ anode_NN wa_BEDZ varied_VBN systematically_RB between_IN Af_NN and_CC Af_NN ._. The_AT low_JJR limit_NN wa_BEDZ determined_VBN by_IN the_AT fact_NN that_CS for_IN small_JJR flow_NN rate_NNS the_AT arc_NN started_VBD to_TO strike_VB to_IN the_AT anode_NN holder_NN instead_RB of_IN to_IN the_AT porous_JJ graphite_NN plug_NN and_CC that_CS it_PPS became_VBD highly_QL unstable_JJ ._. The_AT upper_JJ limit_NN wa_BEDZ determined_VBN by_IN the_AT difficulty_NN of_IN measuring_VBG the_AT characteristic_JJ anode_NN surface_NN temperature_NN (_( see_VB below_RB )_) since_CS only_RB a_AT small_JJ region_NN of_IN the_AT anode_NN wa_BEDZ struck_VBN by_IN the_AT arc_NN ._. This_DT region_NN which_WDT had_HVD a_AT high_JJR temperature_NN than_CS the_AT rest_NN of_IN the_AT anode_NN surface_NN changed_VBD size_NN and_CC location_NN continuously_RB ._. For_IN each_DT mass_NN flow_NN rate_NN the_AT arc_NN voltage_NN wa_BEDZ measured_VBN ._. To_TO measure_VB the_AT surface_NN temperature_NN of_IN the_AT anode_NN plug_NN ,_, the_AT surface_NN wa_BEDZ scanned_VBN with_IN a_AT pyrometer_NN ._. As_CS it_PPS turned_VBD out_RP ,_, a_AT very_QL hot_JJ region_NN occurred_VBD on_IN the_AT plug_NN ._. Its_PP$ temperature_NN wa_BEDZ denoted_VBN by_IN Af_NN ._. The_AT size_NN of_IN this_DT hot_JJ region_NN wa_BEDZ estimated_VBN by_IN eye_NN ._. The_AT rest_NN of_IN the_AT surface_NN had_HVD a_AT temperature_NN which_WDT decreased_VBD towards_IN the_AT out_JJ diameter_NN of_IN the_AT plug_NN ._. The_AT mean_JJ temperature_NN of_IN this_DT region_NN wa_BEDZ approximated_VBN by_IN the_AT temperature_NN measured_VBN halfways_RB between_IN the_AT edge_NN of_IN the_AT hot_JJ spot_NN and_CC the_AT rim_NN of_IN the_AT plug_NN ._. It_PPS wa_BEDZ denoted_VBN by_IN Af_NN ._. The_AT mean_JJ temperature_NN of_IN the_AT surface_NN wa_BEDZ then_RB computed_VBN according_IN to_IN the_AT following_VBG relation_NN :_: Af_NN where_WRB x_NN is_BEZ the_AT fraction_NN of_IN the_AT plug_NN area_NN covered_VBN by_IN the_AT hot_JJ spot_NN ._. A_AT back_JJ pressure_NN wa_BEDZ then_RB introduced_VBN ,_, and_CC the_AT rise_NN or_CC fall_NN of_IN the_AT material_NN in_IN the_AT manometer_NN indicated_VBD which_WDT wa_BEDZ great_JJR ,_, the_AT normal_JJ pressure_NN in_IN the_AT block_NN or_CC the_AT back_JJ pressure_NN ._.
