The_AT maximum_JJ suction_NN wa_BEDZ 3.25''_NNS ''_'' of_IN test_NN fluid_NN measured_VBN from_IN the_AT top_NN of_IN the_AT block_NN ,_, and_CC steady_JJ state_NNS were_BED apparently_RB reached_VBN with_IN these_DTS fluid_NNS ._. It_PPS is_BEZ presumed_VBN that_CS this_DT negative_JJ head_NN wa_BEDZ associated_VBN with_IN some_DTI geometric_JJ factor_NN of_IN the_AT assembly_NN ,_, since_CS different_JJ reading_NNS were_BED obtained_VBN with_IN the_AT same_AP fluid_NN and_CC the_AT only_AP apparent_JJ difference_NN wa_BEDZ the_AT assembly_NN and_CC disassembly_NN of_IN the_AT apparatus_NN ._. This_DT negative_JJ pressure_NN is_BEZ not_* explained_VBN by_IN the_AT velocity_NN head_NN Af_NN since_CS this_DT is_BEZ not_* sufficient_JJ to_TO explain_VB the_AT reading_NNS by_IN several_AP magnitude_NNS ._. These_DTS experiment_NNS can_MD be_BE considered_VBN exploratory_JJ only_RB ._. However_RB ,_, they_PPSS do_DO demonstrate_VB the_AT presence_NN of_IN large_JJ normal_JJ pressure_NNS in_IN the_AT presence_NN of_IN flat_JJ shear_NN field_NNS which_WDT were_BED forecast_VBN by_IN the_AT theory_NN in_IN the_AT first_OD part_NN of_IN the_AT paper_NN ._. They_PPSS also_RB give_VB information_NN which_WDT will_MD aid_VB in_IN the_AT design_NN of_IN a_AT more_QL satisfactory_JJ instrument_NN for_IN the_AT measurement_NN of_IN the_AT normal_JJ pressure_NNS ._. Such_ABL an_AT instrument_NN would_MD be_BE useful_JJ for_IN the_AT characterization_NN of_IN many_AP commercial_JJ material_NNS a_QL well_RB a_CS theoretical_JJ study_NNS ._. The_AT elasticity_NN is_BEZ a_AT parameter_NN of_IN fluid_NNS which_WDT is_BEZ not_* subject_JJ to_IN simple_JJ measurement_NN at_IN present_NN ,_, and_CC it_PPS is_BEZ a_AT parameter_NN which_WDT is_BEZ probably_RB varying_VBG in_IN an_AT unknown_JJ manner_NN with_IN many_AP commercial_JJ material_NNS ._. Such_ABL an_AT instrument_NN is_BEZ expected_VBN to_TO be_BE especially_QL useful_JJ if_CS it_PPS could_MD be_BE used_VBN to_TO measure_VB the_AT elasticity_NN of_IN heavy_JJ paste_NNS such_JJ a_CS printing_VBG ink_NNS ,_, paint_NNS ,_, adhesive_NNS ,_, molten_JJ plastic_NNS ,_, and_CC bread_NN dough_NN ,_, for_CS the_AT elasticity_NN is_BEZ related_VBN to_IN those_DTS various_JJ property_NNS termed_VBN ``_`` length_NN ''_'' ,_, ``_`` shortness_NN ''_'' ,_, ``_`` spinnability_NN ''_'' ,_, etc._RB ,_, which_WDT are_BER usually_RB judged_VBN by_IN subjective_JJ method_NNS at_IN present_NN ._. The_AT actual_JJ change_NN Af_NN caused_VBN by_IN a_AT shear_NN field_NN is_BEZ calculated_VBN by_IN multiplying_VBG the_AT pressure_NN differential_NN time_IN the_AT volume_NN ,_, just_RB a_CS it_PPS is_BEZ for_IN any_DTI gravitational_JJ or_CC osmotic_JJ pressure_NN head_NN ._. If_CS the_AT volume_NN is_BEZ the_AT molal_JJ volume_NN ,_, then_RB Af_NN is_BEZ obtained_VBN on_IN a_AT molal_JJ basis_NN which_WDT is_BEZ the_AT customary_JJ terminology_NN of_IN the_AT chemist_NNS ._. Although_CS the_AT Af_NN calculation_NN is_BEZ obvious_JJ by_IN analogy_NN with_IN that_DT for_IN gravitational_JJ field_NN and_CC osmotic_JJ pressure_NN ,_, it_PPS is_BEZ interesting_JJ to_TO confirm_VB it_PPO by_IN a_AT method_NN which_WDT can_MD be_BE generalized_VBN to_TO include_VB related_VBN effect_NNS ._. Consider_VB a_AT shear_NN field_NN with_IN a_AT height_NN of_IN H_NN and_CC a_AT cross-sectional_JJ area_NN of_IN A_NN opposed_VBN by_IN a_AT manometer_NN with_IN a_AT height_NN of_IN H_NP (_( referred_VBN to_IN the_AT same_AP base_NN a_CS H_NN )_) and_CC a_AT cross-sectional_JJ area_NN of_IN A_NP ._. If_CS Af_NN is_BEZ the_AT change_NN per_IN unit_NN volume_NN in_IN Gibbs_NP function_NN caused_VBN by_IN the_AT shear_NN field_NN at_IN constant_JJ P_NN and_CC T_NN ,_, and_CC **yr_NN is_BEZ the_AT density_NN of_IN the_AT fluid_NN ,_, then_RB the_AT total_JJ potential_JJ energy_NN of_IN the_AT system_NN above_IN the_AT reference_NN height_NN is_BEZ Af_NN ._. Af_NN is_BEZ the_AT work_NN necessary_JJ to_TO fill_VB the_AT manometer_NN column_NN from_IN the_AT reference_NN height_NN to_IN H_NP ._. The_AT total_JJ volume_NN of_IN the_AT system_NN above_IN the_AT reference_NN height_NN is_BEZ Af_NN ,_, and_CC H_NP can_MD be_BE eliminated_VBN to_TO obtain_VB an_AT equation_NN for_IN the_AT total_JJ potential_JJ energy_NN of_IN the_AT system_NN in_IN term_NNS of_IN H_NN ._. The_AT minimum_JJ total_JJ potential_JJ energy_NN is_BEZ found_VBN by_IN taking_VBG the_AT derivative_NN with_IN respect_NN to_IN H_NN and_CC equating_VBG to_IN zero_NN ._. This_DT give_VBZ Af_NN ,_, which_WDT is_BEZ the_AT pressure_NN ._. This_DT is_BEZ interesting_JJ for_CS it_PPS combine_VBZ both_ABX the_AT thermodynamic_JJ concept_NN of_IN a_AT minimum_JJ Gibbs_NP function_NN for_IN equilibrium_NN and_CC minimum_JJ mechanical_JJ potential_JJ energy_NN for_IN equilibrium_NN ._. This_DT method_NN can_MD be_BE extended_VBN to_TO include_VB the_AT concentration_NN difference_NNS caused_VBN by_IN shear_NN field_NNS ._. The_AT relation_NN between_IN osmotic_JJ pressure_NN and_CC the_AT Gibbs_NP function_NN may_MD also_RB be_BE developed_VBN in_IN an_AT analogous_JJ way_NN ._. In_IN the_AT above_JJ development_NN we_PPSS have_HV applied_VBN the_AT thermodynamics_NN of_IN equilibrium_NN (_( referred_VBN to_IN by_IN some_DTI a_CS thermostatics_NN )_) to_IN the_AT steady_JJ state_NN ._. This_DT can_MD be_BE justified_VBN thermodynamically_RB in_IN this_DT case_NN ,_, and_CC this_DT will_MD be_BE done_VBN in_IN a_AT separate_JJ paper_NN which_WDT is_BEZ being_BEG prepared_VBN ._. This_DT ha_HVZ an_AT interesting_JJ analogy_NN with_IN the_AT assumption_NN stated_VBN by_IN Philippoff_NP that_CS ``_`` the_AT deformational_JJ mechanic_NN of_IN elastic_JJ solid_NNS can_MD be_BE applied_VBN to_IN flowing_VBG solution_NNS ''_'' ._. There_EX is_BEZ one_CD exception_NN to_IN the_AT above_JJ statement_NN a_CS ha_HVZ been_BEN pointed_VBN out_RP ,_, and_CC that_DT is_BEZ that_CS fluid_NNS can_MD relax_VB by_IN flowing_VBG into_IN field_NNS of_IN low_JJR rate_NNS of_IN shear_NN ,_, so_RB the_AT statement_NN should_MD be_BE modified_VBN by_IN stating_VBG that_CS the_AT mechanic_NNS are_BER similar_JJ ._. If_CS the_AT mechanic_NNS are_BER similar_JJ ,_, we_PPSS can_MD also_RB infer_VB that_CS the_AT thermodynamics_NN will_MD also_RB be_BE similar_JJ ._. The_AT concept_NN of_IN the_AT strain_NN energy_NN a_CS a_AT Gibbs_NP function_NN difference_NN Af_NN and_CC exerting_VBG a_AT force_NN normal_RB to_IN the_AT shearing_VBG face_NN is_BEZ compatible_JJ with_IN the_AT information_NN obtained_VBN from_IN optical_JJ birefringence_NN study_NNS of_IN fluid_NNS undergoing_VBG shear_NN ._. Essentially_RB these_DTS birefringence_NN study_NNS show_VB that_CS at_IN low_JJ rate_NNS of_IN shear_NN a_AT tension_NN is_BEZ present_JJ at_IN 45-degrees_NNS to_IN the_AT direction_NN of_IN shear_NN ,_, and_CC a_CS the_AT rate_NN of_IN shear_NN increase_VBZ ,_, the_AT direction_NN of_IN the_AT maximum_JJ tension_NN move_VBZ asymptotically_RB toward_IN the_AT direction_NN of_IN shear_NN ._. According_IN to_IN Philippoff_NP ,_, the_AT recoverable_JJ shear_NN S_NP is_BEZ given_VBN by_IN Af_NN where_WRB **yc_NN is_BEZ the_AT angle_NN of_IN extinction_NN ._. From_IN this_DT and_CC the_AT force_NN of_IN deformation_NN it_PPS should_MD be_BE possible_JJ to_TO calculate_VB the_AT elastic_JJ energy_NN of_IN deformation_NN which_WDT should_MD be_BE equal_JJ to_IN the_AT Af_NN calculated_VBN from_IN the_AT pressure_NN normal_RB to_IN the_AT shearing_VBG face_NN ._. There_EX is_BEZ another_DT mean_NN which_WDT should_MD show_VB the_AT direction_NN and_CC relative_JJ value_NN of_IN the_AT stress_NNS in_IN viscoelastic_JJ fluid_NNS that_WPS is_BEZ not_* mentioned_VBN a_CS such_JJ in_IN the_AT literature_NN ,_, and_CC that_DT is_BEZ the_AT shape_NN of_IN the_AT suspended_VBN drop_NNS of_IN low_JJ viscosity_NN fluid_NNS in_IN shear_NN field_NNS ._. These_DTS droplet_NNS are_BER distorted_VBN by_IN the_AT normal_JJ force_NNS just_RB a_CS a_AT balloon_NN would_MD be_BE pulled_VBN or_CC pressed_VBN out_RP of_IN shape_NN in_IN one's_PN$ hand_NNS ._. These_DTS droplet_NNS appear_VB to_TO be_BE ellipsoid_NNS ,_, and_CC it_PPS is_BEZ mathematically_RB convenient_JJ to_TO assume_VB that_CS they_PPSS are_BER ._. If_CS they_PPSS are_BER not_* ellipsoid_NNS ,_, the_AT conclusion_NNS will_MD be_BE a_AT reasonable_JJ approximation_NN ._. The_AT direction_NN of_IN the_AT tension_NN of_IN minimum_NN pressure_NN is_BEZ ,_, of_IN course_NN ,_, given_VBN by_IN the_AT direction_NN of_IN the_AT major_JJ axis_NN of_IN the_AT ellipsoid_NNS ._. Mason_NP and_CC Taylor_NP both_ABX show_VB that_CS the_AT major_JJ axis_NN of_IN the_AT ellipsoid_NNS is_BEZ at_IN 45-degrees_NNS at_IN low_JJ rate_NNS of_IN shear_NN and_CC that_CS it_PPS approach_VBZ the_AT direction_NN of_IN shear_NN with_IN increased_VBN rate_NNS of_IN shear_NN ._. (_( Some_DTI suspension_NNS break_VB up_RP before_CS they_PPSS are_BER near_IN to_IN the_AT direction_NN of_IN shear_NN ,_, and_CC some_DTI become_VB asymptotic_JJ to_IN it_PPO without_IN breakup_NN ._. )_) This_DT is_BEZ ,_, of_IN course_NN ,_, a_AT similar_JJ type_NN of_IN behavior_NN to_IN that_DT indicated_VBN by_IN birefringence_NN study_NNS ._. The_AT relative_JJ force_NNS can_MD be_BE calculated_VBN from_IN the_AT various_JJ radius_NNS of_IN curvature_NN if_CS we_PPSS assume_VB :_: (_( A_NP )_) The_AT surface_JJ tension_NN is_BEZ uniform_JJ on_IN the_AT surface_NN of_IN the_AT drop_NN ._. (_( B_NP )_) That_CS because_RB of_IN the_AT low_JJ viscosity_NN of_IN the_AT fluid_NN ,_, the_AT internal_JJ pressure_NN is_BEZ the_AT same_AP in_IN all_ABN direction_NNS ._. (_( C_NP )_) The_AT kinetic_JJ effect_NNS are_BER negligible_JJ ._. (_( D_NP )_) Since_CS the_AT shape_NN of_IN the_AT drop_NN conforms_VBZ to_IN the_AT force_NN field_NN ,_, it_PPS doe_DOZ not_* appreciably_RB affect_VB the_AT distribution_NN of_IN force_NNS in_IN the_AT fluid_NN ._. These_DTS are_BER reasonable_JJ assumption_NNS with_IN low_JJ viscosity_NN fluid_NNS suspended_VBN in_IN high_JJ viscosity_NN fluid_NNS which_WDT are_BER subjected_VBN to_IN low_JJ rate_NNS of_IN shear_NN ._. Just_RB a_CS the_AT pressure_NN exerted_VBN by_IN surface_JJ tension_NN in_IN a_AT spherical_JJ drop_NN is_BEZ Af_NN and_CC the_AT pressure_NN exerted_VBN by_IN surface_JJ tension_NN on_IN a_AT cylindrical_JJ shape_NN is_BEZ Af_NN ,_, the_AT pressure_NN exerted_VBN by_IN any_DTI curved_VBN surface_NN is_BEZ Af_NN ,_, where_WRB **yg_NN is_BEZ the_AT interfacial_JJ tension_NN and_CC Af_NN and_CC Af_NN are_BER the_AT two_CD radius_NNS of_IN curvature_NN ._. This_DT formula_NN is_BEZ given_VBN by_IN Rumscheidt_NP and_CC Mason_NP ._. If_CS A_NP is_BEZ the_AT major_JJ axis_NN of_IN an_AT ellipsoid_NN and_CC B_NP and_CC C_NP are_BER the_AT other_AP two_CD ax_NNS ,_, the_AT radius_NN of_IN curvature_NN in_IN the_AT ab_NN plane_NN at_IN the_AT end_NN of_IN the_AT axis_NN Af_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT difference_NN in_IN pressure_NN along_IN the_AT A_NP and_CC B_NP ax_NNS is_BEZ Af_NN ._. There_EX are_BER no_AT data_NN published_VBN in_IN the_AT literature_NN on_IN the_AT shape_NN of_IN low_JJ viscosity_NN drop_NNS to_TO confirm_VB the_AT above_JJ formula_NNS ._. However_RB ,_, there_EX are_BER photograph_NNS of_IN suspended_VBN drop_NNS of_IN cyclohexanol_NN phthalate_NN (_( viscosity_NN 155_CD poise_NNS )_) suspended_VBN in_IN corn_NN syrup_NN of_IN 71_CD poise_NNS in_IN a_AT paper_NN by_IN Mason_NP and_CC Bartok_NP ._. This_DT viscosity_NN of_IN the_AT material_NN in_IN the_AT drop_NNS is_BEZ ,_, of_IN course_NN ,_, not_* negligible_JJ ._. Measurements_NNS on_IN the_AT photograph_NN in_IN this_DT paper_NN give_VB Af_NN at_IN the_AT maximum_JJ rate_NN of_IN shear_NN of_IN Af_NN ._. If_CS it_PPS is_BEZ assumed_VBN that_CS the_AT formula_NN given_VBN by_IN Lodge_NP of_IN cosec_NN Af_NIL applies_VBZ ,_, the_AT pressure_NN difference_NN along_IN the_AT major_JJ ax_NNS can_MD be_BE calculated_VBN from_IN the_AT angle_NN of_IN inclination_NN of_IN the_AT major_JJ axis_NN ,_, and_CC from_IN this_DT the_AT interfacial_JJ tension_NN can_MD be_BE calculated_VBN ._. Its_PP$ value_NN wa_BEDZ Af_NN from_IN the_AT above_JJ data_NN ._. This_DT appears_VBZ to_TO be_BE high_JJ ,_, a_CS would_MD be_BE expected_VBN from_IN the_AT appreciable_JJ viscosity_NN of_IN the_AT material_NN in_IN the_AT drop_NNS ._. It_PPS is_BEZ appropriate_JJ to_TO call_VB attention_NN to_IN certain_JJ thermodynamic_JJ property_NNS of_IN an_AT ideal_JJ gas_NN that_WPS are_BER analogous_JJ to_IN rubber-like_JJ deformation_NN ._. The_AT internal_JJ energy_NN of_IN an_AT ideal_JJ gas_NN depends_VBZ on_IN temperature_NN only_RB and_CC is_BEZ independent_JJ of_IN pressure_NN or_CC volume_NN ._. In_IN other_AP word_NNS ,_, if_CS an_AT ideal_JJ gas_NN is_BEZ compressed_VBN and_CC kept_VBN at_IN constant_JJ temperature_NN ,_, the_AT work_NN done_VBN in_IN compressing_VBG it_PPO is_BEZ completely_RB converted_VBN into_IN heat_NN and_CC transferred_VBN to_IN the_AT surrounding_VBG heat_NN sink_NN ._. This_DT mean_VBZ that_CS work_NN equal_VBZ Q_NP which_WDT in_IN turn_NN equal_VBZ Af_NN ._. This_DT is_BEZ known_VBN a_CS conformational_JJ entropy_NN ._. This_DT conformational_NN entropy_NN is_BEZ ,_, in_IN this_DT case_NN ,_, equal_JJ to_IN the_AT usual_JJ entropy_NN ,_, for_CS there_EX are_BER no_AT other_AP change_NNS or_CC other_AP energy_NNS involved_VBN ._. Note_VB that_CS though_CS the_AT ideal_JJ gas_NN itself_PPL contains_VBZ no_AT additional_JJ energy_NN ,_, the_AT compressed_VBN gas_NN doe_DOZ exert_VB an_AT increased_VBN pressure_NN ._. A_AT proton_NN magnetic_JJ resonance_NN study_NN of_IN polycrystalline_JJ Af_NN a_CS a_AT function_NN of_IN magnetic_JJ field_NN and_CC temperature_NN is_BEZ presented_VBN ._. Af_NN is_BEZ paramagnetic_JJ ,_, and_CC electron_NN paramagnetic_JJ dipole_JJ a_QL well_RB a_CS nuclear_JJ dipole_JJ effect_NNS lead_VB to_IN line_NN broadening_NN ._. An_AT isotropic_JJ resonance_NN shift_NN of_IN Af_NN to_TO low_JJR applied_VBN field_VBZ indicates_VBZ a_AT weak_JJ isotropic_JJ hyperfine_JJ contact_NN interaction_NN ._. The_AT experimental_JJ second_OD moment_NN Af_NN conforms_VBZ to_IN the_AT relation_NN Af_NN in_IN agreement_NN with_IN theory_NN ._. Hence_RB ,_, the_AT electron_NN paramagnetic_JJ effect_NNS (_( slope_NN )_) can_MD be_BE separated_VBN from_IN the_AT nuclear_JJ effect_NNS (_( intercept_NN )_) ._. The_AT paramagnetic_JJ dipole_JJ effect_NNS provide_VB some_DTI information_NN on_IN the_AT particle_NN shape_NNS ._. Af_NN bond_NN in_IN Af_NN Theoretical_JJ study_NNS of_IN the_AT hydrogen_NN bond_NN generally_RB agree_VB that_CS the_AT Af_NN bond_NN will_MD be_BE linear_JJ in_IN the_AT absence_NN of_IN peculiarity_NNS of_IN packing_VBG in_IN the_AT solid_NN ._. There_EX is_BEZ ample_JJ evidence_NN from_IN many_AP source_NNS that_CS the_AT Af_NN bond_NN in_IN Af_NN is_BEZ symmetric_JJ ._. The_AT Af_NN distance_NN in_IN Af_NN is_BEZ 2.26_CD Aj_NN ._. (_( 3_CD )_) hydrogen_NN atom_NNS are_BER asymmetrically_RB placed_VBN ,_, either_CC randomly_RB or_CC in_IN an_AT ordered_VBN way_NN ,_, so_CS that_CS some_DTI hydrogen_NN atom_NNS are_BER closer_RBR to_IN the_AT upper_JJR oxygen_NN atom_NNS while_CS others_NNS are_BER closer_RBR to_IN the_AT low_JJR oxygen_NN atom_NNS ._. The_AT market_NN today_NR for_IN detergent_NN builder_NNS is_BEZ quite_QL diverse_JJ ._. The_AT best_RBT known_VBN field_NN of_IN application_NN for_IN builder_NNS is_BEZ in_IN heavy-duty_NN ,_, spray-dried_JJ detergent_NN formulation_NNS for_IN household_NN use_NN ._. These_DTS widely_RB advertised_VBN product_NNS ,_, which_WDT are_BER used_VBN primarily_RB for_IN washing_VBG clothes_NNS ,_, are_BER based_VBN on_IN high-sudsing_JJ ,_, synthetic_JJ organic_JJ active_NNS (_( sodium_NN alkylbenzenesulfonate_NNS )_) and_CC contain_VB up_RP to_IN 50%_NN by_IN weight_NN of_IN sodium_NN tripolyphosphate_NN or_CC a_AT mixture_NN of_IN sodium_NN tripolyphosphate_NN and_CC tetrasodium_NN pyrophosphate_NN ._. Hard-surface_JJ cleaning_NN in_IN household_NN application_NN is_BEZ represented_VBN by_IN two_CD class_NNS of_IN alkaline_JJ product_NNS :_: (_( 1_CD )_) the_AT formulation_NNS made_VBN expressly_RB for_IN machine_NN dishwasher_NNS ,_, and_CC (_( 2_CD )_) the_AT general-purpose_JJ cleaner_NNS used_VBN for_IN wall_NNS and_CC woodwork_NN ._. The_AT cleaning_VBG process_NN Cleaning_VBG or_CC detergent_NN action_NN is_BEZ entirely_RB a_AT matter_NN of_IN surface_NNS ._. Wet_JJ cleaning_NN involves_VBZ an_AT aqueous_JJ medium_NN ,_, a_AT solid_JJ substrate_NN ,_, soil_NN to_TO be_BE removed_VBN ,_, and_CC the_AT detergent_NN or_CC surface-active_JJ material_NN ._. An_AT oversimplified_VBN differentiation_NN between_IN soft-_JJ and_CC hard-surface_JJ cleaning_NN lie_VBZ in_IN the_AT magnitude_NN and_CC kind_NN of_IN surface_NN involved_VBN ._. One_CD gram_NN of_IN cotton_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN found_VBN to_TO have_HV a_AT specific_JJ surface_NN area_NN of_IN Af_NN ._. In_IN contrast_NN ,_, a_AT metal_NN coupon_NN Af_NN in_IN size_NN would_MD have_HV a_AT magnitude_NN from_IN 100,000_CD to_IN a_AT million_CD le_AP ._. Even_RB here_RB there_EX is_BEZ room_NN for_IN some_DTI variation_NN ,_, for_CS metal_NN surface_NNS vary_VB in_IN smoothness_NN ,_, absorptive_JJ capacity_NN ,_, and_CC chemical_JJ reactivity_NN ._. Spring_NP used_VBD a_AT Brush_NP surface-analyzer_NN in_IN a_AT metal-cleaning_JJ study_NN and_CC showed_VBD considerable_JJ difference_NNS in_IN soil_NN removal_NN ,_, depending_IN upon_IN surface_NN roughness_NN ._. There_EX are_BER considerable_JJ difference_NNS between_IN the_AT requirement_NNS for_IN textile_JJ and_CC hard-surface_JJ cleaning_NN ._. Exclusive_JJ of_IN esthetic_JJ value_NNS ,_, such_JJ a_CS high-_JJ or_CC low-foam_NN level_NN ,_, perfume_NN content_NN ,_, etc._RB ,_, the_AT requirement_NNS for_IN the_AT organic_JJ active_JJ used_VBN in_IN washing_VBG textile_NNS are_BER high_JJ ._. No_AT matter_NN how_WRB they_PPSS are_BER formulated_VBN ,_, a_AT large_JJ number_NN of_IN organic_JJ active_NNS are_BER simply_RB not_* suitable_JJ for_IN this_DT application_NN ,_, since_CS they_PPSS do_DO not_* give_VB adequate_JJ soil_NN removal_NN ._. This_DT is_BEZ best_RBT demonstrated_VBN by_IN practical_JJ washing_VBG test_NNS in_IN which_WDT cloth_NN article_NNS are_BER repeatedly_RB washed_VBN with_IN the_AT same_AP detergent_NN formulation_NN ._. A_AT good_JJ formulation_NN will_MD keep_VB the_AT clothes_NNS clean_VB and_CC white_JJ after_IN many_AP washing_NNS ;_. ;_. whereas_CS ,_, with_IN a_AT poor_JJ formulation_NN ,_, the_AT clothes_NNS exhibit_VB a_AT build-up_NN of_IN ``_`` tattle-tale_NN grey_NN ''_'' and_CC dirty_JJ spot_NNS --_-- sometimes_RB with_IN bad_JJ result_NNS even_RB after_IN the_AT first_OD wash_NN ._. Since_CS practical_JJ washing_VBG procedure_NNS are_BER both_ABX lengthy_JJ and_CC expensive_JJ ,_, a_AT number_NN of_IN laboratory_NN test_NNS have_HV been_BEN developed_VBN for_IN the_AT numerical_JJ evaluation_NN of_IN detergent_NNS ._. Harris_NP ha_HVZ indicated_VBN that_CS two_CD device_NNS ,_, the_AT Launder-Ometer_NP and_CC Terg-O-Tometer_NP are_BER most_RBT widely_RB used_VBN for_IN rapid_JJ detergent_NN testing_NN ,_, and_CC he_PPS ha_HVZ listed_VBN the_AT commercially_RB available_JJ standard_JJ soiled_VBN fabric_NNS ._. Also_RB given_VBN are_BER several_AP laboratory_NN wash_NN procedure_NNS in_IN general_JJ use_NN ._. The_AT soiled_VBN fabric_NNS used_VBN for_IN rapid_JJ testing_NN of_IN detergent_NN formulation_NNS are_BER made_VBN in_IN such_ABL a_AT way_NN that_CS only_AP part_NN of_IN the_AT soil_NN is_BEZ removed_VBN by_IN even_RB the_AT best_JJT detergent_NN formulation_NN in_IN a_AT single_AP wash_NN ._. In_IN this_DT way_NN ,_, numerical_JJ value_NNS for_IN the_AT relative_JJ efficacy_NN of_IN various_JJ detergent_NN formulation_NNS can_MD be_BE obtained_VBN by_IN measuring_VBG the_AT reflectance_NN (_( whiteness_NN )_) of_IN the_AT cloth_NN swatch_NNS before_IN and_CC after_IN washing_VBG ._. Soil_NN redeposition_NN is_BEZ evaluated_VBN by_IN washing_VBG clean_JJ swatch_NNS with_IN the_AT dirty_JJ one_NNS ._. The_AT problem_NNS of_IN hard-surface_JJ cleaning_VBG are_BER not_* nearly_RB a_CS complex_JJ ._. In_IN hard-surface_JJ cleaning_NN ,_, the_AT inorganic_JJ salt_NNS are_BER more_QL important_JJ than_CS the_AT organic_JJ active_NN ._. Indeed_RB ,_, when_WRB the_AT proper_JJ inorganic_JJ constituent_NNS are_BER employed_VBN ,_, practically_RB any_DTI wetting_VBG or_CC surface-active_JJ agent_NN will_MD do_DO a_AT reasonably_QL good_JJ job_NN when_WRB present_RB in_IN sufficient_JJ amount_NN in_IN a_AT hard-surface_JJ cleaning_NN formulation_NN ._. Hydroxides_NNS ,_, orthophosphate_NNS ,_, borate_NNS ,_, carbonate_NNS ,_, and_CC silicate_NNS are_BER important_JJ inorganic_JJ ingredient_NNS of_IN hard-surface_JJ cleaner_NNS ._. In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_AT polyphosphate_NNS are_BER also_RB used_VBN ,_, probably_RB acting_VBG more_RBR a_CS peptizing_VBG agent_NNS than_CS anything_PN else_RB ._. The_AT importance_NN of_IN the_AT inorganic_JJ constituent_NNS in_IN hard-surface_JJ cleaning_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN emphasized_VBN in_IN a_AT number_NN of_IN paper_NNS ._. Physical_JJ chemistry_NN of_IN washing_VBG Although_CS there_EX is_BEZ no_AT question_NN but_IN that_CS the_AT process_NN of_IN washing_VBG fabric_NNS involves_VBZ a_AT number_NN of_IN phenomenon_NNS which_WDT are_BER related_VBN together_RB in_IN an_AT extremely_QL complicated_VBN way_NN and_CC that_CS these_DTS phenomenon_NNS and_CC their_PP$ interrelation_NNS are_BER not_* well_RB understood_VBN at_IN the_AT present_NN ,_, this_DT section_NN attempt_VBZ to_TO present_VB briefly_RB an_AT up-to-date_JJ picture_NN of_IN the_AT physical_JJ chemistry_NN of_IN washing_VBG either_CC fabric_NNS or_CC hard_JJ surface_NNS ._. The_AT purpose_NN of_IN washing_VBG is_BEZ ,_, obviously_RB ,_, to_TO remove_VB soil_NNS which_WDT are_BER arbitrarily_RB classed_VBN in_IN the_AT four_CD major_JJ category_NNS given_VBN below_RB :_: 1_CD ._. Dirt_NN ,_, which_WDT is_BEZ here_RB defined_VBN a_CS particulate_JJ material_NN which_WDT is_BEZ usually_RB inorganic_JJ and_CC is_BEZ very_QL often_RB extremely_QL finely_RB divided_VBN so_CS a_CS to_TO exhibit_VB colloidal_JJ property_NNS ._. 2_CD ._. Greasy_JJ soil_NNS ,_, which_WDT are_BER typified_VBN by_IN hydrocarbon_NNS and_CC fat_NNS (_( ester_NNS of_IN glycerol_NN with_IN long-chain_NN organic_JJ acid_NNS )_) ._. 3_CD ._. Stains_NNS ,_, which_WDT include_VB the_AT wide_JJ variety_NN of_IN nonparticulate_JJ material_NNS which_WDT give_VB color_NN even_RB when_WRB present_RB in_IN very_QL low_JJ concentration_NN on_IN the_AT soiled_VBN object_NN ._. 4_CD ._. Miscellaneous_JJ soil_NNS ,_, which_WDT primarily_RB include_VB sticky_JJ substance_NNS and_CC colorless_JJ liquid_NNS which_WDT evaporate_VB to_TO leave_VB a_AT residue_NN ._. The_AT dirt_NN on_IN the_AT soiled_VBN object_NNS is_BEZ mechanically_RB held_VBN by_IN surface_NN irregularity_NNS to_IN some_DTI extent_NN ._. However_RB ,_, a_AT major_JJ factor_NN in_IN binding_VBG dirt_NN is_BEZ the_AT attraction_NN between_IN surface_NNS that_WPS go_VBZ under_IN the_AT name_NN of_IN Van_NP der_NP Waal's_NP$ force_NNS ._. This_DT is_BEZ a_AT theoretically_RB complicated_VBN dipole_JJ interaction_NN which_WDT cause_VBZ any_DTI extremely_QL small_JJ uncharged_JJ particle_NN to_TO agglomerate_VB with_IN other_AP small_JJ uncharged_JJ particle_NNS ,_, or_CC to_TO stick_VB to_IN an_AT uncharged_JJ surface_NN ._. Obviously_RB ,_, if_CS colloidal_JJ particle_NNS bear_VB charge_NNS of_IN opposite_JJ sign_NN or_CC ,_, if_CS one_CD kind_NN is_BEZ charged_VBN and_CC the_AT other_AP kind_NN is_BEZ not_* ,_, the_AT attraction_NN will_MD be_BE intensified_VBN and_CC the_AT tendency_NN to_TO agglomerate_VB will_MD be_BE greatly_RB reinforced_VBN ._. Likewise_RB ,_, a_AT charged_VBN particle_NN will_MD tend_VB to_TO stick_VB to_IN an_AT uncharged_JJ surface_NN and_CC vice_RB versa_RB ,_, and_CC a_AT charged_VBN particle_NN will_MD be_BE very_QL strongly_RB attracted_VBN to_IN a_AT surface_NN exhibiting_VBG an_AT opposite_JJ charge_NN ._. In_IN addition_NN ,_, dirt_NN particle_NNS can_MD be_BE held_VBN onto_IN a_AT soiled_VBN surface_NN by_IN sticky_JJ substance_NNS or_CC by_IN the_AT surface_NN tension_NN of_IN liquid_NNS ,_, including_IN liquid_NN grease_NNS ._. Greases_NNS ,_, stain_NNS ,_, and_CC miscellaneous_JJ soil_NNS are_BER usually_RB sorbed_VBN onto_IN the_AT soiled_VBN surface_NN ._. In_IN most_AP case_NNS ,_, these_DTS soil_NNS are_BER taken_VBN up_RP a_CS liquid_NNS through_IN capillary_NN action_NN ._. In_IN an_AT essentially_RB static_JJ system_NN ,_, an_AT oil_NN cannot_MD* be_BE replaced_VBN by_IN water_NN on_IN a_AT surface_NN unless_CS the_AT interfacial_JJ tension_NNS of_IN the_AT water_NN phase_NN are_BER reduced_VBN by_IN a_AT surface-active_JJ agent_NN ._. The_AT washing_VBG process_NN whereby_WRB soil_NNS are_BER removed_VBN consists_VBZ basically_RB of_IN applying_VBG mechanical_JJ action_NN to_TO loosen_VB the_AT dirt_NN particle_NNS and_CC dried_VBN matter_NN in_IN the_AT presence_NN of_IN water_NN which_WDT help_VBZ to_TO float_VB off_RP the_AT debris_NN and_CC act_VBZ ,_, to_IN some_DTI extent_NN ,_, a_CS a_AT dissolving_VBG and_CC solvating_VBG agent_NN ._. Greasy_JJ soil_NNS are_BER hardly_RB removed_VBN by_IN washing_VBG in_IN plain_JJ water_NN ;_. ;_. and_CC natural_JJ water_NNS ,_, in_IN addition_NN ,_, often_RB contain_VB impurity_NNS such_JJ a_CS calcium_NN salt_NNS which_WDT can_MD react_VB with_IN soil_NNS to_TO make_VB them_PPO more_QL difficult_JJ to_TO remove_VB ._. Therefore_RB ,_, detergent_NNS are_BER used_VBN ._. The_AT detergent_NN active_NN is_BEZ that_DT substance_NN which_WDT primarily_RB act_VBZ to_TO remove_VB greasy_JJ soil_NNS ._. The_AT other_AP constituent_NNS in_IN a_AT built_VBN detergent_NN assist_VB in_IN this_DT and_CC in_IN the_AT removal_NN of_IN dirty_JJ stain_NNS and_CC the_AT hydrophilic_JJ sticky_JJ or_CC dried_VBN soil_NNS ._. As_CS is_BEZ well_RB known_VBN ,_, detergent_NN active_NNS belong_VB to_IN the_AT chemical_NN class_NN consisting_VBG of_IN moderately_QL high_JJ molecular_JJ weight_NN and_CC highly_QL polar_JJ molecule_NNS which_WDT exhibit_VB the_AT property_NN of_IN forming_VBG micelle_NNS in_IN solution_NN ._. Physicochemical_JJ investigation_NNS of_IN anionic_JJ surfactant_NNS ,_, including_IN the_AT soap_NNS ,_, have_HV shown_VBN that_CS there_EX is_BEZ little_AP polymerization_NN or_CC agglomeration_NN of_IN the_AT chain_NN anion_NNS below_IN a_AT certain_JJ region_NN of_IN concentration_NN called_VBN the_AT critical_JJ micelle_NN concentration_NN ._. (_( 1_CD )_) Below_IN the_AT critical_JJ micelle_NN concentration_NN ,_, monomer_NNS and_CC some_DTI dimer_NNS are_BER present_JJ ._. (_( 2_CD )_) In_IN the_AT critical_JJ micelle_NN region_NN ,_, there_EX is_BEZ a_AT rapid_JJ agglomeration_NN or_CC polymerization_NN to_TO give_VB the_AT micelle_NNS ,_, which_WDT have_HV a_AT degree_NN of_IN polymerization_NN averaging_VBG around_RB 60_CD -_IN 80_CD ._. (_( 3_CD )_) For_IN anionic_NNS ,_, these_DTS micelle_NNS appear_VB to_TO be_BE roughly_RB spherical_JJ assemblage_NNS in_IN which_WDT the_AT hydrocarbon_NN tail_NNS come_VB together_RB so_CS that_CS the_AT polar_JJ group_NNS (_( the_AT ionized_VBN end_NNS )_) face_VB outward_RB towards_IN the_AT aqueous_JJ continuous_JJ phase_NN ._. Obviously_RB hydrophobic_JJ (_( oleophilic_JJ )_) substance_NNS such_JJ a_CS grease_NNS ,_, oil_NNS ,_, or_CC particle_NNS having_HVG a_AT greasy_JJ or_CC oily_JJ surface_NN are_BER more_RBR at_IN home_NN in_IN the_AT center_NN of_IN a_AT micelle_NN than_CS in_IN the_AT aqueous_JJ phase_NN ._. Micelles_NNS can_MD imbibe_VB and_CC hold_VB a_AT considerable_JJ amount_NN of_IN oleophilic_JJ substance_NNS so_CS that_CS the_AT micelle_NN volume_NN may_MD be_BE increased_VBN a_QL much_AP a_CS approximately_RB two-fold_RB ._. Although_CS the_AT matter_NN ha_HVZ not_* been_BEN unequivocally_RB demonstrated_VBN ,_, the_AT available_JJ data_NNS show_VB that_CS micelle_NNS in_IN themselves_PPLS do_DO not_* contribute_VB significantly_RB to_IN the_AT detergency_NN process_NN ._. Related_VBN to_IN micelle_NN formation_NN is_BEZ the_AT technologically_RB important_JJ ability_NN of_IN detergent_NN active_NNS to_TO congregate_VB at_IN oil_NN -_IN water_NN interface_NNS in_IN such_ABL a_AT manner_NN that_CS the_AT polar_JJ (_( or_CC ionized_VBN )_) end_NN of_IN the_AT molecule_NN is_BEZ directed_VBN towards_IN the_AT aqueous_JJ phase_NN and_CC the_AT hydrocarbon_NN chain_NN towards_IN the_AT oily_JJ phase_NN ._. In_IN the_AT cleaning_VBG process_NN ,_, sorbed_VBN greasy_JJ soil_NNS become_VB coated_VBN in_IN this_DT manner_NN with_IN an_AT oriented_VBN film_NN of_IN surfactant_NN ._. Then_RB during_IN washing_VBG ,_, the_AT greasy_JJ soil_NN roll_VBZ back_RB at_IN the_AT edge_NNS so_CS that_CS emulsified_VBN droplet_NNS can_MD disengage_VB themselves_PPLS from_IN the_AT sorbed_VBN oil_NN mass_NN ,_, with_IN the_AT aid_NN of_IN mechanical_JJ action_NN ,_, and_CC enter_VB the_AT aqueous_JJ phase_NN ._. Obviously_RB ,_, a_AT substance_NN which_WDT is_BEZ permanently_RB or_CC temporarily_RB sorbed_VBN on_IN the_AT surface_NN in_IN place_NN of_IN the_AT soil_NN will_MD tend_VB to_TO accelerate_VB this_DT process_NN and_CC effectively_RB push_VB off_RP the_AT greasy_JJ soil_NN ._. Substances_NNS other_AP than_CS detergent_NN active_NNS also_RB tend_VB to_TO be_BE strongly_RB sorbed_VBN from_IN aqueous_JJ medium_NNS onto_IN surface_NNS of_IN other_AP contiguous_JJ condensed_VBN phase_NNS ._. This_DT is_BEZ particularly_QL true_JJ of_IN highly_QL charged_VBN ion_NNS ,_, especially_RB those_DTS ion_NNS which_WDT fall_VB into_IN the_AT class_NN of_IN polyelectrolyte_NNS ._. Whereas_CS the_AT usual_JJ organic_JJ surface-active_JJ agent_NN is_BEZ strongly_RB sorbed_VBN at_IN oil_NN -_IN water_NN interface_NNS ,_, the_AT highly_QL charged_VBN ion_NNS are_BER most_QL strongly_RB sorbed_VBN at_IN interface_NNS between_IN water_NN and_CC insoluble_JJ material_NNS exhibiting_VBG an_AT ionic_JJ structure_NN (_( see_VB Table_NN 26-2_CD on_IN p._NN 1678_CD )_) ._. Thus_RB ,_, for_IN aqueous_JJ medium_NNS ,_, we_PPSS can_MD think_VB of_IN the_AT idealized_VBN organic_JJ active_NN a_CS an_AT oleophilic_JJ or_CC hydrophobic_JJ surface-active_JJ agent_NN ,_, and_CC of_IN an_AT idealized_VBN builder_NN a_CS a_AT oleophobic_JJ or_CC hydrophilic_JJ surface-active_JJ agent_NN ._. From_IN the_AT equilibrium_NN sorption_NN data_NNS which_WDT are_BER available_JJ ,_, it_PPS seems_VBZ logical_JJ to_TO expect_VB that_CS polyphosphate_NN ion_NNS would_MD be_BE strongly_RB sorbed_VBN on_IN the_AT surface_NN of_IN the_AT dirt_NN (_( especially_RB clay_NN soil_NNS )_) so_CS a_CS to_TO give_VB it_PPO a_AT greatly_RB increased_VBN negative_JJ charge_NN ._. The_AT charged_VBN particle_NNS then_RB repel_VB each_DT other_AP and_CC are_BER also_RB repelled_VBN from_IN the_AT charged_VBN surface_NN ,_, which_WDT almost_QL invariably_RB bear_VBZ a_AT negative_JJ charge_NN under_IN washing_VBG condition_NNS ._. The_AT negatively_RB charged_VBN dirt_NN particle_NNS then_RB leave_VB the_AT surface_NN and_CC go_VB into_IN the_AT aqueous_JJ phase_NN ._. This_DT hypothesis_NN is_BEZ evolved_VBN in_IN analogy_NN to_IN the_AT demonstrated_VBN action_NN of_IN organic_JJ active_NNS in_IN detergency_NN ._. It_PPS doe_DOZ not_* consider_VB the_AT kinetic_JJ effect_NNS of_IN the_AT phosphate_NN builder_NNS on_IN sorption-desorption_NN phenomenon_NNS which_WDT will_MD be_BE discussed_VBN later_RBR (_( see_VB pp._NNS 1746_CD -_IN 1748_CD )_) ._. The_AT crude_JJ picture_NN of_IN the_AT detergency_NN process_NN thus_QL far_RB developed_VBN can_MD be_BE represented_VBN a_CS :_: Af_NN ._. The_AT influence_NN of_IN mechanical_JJ action_NN on_IN the_AT particle_NNS of_IN free_JJ soil_NN may_MD be_BE compared_VBN to_IN that_DT of_IN kinetic_JJ energy_NN on_IN a_AT molecular_JJ scale_NN ._. Freed_VBN soil_NN must_MD be_BE dispersed_VBN and_CC protected_VBN against_IN flocculation_NN ._. Cleaned_VBN cloth_NN must_MD be_BE protected_VBN against_IN the_AT redeposition_NN of_IN dispersed_VBN soil_NN ._. It_PPS is_BEZ evident_JJ that_CS the_AT requirement_NNS imposed_VBN by_IN these_DTS effect_NNS upon_IN any_DTI one_CD detergent_NN constituent_NN acting_VBG alone_RB are_BER severe_JJ ._. Upon_IN consideration_NN of_IN the_AT variety_NN of_IN soil_NNS and_CC fabric_NNS normally_RB encountered_VBN in_IN the_AT washing_VBG process_NN ,_, it_PPS is_BEZ little_AP wonder_NN that_CS the_AT use_NN of_IN a_AT number_NN of_IN detergent_NN constituent_NNS having_HVG ``_`` synergistic_JJ ''_'' property_NNS ha_HVZ gained_VBN widespread_JJ acceptance_NN ._. In_IN the_AT over-all_JJ process_NN ,_, it_PPS is_BEZ difficult_JJ to_TO assign_VB a_AT ``_`` pure_JJ ''_'' role_NN to_IN each_DT constituent_NN of_IN a_AT built-detergent_NN formulation_NN ;_. ;_. and_CC ,_, indeed_RB ,_, there_EX is_BEZ no_AT more_AP reason_NN to_TO separate_VB the_AT interrelated_VBN role_NNS of_IN the_AT active_NN ,_, builder_NN ,_, antiredeposition_NN agent_NN ,_, etc._RB than_CS there_EX is_BEZ to_TO assign_VB individual_JJ action_NNS to_IN each_DT of_IN the_AT numerous_JJ isomer_NNS making_VBG up_RP a_AT given_VBN commercial_JJ organic_JJ active_NN ._. The_AT thermal_JJ exchange_NN of_IN chlorine_NN between_IN Af_NN and_CC liquid_JJ Af_NN is_BEZ readily_RB measurable_JJ at_IN temperature_NNS in_IN the_AT range_NN of_IN 180-degrees_NNS and_CC above_RB ._. The_AT photochemical_JJ exchange_NN occurs_VBZ with_IN a_AT quantum_NN yield_NN of_IN the_AT order_NN of_IN unity_NN in_IN the_AT liquid_JJ phase_NN at_IN 65-degrees_NNS using_VBG light_NN absorbed_VBN only_RB by_IN the_AT Af_NN ._. In_IN the_AT gas_NN phase_NN ,_, with_IN Af_NN of_IN Af_NN and_CC Af_NN of_IN Af_NN ,_, quantum_NN yield_NNS of_IN the_AT order_NN of_IN Af_NN have_HV been_BEN observed_VBN at_IN 85-degrees_NNS ._. Despite_IN extensive_JJ attempt_NNS to_TO obtain_VB highly_QL pure_JJ reagent_NNS ,_, serious_JJ difficulty_NN wa_BEDZ experienced_VBN in_IN obtaining_VBG reproducible_JJ rate_NNS of_IN reaction_NN ._. It_PPS appears_VBZ possible_JJ to_TO set_VB a_AT low_JJR limit_NN of_IN about_RB Af_NN for_IN the_AT activation_NN energy_NN of_IN the_AT abstraction_NN of_IN a_AT chlorine_NN atom_NN from_IN a_AT carbon_NN tetrachloride_NN molecule_NN by_IN a_AT chlorine_NN atom_NN to_TO form_VB Af_NN radical_NN ._. The_AT rate_NN of_IN the_AT gas_NN phase_NN exchange_NN reaction_NN appears_VBZ to_TO be_BE proportional_JJ to_IN the_AT first_OD power_NN of_IN the_AT absorbed_VBN light_NN intensity_NN indicating_VBG that_CS the_AT radical_NN intermediate_NNS are_BER removed_VBN at_IN the_AT wall_NNS or_CC by_IN reaction_NN with_IN an_AT impurity_NN rather_RB than_IN by_IN bimolecular_JJ radical_NN combination_NN reaction_NNS ._. Introduction_NN Because_RB of_IN the_AT simplicity_NN of_IN the_AT molecule_NNS ,_, isotopic_JJ exchange_NN reaction_NNS between_IN elemental_JJ halogen_NNS and_CC the_AT corresponding_JJ carbon_NN tetrahalide_NNS would_MD appear_VB to_TO offer_VB particularly_QL fruitful_JJ possibility_NNS for_IN obtaining_VBG unambiguous_JJ basic_JJ kinetic_JJ data_NN ._. Experimental_JJ reagent_NNS ._. --_-- Matheson_NP high_JJT purity_NN tank_NN chlorine_NN wa_BEDZ passed_VBN through_IN a_AT tube_NN of_IN resublimed_VBN Af_NN into_IN an_AT evacuated_VBN Pyrex_NP system_NN where_WRB it_PPS wa_BEDZ condensed_VBN with_IN liquid_JJ air_NN ._. Results_NNS the_AT thermal_JJ reaction_NN ._. --_-- In_IN studying_VBG the_AT liquid_JJ phase_NN thermal_JJ reaction_NN ,_, some_RB 70_CD tube_NNS from_IN 12_CD different_JJ manifold_NN filling_NNS were_BED prepared_VBN and_CC analyzed_VBN ._. In_IN addition_NN to_IN the_AT method_NN described_VBN in_IN the_AT section_NN above_RB ,_, chlorine_NN and_CC radiochlorine_NN were_BED prepared_VBN by_IN the_AT electrolysis_NN of_IN a_AT Af_NN eutectic_NN on_IN the_AT vacuum_NN line_NN ,_, and_CC by_IN exchange_NN of_IN Af_NN with_IN molten_JJ Af_NN ._. No_AT correlation_NN between_IN these_DTS variable_NNS and_CC the_AT irreproducibility_NN of_IN the_AT result_NNS wa_BEDZ found_VBN ._. The_AT reaction_NN rate_NNS observed_VBN at_IN 200-degrees_NNS ranged_VBD from_IN Af_NN of_IN the_AT chlorine_NN exchanged_VBN per_IN hour_NN to_IN 0.7_CD exchanged_VBN per_IN hour_NN ._. No_AT detectable_JJ reaction_NN wa_BEDZ found_VBN at_IN room_NN temperature_NN for_IN reaction_NN mixture_NNS allowed_VBN to_TO stand_VB up_RP to_IN 5_CD hour_NNS ._. The_AT liquid_JJ phase_NN photochemical_JJ reaction_NN ._. The_AT liquid_JJ phase_NN photochemical_JJ exchange_NN between_IN chlorine_NN and_CC carbon_NN tetrachloride_NN wa_BEDZ more_QL reproducible_JJ than_CS the_AT thermal_JJ exchange_NN ,_, although_CS still_RB erratic_JJ ._. The_AT improvement_NN wa_BEDZ most_QL noticeable_JJ in_IN the_AT great_JJR consistency_NN among_IN reaction_NN cell_NNS prepared_VBN a_CS a_AT group_NN on_IN the_AT same_AP manifold_NN ._. Rather_QL large_JJ difference_NNS were_BED still_RB found_VBN between_IN reaction_NN cell_NNS from_IN different_JJ manifold_NN filling_NNS ._. Some_RB 80_CD reaction_NN tube_NNS from_IN 13_CD manifold_NN filling_NNS were_BED illuminated_VBN in_IN the_AT temperature_NN range_NN from_IN 40_CD to_IN 85-degrees_NNS in_IN a_AT further_JJR endeavor_NN to_TO determine_VB the_AT cause_NN of_IN the_AT irreproducibility_NN and_CC to_TO obtain_VB information_NN on_IN the_AT activation_NN energy_NN and_CC the_AT effect_NN of_IN light_NN intensity_NN ._. In_IN all_ABN case_NNS there_EX wa_BEDZ readily_RB measurable_JJ exchange_NN after_IN a_QL little_AP a_CS one_CD hour_NN of_IN illumination_NN ._. By_IN comparing_VBG reaction_NN cell_NNS sealed_VBN from_IN the_AT same_AP manifold_NN temperature_NN dependency_NN corresponding_VBG to_IN activation_NN energy_NNS ranging_VBG from_IN 11_CD to_IN 18_CD Af_NN wa_BEDZ observed_VBN while_CS dependence_NN on_IN the_AT first_OD power_NN of_IN the_AT light_NN intensity_NN seemed_VBD to_TO be_BE indicated_VBN in_IN most_AP case_NNS ._. It_PPS wa_BEDZ possible_JJ to_TO make_VB estimate_NNS of_IN the_AT quantum_NN yield_NN by_IN observing_VBG the_AT extent_NN of_IN reduction_NN of_IN a_AT uranyl_NN oxalate_NN actinometer_NN solution_NN illuminated_VBN for_IN a_AT known_VBN time_NN in_IN a_AT typical_JJ reaction_NN cell_NN and_CC making_VBG appropriate_JJ conversion_NNS based_VBN on_IN the_AT difference_NNS in_IN the_AT absorption_NN spectrum_NNS of_IN uranyl_NN oxalate_NN and_CC of_IN chlorine_NN ,_, and_CC considering_IN the_AT spectral_JJ distribution_NN of_IN the_AT light_NN source_NN ._. These_DTS estimate_NNS indicated_VBD that_CS the_AT quantum_NN yield_NN for_IN the_AT exchange_NN of_IN chlorine_NN with_IN liquid_JJ carbon_NN tetrachloride_NN at_IN 65-degrees_NNS is_BEZ of_IN the_AT order_NN of_IN magnitude_NN of_IN unity_NN ._. When_WRB typical_JJ reaction_NN cell_NNS to_IN which_WDT 0.3_CD of_IN an_AT atmosphere_NN of_IN oxygen_NN had_HVD been_BEN added_VBN were_BED illuminated_VBN ,_, chlorine_NN and_CC phosgene_NN were_BED produced_VBN ._. The_AT photochemical_JJ exchange_NN in_IN the_AT gas_NN phase_NN ._. --_-- Although_CS there_EX wa_BEDZ some_DTI variation_NN in_IN result_NNS which_WDT must_MD be_BE attributed_VBN either_CC to_IN trace_JJ impurity_NNS or_CC to_IN variation_NN in_IN wall_NN effect_NNS ,_, the_AT photochemical_JJ exchange_NN in_IN the_AT gas_NN phase_NN wa_BEDZ sufficiently_QL reproducible_JJ so_CS that_CS it_PPS seemed_VBD meaningful_JJ to_TO compare_VB the_AT reaction_NN rate_NNS in_IN different_JJ series_NNS of_IN reaction_NN tube_NNS for_IN the_AT purpose_NN of_IN obtaining_VBG information_NN on_IN the_AT effect_NN of_IN chlorine_NN concentration_NN and_CC of_IN carbon_NN tetrachloride_NN concentration_NN on_IN the_AT reaction_NN rate_NN ._. Data_NNS on_IN such_JJ comparison_NNS together_RB with_IN data_NNS on_IN the_AT effect_NN of_IN light_NN intensity_NN are_BER given_VBN in_IN Table_NN 1_CD ._. ,_, In_IN series_NN 1_CD ,_, the_AT relative_JJ light_NN intensity_NN wa_BEDZ varied_VBN by_IN varying_VBG the_AT distance_NN of_IN the_AT lamp_NN from_IN the_AT reaction_NN cell_NN over_IN the_AT range_NN from_IN 14.7_CD to_IN 29.2_CD cm._NNS ._. The_AT last_AP column_NN show_VBZ the_AT rate_NN of_IN exchange_NN that_WPS would_MD have_HV been_BEN observed_VBN at_IN a_AT relative_JJ intensity_NN of_IN 4_CD (_( 14.7_CD cm._NNS distance_NN )_) calculated_VBN on_IN the_AT assumption_NNS that_CS the_AT incident_JJ light_NN intensity_NN is_BEZ inversely_RB proportional_JJ to_IN the_AT square_NN of_IN the_AT distance_NN of_IN the_AT lamp_NN from_IN the_AT cell_NN and_CC that_CS the_AT rate_NN is_BEZ directly_RB proportional_JJ to_IN the_AT incident_JJ light_NN intensity_NN ._. Direct_JJ proportionality_NN of_IN the_AT rate_NN to_IN the_AT incident_JJ intensity_NN ha_HVZ also_RB been_BEN assumed_VBN in_IN obtaining_VBG the_AT value_NN in_IN the_AT last_AP column_NN for_IN the_AT fourth_OD sample_NN of_IN series_NN 2_CD ,_, where_WRB the_AT light_NN intensity_NN wa_BEDZ reduced_VBN by_IN use_NN of_IN a_AT screen_NN ._. The_AT Poynting-Robertson_NP effect_NN (_( Robertson_NP ,_, 1937_CD ;_. ;_. Wyatt_NP and_CC Whipple_NP ,_, 1950_CD )_) ,_, which_WDT is_BEZ a_AT retardation_NN of_IN the_AT orbital_JJ motion_NN of_IN particle_NNS by_IN the_AT relativistic_JJ aberration_NN of_IN the_AT repulsive_JJ force_NN of_IN the_AT impinging_VBG solar_JJ radiation_NN ,_, cause_VBZ the_AT dust_NN to_TO spiral_VB into_IN the_AT sun_NN in_IN time_NNS much_QL short_JJR than_CS the_AT age_NN of_IN the_AT Earth_NN ._. The_AT radial_JJ velocity_NN varies_VBZ inversely_RB a_CS the_AT particle_NN size_NN --_-- a_AT 1000-m-diameter_NN particle_NN near_IN the_AT orbit_NN of_IN Mars_NP would_MD reach_VB the_AT sun_NN in_IN about_RB 60_CD million_CD year_NNS ._. Whipple_NP (_( 1955_CD )_) extends_VBZ the_AT effect_NNS to_TO include_VB the_AT solar-corpuscular-radiation_NN pressure_NN ,_, which_WDT increase_VBZ both_ABX the_AT minimum_JJ particle_NN size_NN and_CC the_AT drag_NN ._. Further_RBR ,_, the_AT corpuscular_JJ radiation_NN ,_, i.e._RB ,_, the_AT solar-wind_NN proton_NNS ,_, must_MD sputter_VB away_RB the_AT surface_JJ atom_NNS of_IN the_AT dust_NN and_CC cause_VB a_AT slow_JJ diminution_NN in_IN size_NN ,_, with_IN a_AT resultant_JJ increase_NN in_IN both_ABX the_AT Poynting-Robertson_NP effect_NN and_CC the_AT ratio_NN of_IN the_AT repulsive_JJ force_NN to_IN the_AT gravitational_JJ force_NN ._. The_AT Poynting-Robertson_NP effect_NN cause_VBZ the_AT semi-major_JJ axis_NN of_IN orbit_NNS to_TO diminish_VB more_QL rapidly_RB than_CS the_AT semi-minor_JJ axis_NN ,_, with_IN a_AT consequent_JJ tendency_NN toward_IN circular_JJ orbit_NNS a_CS the_AT particle_NNS move_VB toward_IN the_AT sun_NN ._. Also_RB ,_, planetary_JJ gravitational_JJ attraction_NN increase_VBZ the_AT dust_NN concentration_NN near_IN the_AT plane_NN of_IN the_AT ecliptic_NN a_CS the_AT sun_NN is_BEZ approached_VBN ._. At_IN one_CD astronomical_JJ unit_NN from_IN the_AT sun_NN (_( the_AT Earth's_NN$ distance_NN )_) the_AT dust_NN orbit_NNS are_BER probably_RB nearly_QL circular_JJ ._. If_CS such_JJ is_BEZ the_AT case_NN ,_, the_AT particle_NNS within_IN a_AT distance_NN of_IN about_RB Af_NN of_IN the_AT Earth_NN will_MD have_HV ,_, relative_JJ to_IN the_AT Earth_NN ,_, a_AT kinetic_JJ energy_NN le_AP than_CS their_PP$ potential_JJ energy_NN and_CC they_PPSS will_MD be_BE captured_VBN into_IN orbit_NNS about_IN the_AT Earth_NN ._. De_NP Jager_NP (_( 1955_CD )_) ha_HVZ calculated_VBN the_AT time_NNS required_VBN for_IN these_DTS particle_NNS to_TO reach_VB the_AT atmosphere_NN under_IN the_AT influence_NN of_IN the_AT Poynting-Robertson_NP effect_NN ,_, which_WDT in_IN this_DT case_NN cause_VBZ the_AT orbit_NNS to_TO become_VB more_QL and_CC more_QL eccentric_JJ without_IN changing_VBG the_AT semi-major_JJ axis_NN ._. This_DT effect_NN can_MD give_VB rise_NN to_IN a_AT blanket_NN of_IN micrometeorite_NNS around_IN the_AT Earth_NN ._. Since_CS there_EX is_BEZ a_AT continual_JJ loss_NN of_IN micrometeoritic_JJ material_NN in_IN space_NN because_RB of_IN the_AT radiation_NN effect_NNS ,_, there_EX must_MD be_BE a_AT continual_JJ replenishment_NN :_: otherwise_RB ,_, micrometeorite_NNS would_MD have_HV disappeared_VBN from_IN interplanetary_JJ space_NN ._. There_EX are_BER several_AP possible_JJ source_NNS ._. According_IN to_IN Whipple_NP (_( 1955_CD )_) ,_, cometary_JJ debris_NN is_BEZ sufficient_JJ to_TO replenish_VB the_AT material_NN spiraling_VBG into_IN the_AT sun_NN ,_, maintaining_VBG a_AT fairly_QL steady_JJ state_NN ._. Asteroidal_JJ collision_NNS are_BER also_RB thought_VBN to_TO contribute_VB material_NN ._. It_PPS is_BEZ also_RB possible_JJ that_CS some_DTI of_IN the_AT dust_NN in_IN the_AT vicinity_NN of_IN the_AT Earth_NN originated_VBD from_IN meteoritic_JJ impact_NNS upon_IN the_AT moon_NN ._. 5.3_CD direct_JJ measurement_NNS of_IN micrometeorite_NN flux_NN One_PN cannot_MD* make_VB a_AT very_QL satisfactory_JJ guess_NN about_IN the_AT micrometeorite_NN flux_NN in_IN space_NN ._. Even_RB in_IN the_AT neighborhood_NN of_IN the_AT Earth_NN ,_, where_WRB information_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN obtained_VBN both_ABX directly_RB and_CC indirectly_RB ,_, the_AT derived_VBN flux_NN value_NNS vary_VB by_IN at_IN least_AP four_CD order_NNS of_IN magnitude_NN ._. This_DT large_JJ discrepancy_NN demonstrates_VBZ the_AT inadequacy_NNS of_IN the_AT experimental_JJ method_NNS and_CC the_AT lack_NN of_IN understanding_NN of_IN the_AT various_AP phenomenon_NNS involved_VBN ._. Beyond_IN a_AT few_AP million_CD kilometer_NNS from_IN the_AT Earth_NN ,_, but_CC still_RB in_IN the_AT region_NN of_IN the_AT Earth's_NN$ orbit_NN ,_, a_AT prediction_NN of_IN the_AT flux_NN of_IN dust_NN is_BEZ even_QL more_QL unreliable_JJ ._. At_IN great_JJR distance_NNS from_IN the_AT sun_NN ,_, the_AT situation_NN is_BEZ still_RB le_QL certain_JJ ._. There_EX are_BER several_AP source_NNS of_IN evidence_NN on_IN the_AT micrometeorite_NN environment_NN ._. Direct_JJ information_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN obtained_VBN from_IN rocket_NNS and_CC satellite_NNS equipped_VBN with_IN impact_NN sensor_NNS ._. In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_AT size_NN distribution_NN obtained_VBN from_IN visual_JJ and_CC radar_NN observation_NNS of_IN meteor_NNS may_MD be_BE extrapolated_VBN to_IN the_AT micrometeorite_NN domain_NN ._. From_IN the_AT brightness_NN of_IN the_AT F_NN component_NN of_IN the_AT solar_JJ corona_NN and_CC the_AT brightness_NN of_IN the_AT zodiacal_JJ light_NN ,_, an_AT estimate_NN of_IN the_AT particle_NN size_NNS ,_, concentration_NNS ,_, and_CC spatial_JJ distribution_NN can_MD be_BE derived_VBN for_IN region_NNS of_IN space_NN near_IN the_AT ecliptic_NN plane_NN ._. Another_DT important_JJ source_NN of_IN evidence_NN only_RB recently_RB receiving_VBG much_AP attention_NN is_BEZ the_AT analysis_NN of_IN atmospheric_JJ dust_NN for_IN a_AT meteoritic_JJ component_NN ._. The_AT core_NNS of_IN deep-sea_JJ sediment_NNS and_CC content_NN of_IN collector_NNS in_IN remote_JJ region_NNS are_BER valuable_JJ in_IN this_DT category_NN ._. The_AT data_NNS provide_VB a_AT measure_NN of_IN the_AT total_JJ mass_NN of_IN cosmic_JJ material_NN incident_JJ upon_IN the_AT Earth_NN ._. The_AT direct_JJ evidence_NN on_IN the_AT micrometeorite_NN environment_NN near_IN the_AT Earth_NN is_BEZ obtained_VBN from_IN piezoelectric_JJ sensor_NNS (_( essentially_RB microphone_NNS )_) and_CC from_IN wire_NN gage_NNS ;_. ;_. these_DTS instrument_NNS are_BER installed_VBN on_IN rocket_NNS ,_, satellite_NNS ,_, and_CC space_NN probe_NNS ._. Statistically_RB ,_, the_AT most_QL significant_JJ data_NNS have_HV been_BEN collected_VBN from_IN the_AT sensor_NNS on_IN 1958_CD Alpha_NP (_( Explorer_NN 1_CD )_) ,_, 1958_CD Delta_NP 2_CD (_( Sputnik_NN 3_CD )_) ,_, and_CC 1959_CD Eta_NP (_( Vanguard_NN 3_CD )_) ._. These_DTS vehicle_NNS ,_, with_IN large_JJ sensitive_JJ area_NNS ,_, have_HV collected_VBN data_NN for_IN long_JJ enough_QLP time_NNS to_TO give_VB reliable_JJ impact_NN rate_NNS for_IN the_AT period_NNS of_IN exposure_NN ._. Many_AP other_AP vehicle_NNS with_IN small_JJR sensitive-area_NN exposure-time_NN product_NNS contribute_VB some_DTI information_NN ._. The_AT impact_NN rate_NN on_IN 1958_CD Alpha_NP for_IN 153_CD event_NNS wa_BEDZ Af_NN for_IN particle_NNS of_IN mass_NN great_JJR than_CS Af_NN (_( Dubin_NP ,_, 1960_CD )_) ;_. ;_. this_DT mass_NN threshold_NN wa_BEDZ derived_VBN from_IN the_AT detector_NN calibration_NN and_CC an_AT assumed_VBN impact_NN velocity_NN of_IN Af_NN ._. The_AT data_NNS show_VB daily_JJ and_CC diurnal_JJ variation_NNS ._. Ninety_CD per_IN cent_NN of_IN the_AT 153_CD recorded_VBN impact_NNS occurred_VBD between_IN midnight_NN and_CC noon_NN ,_, and_CC from_IN day_NN to_IN day_NN the_AT variation_NN of_IN the_AT rate_NN wa_BEDZ a_QL much_AP a_CS an_AT order_NN of_IN magnitude_NN ._. One_PN may_MD conclude_VB that_CS most_AP of_IN the_AT detected_VBN micrometeoritic_JJ material_NN is_BEZ concentrated_VBN in_IN orbital_JJ stream_NNS which_WDT intersect_VB the_AT Earth's_NN$ orbit_NN ._. On_IN May_NP 15_CD ,_, a_AT very_QL large_JJ increase_NN occurred_VBD with_IN Af_NN of_IN mass_NN between_IN Af_NN and_CC Af_NN ;_. ;_. for_IN the_AT next_AP two_CD day_NNS ,_, the_AT impact_NN rate_NN wa_BEDZ Af_NN ;_. ;_. and_CC for_IN the_AT next_AP nine_CD day_NNS ,_, the_AT impact_NN rate_NN wa_BEDZ le_AP than_IN Af_NN (_( Nazarova_NP ,_, 1960_CD )_) ._. The_AT data_NNS for_IN the_AT first_OD day_NN indicate_VB a_AT meteor_NN stream_NN with_IN a_AT very_QL high_JJ concentration_NN of_IN particle_NNS and_CC may_MD have_HV led_VBN to_IN the_AT high_JJ estimate_NNS of_IN micrometeorite_NN flux_NN ._. The_AT day-to-day_JJ rate_NN varied_VBD by_IN le_AP than_CS a_AT factor_NN of_IN 4.5_CD ._. The_AT data_NNS have_HV not_* yet_RB been_BEN analyzed_VBN for_IN diurnal_JJ variation_NNS ._. Note_VB that_CS the_AT mass_NN threshold_NN is_BEZ four_CD time_NNS that_DT of_IN 1958_CD Alpha_NP and_CC that_CS the_AT flux_NN is_BEZ one_CD fifth_OD a_CS large_JJ ._. If_CS one_PN assumes_VBZ that_CS the_AT average_JJ flux_NN did_DOD not_* change_VB between_IN measurement_NNS ,_, a_AT mass-distribution_NN curve_NN is_BEZ obtained_VBN which_WDT relates_VBZ the_AT flux_NN of_IN particle_NNS large_JJR than_CS a_AT given_VBN radius_NN to_IN the_AT inverse_JJ 7/2_CD power_NN of_IN the_AT radius_NN ._. Space_NN probe_NNS have_HV yielded_VBN little_AP information_NN ._. Pioneer_NN 1_CD ,_, recorded_VBD a_AT decrease_NN in_IN flux_NN with_IN distance_NN from_IN the_AT Earth_NN on_IN the_AT basis_NN of_IN 11_CD count_NNS in_IN 9_CD hour_NNS ._. With_IN detector_NNS sensitive_JJ to_IN three_CD mass_NN interval_NNS and_CC based_VBN on_IN a_AT few_AP count_NNS ,_, the_AT second_OD and_CC third_OD Russian_JJ space_NN probe_NNS indicate_VB that_CS the_AT flux_NN of_IN the_AT small_JJT particle_NNS detected_VBN is_BEZ le_AP than_CS that_DT of_IN large_JJR one_NNS ._. Being_BEG based_VBN on_IN so_QL few_AP event_NNS ,_, these_DTS result_NNS are_BER of_IN dubious_JJ validity_NN ._. The_AT calibration_NN of_IN piezoelectric_JJ sensor_NNS in_IN term_NNS of_IN the_AT particle_NN parameter_NNS is_BEZ very_QL uncertain_JJ ._. Many_AP worker_NNS believe_VB that_CS the_AT response_NN is_BEZ proportional_JJ to_IN the_AT incident_JJ momentum_NN of_IN the_AT particle_NNS ,_, a_AT relation_NN deduced_VBN from_IN laboratory_NN result_NNS linearly_RB extrapolated_VBN to_IN meteoritic_JJ velocity_NNS ._. However_RB ,_, one_PN must_MD expect_VB that_CS vaporization_NN and_CC ejection_NN of_IN material_NN by_IN hypervelocity_NN impact_NNS would_MD cause_VB a_AT deviation_NN from_IN a_AT linear_JJ relationship_NN ._. In_IN the_AT United_VBN States_NNS ,_, most_AP of_IN the_AT sensor_NNS are_BER calibrated_VBN by_IN dropping_VBG small_JJ sphere_NNS on_IN their_PP$ sensitive_JJ surface_NNS ._. The_AT Russian_NP experimenter_NNS claim_VB that_CS only_RB a_AT small_JJ fraction_NN of_IN the_AT impulse_NN from_IN the_AT sensor_NNS is_BEZ caused_VBN by_IN the_AT incident_JJ momentum_NN with_IN the_AT remainder_NN being_BEG momentum_NN of_IN ejected_VBN material_NN from_IN the_AT sensor_NN ._. This_DT ``_`` ejection_NN ''_'' momentum_NN is_BEZ linearly_RB related_VBN to_IN the_AT particle_NN energy_NN ._. They_PPSS quote_VB about_RB the_AT same_AP mass_NN threshold_NN a_CS that_DT of_IN the_AT U.S._NP apparatus_NN ,_, but_CC a_AT momentum_NN threshold_NN about_RB 40_CD time_NNS great_JJR ._. There_EX is_BEZ a_AT difference_NN in_IN the_AT experimental_JJ arrangement_NN ,_, in_IN that_CS the_AT U.S._NP microphone_NNS are_BER attached_VBN directly_RB to_IN the_AT vehicle_NN skin_NN while_CS the_AT Russian_JJ instrument_NNS are_BER isolated_VBN from_IN the_AT skin_NN ._. The_AT threshold_NN mass_NN is_BEZ derived_VBN from_IN the_AT momentum_NN threshold_NN with_IN the_AT assumption_NN of_IN a_AT mean_JJ impact_NN velocity_NN of_IN Af_NN in_IN the_AT U.S._NP work_NN and_CC Af_NN in_IN the_AT U.S.S.R._NP work_NN ._. The_AT threshold_NN mass_NN of_IN about_RB Af_NN corresponds_VBZ to_IN a_AT 10-M-diameter_NN sphere_NN of_IN density_NN Af_NN ._. However_RB ,_, the_AT conversion_NN from_IN mass_NN to_IN size_NN is_BEZ unreliable_JJ ,_, since_CS many_AP photographic_JJ meteor_NNS give_VB evidence_NN of_IN a_AT fluffy_JJ ,_, loosely_RB bound_VBN meteorite_NN structure_NN with_IN density_NNS a_QL low_JJ a_CS Af_NN ._. To_IN what_WDT extent_NN such_QL low_JJ density_NN applies_VBZ to_IN micrometeorite_NNS is_BEZ unknown_JJ ._. The_AT velocity_NN value_NN used_VBN is_BEZ also_RB open_JJ to_IN some_DTI question_NN ;_. ;_. if_CS a_AT substantial_JJ fraction_NN of_IN the_AT dust_NN is_BEZ orbiting_VBG about_IN the_AT Earth_NN ,_, only_RB about_RB one_CD third_OD the_AT above-mentioned_JJ average_JJ velocity_NN should_MD be_BE used_VBN in_IN deriving_VBG the_AT mass_NN ._. Zodiacal_JJ light_NN and_CC the_AT gegenschein_NN give_VB some_DTI evidence_NN for_IN such_ABL a_AT dust_NN blanket_NN ,_, a_AT phenomenon_NN also_RB to_TO be_BE expected_VBN if_CS the_AT dust_NN before_IN capture_NN is_BEZ in_IN circular_JJ orbit_NNS about_IN the_AT sun_NN ,_, a_CS indicated_VBN by_IN the_AT trend_NN of_IN the_AT small_JJR visible_JJ meteor_NNS ._. The_AT diurnal_JJ variation_NN in_IN the_AT observed_VBN flux_NN may_MD be_BE partly_RB due_JJ to_IN the_AT dependence_NN of_IN the_AT detector_NN sensitivity_NN on_IN the_AT incident_JJ velocity_NN ._. The_AT flux_NN of_IN micrometeorite_NNS in_IN the_AT neighborhood_NN of_IN the_AT Earth_NN can_MD be_BE estimated_VBN by_IN extrapolation_NN from_IN radar_NN and_CC visual_JJ meteor_NN data_NN ._. A_AT summary_NN of_IN meteorite_NN data_NN ,_, prepared_VBN by_IN Whipple_NP (_( 1958_CD )_) on_IN the_AT basis_NN of_IN photographic_JJ ,_, visual_JJ ,_, and_CC radar_NN evidence_NN ,_, is_BEZ given_VBN in_IN Table_NN 5-1_CD ._. From_IN an_AT estimated_VBN mass_NN of_IN 25_CD g_NN for_IN a_AT zero-magnitude_NN meteorite_NN ,_, the_AT other_AP mass_NNS are_BER derived_VBN with_IN the_AT assumption_NN of_IN a_AT mass_NN decrease_NN by_IN a_AT factor_NN of_IN 2.512_CD for_IN each_DT unit_NN increase_NN in_IN magnitude_NN ._. The_AT radius_NN is_BEZ calculated_VBN from_IN the_AT mass_NN by_IN assuming_VBG sphere_NNS of_IN density_NN Af_NN except_IN for_IN the_AT small_JJT particle_NNS ,_, which_WDT must_MD have_HV a_AT high_JJR mass_NN density_NN to_TO remain_VB in_IN the_AT solar_JJ system_NN in_IN the_AT presence_NN of_IN solar-radiation_NN pressure_NN ._. The_AT flux_NN value_NNS are_BER for_IN all_ABN particle_NNS with_IN mass_NNS great_JJR than_CS the_AT given_VBN mass_NN and_CC are_BER based_VBN on_IN an_AT estimate_NN of_IN the_AT number_NNS of_IN visual_JJ meteor_NNS ._. It_PPS is_BEZ assumed_VBN that_CS the_AT flux_NN value_NNS increase_VB by_IN a_AT factor_NN of_IN 2.512_CD per_IN magnitude_NN ,_, in_IN accordance_NN with_IN the_AT opinion_NN that_CS the_AT total_JJ mass_NN flux_NN in_IN each_DT unit_NN range_NN in_IN magnitude_NN is_BEZ constant_JJ ._. The_AT value_NNS agree_VB with_IN the_AT data_NNS from_IN 1958_CD Alpha_NP and_CC 1959_CD Eta_NP ._. The_AT figure_NNS in_IN the_AT next-to-last_AP column_NN are_BER derived_VBN with_IN the_AT assumption_NN of_IN 50_CD per_IN cent_NN shielding_NN by_IN the_AT Earth_NN ;_. ;_. hence_RB ,_, these_DTS figure_NNS apply_VB immediately_QL above_IN the_AT Earth's_NN$ atmosphere_NN ._. The_AT unshielded_JJ flux_NN is_BEZ given_VBN in_IN the_AT last_AP column_NN ;_. ;_. these_DTS figure_NNS constitute_VB the_AT best_JJT estimate_NN for_IN the_AT flux_NN in_IN interplanetary_JJ space_NN near_IN the_AT Earth_NN ._. Of_IN course_NN ,_, if_CS there_EX is_BEZ a_AT dust_NN blanket_NN around_IN the_AT Earth_NN ,_, the_AT flux_NNS in_IN interplanetary_JJ space_NN should_MD be_BE le_AP than_CS the_AT figure_NNS given_VBN here_RB ._. Note_VB that_CS the_AT mass_NN scale_NN is_BEZ one_CD to_IN two_CD order_NNS of_IN magnitude_NN great_JJR than_CS some_DTI previously_RB used_VBN ;_. ;_. for_IN example_NN ,_, Jacchia_NP (_( 1948_CD )_) derived_VBN a_AT scale_NN of_IN 0.15_CD g_NN for_IN a_AT Af_NN ,_, zero-magnitude_NN meteorite_NN ._. The_AT old_JJR scale_NNS were_BED based_VBN on_IN theoretical_JJ estimate_NNS of_IN the_AT conversion_NN efficiency_NN of_IN kinetic_JJ energy_NN into_IN light_NN ._. The_AT mass_NN scale_NN used_VBN in_IN Table_NN 5-1_CD wa_BEDZ derived_VBN on_IN the_AT assumption_NN that_CS the_AT motion_NN of_IN the_AT glowing_VBG trail_NN is_BEZ related_VBN to_IN the_AT momentum_NN transfer_NN to_IN the_AT trail_NN by_IN the_AT meteorite_NN ,_, permitting_VBG the_AT calculation_NN of_IN the_AT mass_NN if_CS the_AT velocity_NN is_BEZ known_VBN (_( Cook_NP and_CC Whipple_NP ,_, 1958_CD )_) ._. A_AT concentration_NN distribution_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN derived_VBN from_IN radar_NN observation_NNS sensitive_JJ to_IN the_AT fifteenth_OD magnitude_NN (_( Manning_NP and_CC Eshleman_NP ,_, 1959_CD )_) ._. Extrapolation_NN of_IN this_DT relationship_NN through_IN the_AT thirtieth_OD magnitude_NN cover_VBZ the_AT range_NN of_IN micrometeorite_NNS ._. The_AT approximate_JJ equation_NN is_BEZ Af_NN ,_, where_WRB N_NP is_BEZ the_AT number_NN of_IN Af_NN with_IN electron_NN line-density_NN great_JJR than_CS or_CC equal_JJ to_IN Af_NN ,_, and_CC Q_NP is_BEZ proportional_JJ to_IN the_AT mass_NN of_IN the_AT meteorite_NN ._. Therefore_RB ,_, N_NP is_BEZ inversely_RB proportional_JJ to_IN the_AT radius_NN cubed_VBN and_CC in_IN fair_JJ agreement_NN with_IN the_AT inverse_JJ 7/2_CD power_NN derived_VBN from_IN 1958_CD Alpha_NP and_CC 1959_CD Eta_NP data_NNS ._. At_IN the_AT fifteenth_OD magnitude_NN ,_, Af_NN ,_, and_CC at_IN the_AT twenty-fifth_OD magnitude_NN ,_, Af_NN ._. These_DTS extrapolated_VBN flux_NNS are_BER about_RB an_AT order_NN of_IN magnitude_NN le_AP than_CS the_AT value_NNS from_IN the_AT satellite_NN data_NN and_CC the_AT figure_NNS in_IN Whipple's_NP$ table_NN ._. The_AT extrapolation_NN may_MD be_BE in_IN error_NN for_IN several_AP reason_NNS ._. The_AT observational_JJ data_NNS determining_VBG the_AT concentration_NN distribution_NN have_HV a_AT range_NN of_IN error_NN which_WDT is_BEZ magnified_VBN in_IN the_AT extension_NN into_IN the_AT micrometeorite_NN region_NN ._. The_AT solar-electromagnetic-_JJ and_CC corpuscular-radiation_NN pressure_NN and_CC the_AT associated_VBN Poynting-Robertson_NP effect_NN increase_VB in_IN effectiveness_NN a_CS the_AT particle_NN size_NN decrease_VBZ and_CC modify_VB the_AT distribution_NN and_CC limit_VB size_NNS to_IN large_JJR than_CS a_AT few_AP micron_NNS ._. Also_RB ,_, it_PPS ha_HVZ been_BEN suggested_VBN that_CS the_AT source_NN of_IN all_ABN or_CC part_NN of_IN the_AT dust_NN may_MD not_* be_BE the_AT same_AP a_CS that_DT for_IN visual_JJ or_CC radar_NN meteorite_NNS (_( Best_NP ,_, 1960_CD )_) ,_, and_CC the_AT same_AP distribution_NN would_MD not_* be_BE expected_VBN ._. 5.4_CD ._. Indirect_JJ indication_NNS of_IN micrometeorite_NN flux_NN A_AT measure_NN of_IN the_AT total_JJ mass_NN accretion_NN of_IN meteoritic_JJ material_NN by_IN the_AT Earth_NN is_BEZ obtained_VBN from_IN analysis_NNS of_IN deep-sea_JJ sediment_NNS and_CC dust_NN collected_VBN in_IN remote_JJ region_NNS (_( Pettersson_NP ,_, 1960_CD )_) ._. Most_AP meteoritic_JJ material_NN ,_, by_IN the_AT time_NN it_PPS reach_VBZ the_AT Earth's_NN$ surface_NN ,_, ha_HVZ been_BEN reduced_VBN to_IN dust_NN or_CC to_IN spherule_NNS of_IN ablated_VBN material_NN in_IN it_PP$ passage_NN through_IN the_AT atmosphere_NN ._. For_IN all_ABN meteorite_NNS ,_, the_AT average_JJ nickel_NN content_NN is_BEZ about_RB 2.5_CD per_IN cent_NN ._. This_DT is_BEZ much_QL high_JJR than_CS the_AT nickel_NN content_NN of_IN terrestrial_JJ dust_NNS and_CC sediment_NNS and_CC provides_VBZ a_AT basis_NN for_IN the_AT determination_NN of_IN the_AT meteoritic_JJ mass_NN influx_NN ._. Present_JJ data_NNS indicate_VB an_AT accretion_NN of_IN about_RB Af_NN ton_NNS per_IN year_NN over_IN the_AT entire_JJ globe_NN ,_, or_CC about_RB Af_NN ._. Biological_JJ warfare_NN Biological_JJ warfare_NN is_BEZ the_AT intentional_JJ use_NN of_IN living_VBG microorganism_NNS or_CC their_PP$ toxic_JJ product_NNS for_IN the_AT purpose_NN of_IN destroying_VBG or_CC reducing_VBG the_AT military_JJ effectiveness_NN of_IN man_NN ._. It_PPS is_BEZ the_AT exploitation_NN of_IN the_AT inherent_JJ potential_NN of_IN infectious_JJ disease_NN agent_NNS by_IN scientific_JJ research_NN and_CC development_NN ,_, resulting_VBG in_IN the_AT production_NN of_IN BW_NN weapon_NNS system_NNS ._. Man_NN may_MD also_RB be_BE injured_VBN secondarily_RB by_IN damage_NN to_IN his_PP$ food_NN crop_NNS or_CC domestic_JJ animal_NNS ._. Biological_JJ warfare_NN is_BEZ considered_VBN to_TO be_BE primarily_RB a_AT strategic_JJ weapon_NN ._. The_AT major_JJ reason_NN for_IN this_DT is_BEZ that_CS it_PPS ha_HVZ no_AT quick-kill_NN effect_NN ._. The_AT incubation_NN period_NN of_IN infectious_JJ disease_NN ,_, plus_IN a_AT variable_JJ period_NN of_IN illness_NN even_RB before_IN a_AT lethal_JJ effect_NN ,_, render_VB this_DT weapon_NN unsuitable_JJ for_IN hand-to-hand_JJ encounter_NN ._. A_AT man_NN can_MD be_BE an_AT effective_JJ fighting_VBG machine_NN throughout_IN the_AT incubation_NN period_NN of_IN most_AP infectious_JJ disease_NNS ._. Thus_RB ,_, an_AT enemy_NN would_MD probably_RB use_VB this_DT weapon_NN for_IN attack_NN on_IN static_JJ population_NN center_NNS such_JJ a_CS large_JJ city_NNS ._. An_AT important_JJ operational_JJ procedure_NN in_IN BW_NN for_IN an_AT enemy_NN would_MD be_BE to_TO create_VB an_AT areosol_NN or_CC cloud_NN of_IN agent_NN over_IN the_AT target_NN area_NN ._. This_DT concept_NN ha_HVZ stimulated_VBN much_AP basic_JJ research_NN concerning_IN the_AT behavior_NN of_IN particulate_JJ biological_JJ material_NNS ,_, the_AT pathogenesis_NN of_IN respiratory_JJ infection_NNS ,_, the_AT medical_JJ management_NN of_IN such_JJ disease_NNS and_CC defense_NN against_IN their_PP$ occurrence_NN ._. The_AT biological_JJ and_CC physical_JJ property_NNS of_IN infectious_JJ particle_NNS have_HV been_BEN studied_VBN intensively_RB during_IN the_AT past_AP fifteen_CD year_NNS ._. Much_AP new_JJ equipment_NN and_CC many_AP unique_JJ technique_NNS have_HV been_BEN developed_VBN for_IN the_AT quantitative_JJ exposure_NN of_IN experimental_JJ animal_NNS to_IN aerosol_NNS of_IN infectious_JJ agent_NNS contained_VBN in_IN particle_NNS of_IN specified_VBN dimensional_JJ characteristic_NNS ._. Much_AP information_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN gathered_VBN relative_JJ to_IN quantitative_JJ sampling_NN and_CC assesment_NN technique_NNS ._. Much_AP of_IN the_AT old_JJR experimental_JJ work_NN on_IN respiratory_JJ infection_NNS wa_BEDZ accomplished_VBN by_IN very_QL artificial_JJ procedure_NNS ._. The_AT intranasal_JJ instillation_NN of_IN a_AT fluid_NN suspension_NN of_IN infectious_JJ agent_NN in_IN an_AT anesthetized_VBN animal_NN is_BEZ far_QL different_JJ from_IN exposure_NN ,_, through_IN natural_JJ respiration_NN ,_, to_IN aerosolized_VBN organism_NNS ._. The_AT importance_NN of_IN particle_NN size_NN in_IN such_JJ aerosol_NNS ha_HVZ been_BEN thoroughly_RB demonstrated_VBN ._. Apart_RB from_IN the_AT honeybee_NN ,_, practically_RB all_ABN bee_NNS and_CC bumblebee_NNS hibernate_VB in_IN a_AT state_NN of_IN torpor_NN ._. Occasionally_RB ,_, you_PPSS may_MD come_VB across_IN one_CD or_CC two_CD bumblebee_NNS in_IN the_AT cold_JJ season_NN ,_, when_WRB you_PPSS are_BER turning_VBG over_RP sod_NNS in_IN your_PP$ garden_NN ,_, but_CC you_PPSS have_HV to_TO be_BE a_AT really_QL keen_JJ observer_NN to_TO see_VB them_PPO at_IN all_ABN ._. They_PPSS keep_VB their_PP$ wing_NNS and_CC foot_NNS pressed_VBN tightly_RB against_IN their_PP$ body_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN spite_NN of_IN their_PP$ often_RB colorful_JJ attire_NN you_PPSS may_MD very_QL well_RB mistake_VB them_PPO for_IN lump_NNS of_IN dirt_NN ._. I_PPSS must_MD add_VB at_IN once_RB that_CS these_DTS animal_NNS are_BER what_WDT we_PPSS call_VB ``_`` queen_NNS ''_'' ,_, young_JJ female_NNS that_WPS have_HV mated_VBN in_IN the_AT previous_JJ summer_NN or_CC autumn_NN ._. Even_RB some_DTI of_IN the_AT queen_NNS will_MD die_VB before_CS the_AT winter_NN is_BEZ over_RP ,_, falling_VBG prey_NN to_IN enemy_NNS or_CC disease_NN ._. Now_RB the_AT thing_NN for_CS u_PPO to_TO do_DO is_BEZ to_TO find_VB ourselves_PPLS a_AT couple_NN of_IN those_DTS wonderful_JJ flowering_VBG currant_NNS such_JJ a_CS the_AT red_JJ Ribes_NP sanguineum_NP of_IN our_PP$ Pacific_JJ Northwest_NN ,_, or_CC otherwise_RB a_AT good_JJ sloe_NN tree_NN ,_, or_CC perhaps_RB some_DTI nice_JJ pussy_NN willow_NN in_IN bloom_NN ,_, preferably_RB one_CD with_IN male_JJ or_CC staminate_JJ catkin_NNS ._. The_AT bloom_NNS of_IN Ribes_NP and_CC of_IN the_AT willow_NN and_CC sloe_NN are_BER the_AT place_NNS where_WRB large_JJ number_NNS of_IN our_PP$ early_JJ insect_NNS will_MD assemble_VB :_: honeybee_NNS ,_, bumblebee_NNS ,_, and_CC other_AP wild_JJ bee_NNS ,_, and_CC also_RB various_JJ kind_NNS of_IN fly_NNS ._. It_PPS is_BEZ a_AT happy_JJ ,_, buzzing_VBG crowd_NN ._. Each_DT male_JJ willow_NN catkin_NN is_BEZ composed_VBN of_IN a_AT large_JJ number_NN of_IN small_JJ flower_NNS ._. It_PPS is_BEZ not_* difficult_JJ to_TO see_VB that_CS the_AT stamen_NNS of_IN the_AT catkin_NN are_BER always_RB arranged_VBN in_IN pair_NNS ,_, and_CC that_CS each_DT individual_JJ flower_NN is_BEZ nothing_PN but_IN one_CD such_JJ pair_NN standing_VBG on_IN a_AT green_JJ ,_, black-tipped_JJ little_JJ scale_NN ._. By_IN scrutinizing_VBG the_AT flower_NNS ,_, one_PN can_MD also_RB notice_VB that_CS the_AT scale_NN bear_VBZ one_CD or_CC two_CD tiny_JJ wart_NNS ._. Those_DTS are_BER the_AT nectary_NNS or_CC honey_NN gland_NNS (_( Fig._NN 26_CD ,_, page_NN 74_CD )_) ._. The_AT staminate_JJ willow_NN catkin_NNS ,_, then_RB ,_, provide_VB their_PP$ visitor_NNS with_IN both_ABX nectar_NN and_CC pollen_NN ;_. ;_. a_AT marvelous_JJ arrangement_NN ,_, for_CS it_PPS provides_VBZ exactly_RB what_WDT the_AT bee_NN queen_NNS need_VB to_TO make_VB their_PP$ beebread_NN ,_, a_AT combination_NN of_IN honey_NN and_CC pollen_NN with_IN which_WDT the_AT young_JJ of_IN all_ABN specie_NNS are_BER fed_VBN ._. The_AT only_AP exception_NN to_IN this_DT is_BEZ certain_AP bee_NNS that_WPS have_HV become_VBN parasite_NNS ._. I_PPSS will_MD deal_VB with_IN these_DTS later_RBR on_RP ._. Quite_QL often_RB ,_, honeybee_NNS form_VB a_AT majority_NN on_IN the_AT willow_NN catkin_NNS ._. As_CS we_PPSS have_HV already_RB seen_VBN in_IN the_AT first_OD chapter_NN ,_, bumblebee_NNS are_BER big_JJR ,_, hairy_JJR ,_, and_CC much_QL more_QL colorful_JJ than_CS honeybee_NNS ,_, exhibiting_VBG various_JJ combination_NNS of_IN black_NN ,_, yellow_NN ,_, white_NN and_CC orange_NN ._. Let_VB u_PPO not_* try_VB to_TO key_VB them_PPO out_RP at_IN this_DT stage_NN of_IN the_AT game_NN ,_, and_CC let_VB u_PPO just_RB call_VB them_PPO Bombus_NN ._. There_EX must_MD be_BE several_AP dozen_NN specie_NNS in_IN the_AT United_VBN States_NNS alone_RB ._. If_CS you_PPSS really_RB insist_VB on_IN knowing_VBG their_PP$ name_NNS ,_, an_AT excellent_JJ book_NN on_IN the_AT North_JJ American_JJ specie_NN is_BEZ Bumblebees_NNS And_CC Their_PP$ Ways_NNS by_IN O._NP E._NP Plath_NP ._. If_CS we_PPSS manage_VB to_TO keep_VB track_NN of_IN a_AT Bombus_NN queen_NN after_CS she_PPS ha_HVZ left_VBN her_PP$ feeding_VBG place_NN ,_, we_PPSS may_MD discover_VB the_AT snug_JJ little_JJ hideout_NN which_WDT she_PPS ha_HVZ fixed_VBN up_RP for_IN herself_PPL when_WRB she_PPS woke_VBD up_RP from_IN her_PP$ winter_NN sleep_NN ._. As_CS befits_VBZ a_AT queen_NN ,_, a_AT bumblebee_NN female_NN is_BEZ rather_QL choosy_JJ and_CC may_MD spend_VB considerable_JJ time_NN searching_VBG for_IN a_AT suitable_JJ nesting_VBG place_NN ._. For_IN example_NN ,_, the_AT marked_VBN susceptibility_NN of_IN the_AT monkey_NN to_IN respiratory_JJ infection_NN might_MD be_BE related_VBN to_IN it_PP$ delicate_JJ ,_, long_JJ alveolar_JJ duct_NNS and_CC short_JJ ,_, large_JJ bronchiole_NNS situated_VBN within_IN a_AT parenchyma_NN entirely_RB lacking_VBG in_IN protective_JJ supportive_JJ tissue_NN barrier_NNS such_JJ a_CS those_DTS found_VBN in_IN type_NNS 1_CD ,_, and_CC 3_CD ._. One_PN might_MD also_RB wonder_VB if_CS monkey_NNS are_BER capable_JJ of_IN developing_VBG bronchiolitis_NN a_CS we_PPSS know_VB it_PPO in_IN man_NN or_CC the_AT horse_NN ._. The_AT only_AP area_NN in_IN which_WDT one_PN might_MD find_VB major_JJ disagreement_NN in_IN this_DT matter_NN is_BEZ in_IN regard_NN to_IN the_AT alveolar_JJ distribution_NN of_IN the_AT bronchial_JJ artery_NNS ._. In_IN 1951_CD ,_, this_DT wa_BEDZ reaffirmed_VBN by_IN Cudkowicz_NP ._. '25_CD )_) ._. The_AT meaning_NN of_IN this_DT variation_NN in_IN distribution_NN of_IN the_AT bronchial_JJ artery_NN a_CS found_VBN in_IN the_AT horse_NN is_BEZ not_* clear_JJ ._. However_RB ,_, this_DT artery_NN is_BEZ known_VBN to_TO be_BE a_AT nutrient_JJ vessel_NN with_IN a_AT distribution_NN primarily_RB to_IN the_AT proximal_JJ airway_NNS and_CC supportive_JJ tissue_NNS of_IN the_AT lung_NN ._. The_AT alveolus_NNS and_CC respiratory_JJ bronchiole_NNS are_BER primarily_RB diffusing_VBG tissue_NNS ._. Summary_NN The_AT main_JJS subgross_JJ anatomical_JJ feature_NNS of_IN the_AT lung_NNS of_IN various_JJ mammal_NNS are_BER presented_VBN ._. A_AT tabulation_NN of_IN these_DTS feature_NNS permit_VBZ the_AT lung_NNS to_TO be_BE grouped_VBN into_IN three_CD distinctive_JJ subgross_JJ type_NNS ._. Type_NN 1_CD ,_, is_BEZ represented_VBN by_IN the_AT cow_NN ,_, sheep_NN ,_, and_CC pig_NN ;_. ;_. type_NN 2_CD ,_, ,_, by_IN the_AT dog_NN ,_, cat_NN ,_, and_CC monkey_NN ;_. ;_. type_NN 3_CD ,_, ,_, by_IN the_AT horse_NN ._. Lobularity_NN is_BEZ extremely_QL well_RB developed_VBN in_IN type_NN 1_CD ;_. ;_. absent_JJ in_IN type_NN 2_CD ;_. ;_. imperfectly_RB developed_VBN in_IN type_NN 3_CD ._. The_AT pleura_NN and_CC interlobular_JJ septum_NNS are_BER thick_JJ in_IN type_NNS 1_CD and_CC 3_CD ._. The_AT pleura_NN is_BEZ extremely_QL thin_JJ in_IN type_NN 2_CD and_CC septum_NNS are_BER absent_JJ ._. In_IN type_NN 1_CD the_AT pulmonary_JJ vein_NN closely_RB follows_VBZ the_AT course_NN of_IN the_AT bronchus_NN and_CC the_AT pulmonary_JJ artery_NN from_IN the_AT periphery_NN to_IN the_AT hilum_NN ._. Some_DTI of_IN the_AT feature_NNS of_IN the_AT top_JJS portion_NNS of_IN Figure_NN 1_CD and_CC Figure_NN 2_CD were_BED mentioned_VBN in_IN discussing_VBG Table_NN 1_CD ._. First_RB ,_, the_AT Onset_NN Profile_NN spread_VBZ across_IN approximately_RB 12_CD year_NNS for_IN boy_NNS and_CC 10_CD year_NNS for_IN girl_NNS ._. The_AT Onset_NN Profile_NN and_CC Completion_NN Profile_NN are_BER constructed_VBN to_TO serve_VB a_CS norm_NNS for_IN child_NNS ._. It_PPS is_BEZ convenient_JJ to_TO classify_VB a_AT child's_NN$ onset_NN age_NNS and_CC completion_NN age_NNS a_CS ``_`` advanced_VBN ''_'' ,_, ``_`` moderate_JJ ''_'' (_( modal_JJ )_) ,_, or_CC ``_`` delayed_VBN ''_'' according_IN to_IN whether_CS the_AT child's_NN$ age_NN equivalent_NN ``_`` dot_NNS ''_'' appeared_VBD to_IN the_AT left_NR of_IN ,_, upon_IN ,_, or_CC to_IN the_AT right_NR of_IN the_AT appropriate_JJ short_JJ transverse_JJ line_NN ._. Such_JJ classification_NNS may_MD be_BE called_VBN ``_`` somewhat_QL advanced_VBN ''_'' or_CC ``_`` somewhat_QL delayed_VBN ''_'' ,_, a_CS the_AT case_NN may_MD be_BE ,_, reserving_VBG ``_`` moderate_JJ ''_'' for_IN dot_NNS upon_IN or_CC close_RB to_IN the_AT mean_NN ._. In_IN the_AT low_JJR portion_NN of_IN each_DT Chart_NN ,_, the_AT Skeletal_JJ Age_NN (_( Hand_NN )_) of_IN boy_NN 34_CD and_CC girl_NN 2_CD may_MD be_BE similarly_RB classified_VBN ._. Thus_RB ,_, a_AT child's_NN$ Skeletal_JJ Age_NN ``_`` dot_NNS ''_'' may_MD be_BE classified_VBN a_CS ``_`` advanced_VBN ''_'' when_WRB they_PPSS appear_VB above_IN the_AT middle_JJ curve_NN ,_, ``_`` moderate_JJ ''_'' when_WRB they_PPSS appear_VB immediately_QL above_IN or_CC below_IN the_AT middle_JJ curve_NN ,_, and_CC ``_`` delayed_VBN ''_'' when_WRB they_PPSS appear_VB below_IN the_AT low_JJR curve_NN ._. To_TO summarize_VB the_AT purpose_NN of_IN the_AT Skeletal_JJ Maturity_NN Chart_NN :_: each_DT contains_VBZ two_CD kind_NNS of_IN skeletal_JJ maturity_NN norm_NNS which_WDT show_VB two_CD quite_QL different_JJ method_NNS of_IN depicting_VBG developmental_JJ level_NN of_IN growth_NN center_NNS ._. B_NP ._. Organification_NN of_IN iodine_NN The_AT precise_JJ mechanism_NN for_IN organification_NN of_IN iodine_NN in_IN the_AT thyroid_NN is_BEZ not_* a_QL yet_RB completely_RB understood_VBN ._. However_RB ,_, the_AT formation_NN of_IN organically_RB bound_VBN iodine_NN ,_, mainly_RB mono-iodotyrosine_NN ,_, can_MD be_BE accomplished_VBN in_IN cell-free_JJ system_NNS ._. In_IN the_AT absence_NN of_IN addition_NNS to_IN the_AT homogenate_NN ,_, the_AT product_NN formed_VBN is_BEZ an_AT iodinated_VBN particulate_JJ protein_NN (_( Fawcett_NP and_CC Kirkwood_NP ,_, 1953_CD ;_. ;_. Taurog_NP ,_, Potter_NP and_CC Chaikoff_NP ,_, 1955_CD ;_. ;_. Taurog_NP ,_, Potter_NP ,_, Tong_NP ,_, and_CC Chaikoff_NP ,_, 1956_CD ;_. ;_. Serif_NP and_CC Kirkwood_NP ,_, 1958_CD ;_. ;_. De_NP Groot_NP and_CC Carvalho_NP ,_, 1960_CD )_) ._. This_DT iodoprotein_NN doe_DOZ not_* appear_VB to_TO be_BE the_AT same_AP a_CS what_WDT is_BEZ normally_RB present_RB in_IN the_AT thyroid_NN ,_, and_CC there_EX is_BEZ no_AT evidence_NN so_QL far_RB that_CS thyroglobulin_NN can_MD be_BE iodinated_VBN in_IN vitro_NN by_IN cell-free_JJ system_NNS ._. In_IN addition_NN ,_, the_AT iodoamino_NN acid_NN formed_VBN in_IN large_JJT quantity_NN in_IN the_AT intact_JJ thyroid_NN is_BEZ di-iodotyrosine_NN ._. If_CS tyrosine_NN and_CC a_AT system_NN generating_VBG hydrogen_NN peroxide_NN are_BER added_VBN to_IN a_AT cell-free_JJ homogenate_NN of_IN the_AT thyroid_NN ,_, large_JJ quantity_NNS of_IN free_JJ mono-iodotyrosine_NN can_MD be_BE formed_VBN (_( Alexander_NP ,_, 1959_CD )_) ._. It_PPS is_BEZ not_* clear_JJ whether_CS this_DT system_NN bear_VBZ any_DTI resemblance_NN to_IN the_AT in_IN vivo_NN iodinating_VBG mechanism_NN ,_, and_CC a_AT system_NN generating_VBG peroxide_NN ha_HVZ not_* been_BEN identified_VBN in_IN thyroid_NN tissue_NN ._. On_IN chemical_JJ ground_NNS it_PPS seems_VBZ most_QL likely_JJ that_CS iodide_NN is_BEZ first_RB converted_VBN to_IN Af_NN and_CC then_RB to_IN Af_NN a_CS the_AT active_JJ iodinating_VBG specie_NN ._. In_IN the_AT thyroid_NN gland_NN it_PPS appears_VBZ that_CS protein_NNS (_( chiefly_RB thyroglobulin_NN )_) are_BER iodinated_VBN and_CC that_CS free_JJ tyrosine_NN and_CC thyronine_NN are_BER not_* iodinated_VBN ._. Iodination_NN of_IN tyrosine_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, is_BEZ not_* enough_AP for_IN the_AT synthesis_NN of_IN hormone_NN ._. The_AT mono-_JJ and_CC di-iodotyrosine_NN must_MD be_BE coupled_VBN to_TO form_VB tri-iodothyronine_NN and_CC thyroxine_NN ._. The_AT mechanism_NN of_IN this_DT coupling_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN studied_VBN in_IN some_DTI detail_NN with_IN non-enzymatic_JJ system_NNS in_IN vitro_NN and_CC can_MD be_BE simulated_VBN by_IN certain_JJ di-iodotyrosine_NN analogue_NNS (_( Pitt-Rivers_NP and_CC James_NP ,_, 1958_CD )_) ._. There_EX is_BEZ so_QL far_RB no_AT evidence_NN to_TO indicate_VB conclusively_RB that_CS this_DT coupling_NN is_BEZ under_IN enzymatic_JJ control_NN ._. The_AT chemical_JJ nature_NN of_IN the_AT iodocompound_NNS is_BEZ discussed_VBN below_RB (_( pp._NNS 76_CD et_CC seq._VBG )_) ._. C_NP ._. Thyroglobulin_NN synthesis_NN Little_AP is_BEZ known_VBN of_IN the_AT synthetic_JJ mechanism_NNS for_IN formation_NN of_IN thyroglobulin_NN ._. Its_PP$ synthesis_NN ha_HVZ not_* been_BEN demonstrated_VBN in_IN cell-free_JJ system_NNS ,_, nor_CC ha_HVZ it_PP$ synthesis_NN by_IN system_NNS with_IN intact_JJ thyroid_NN cell_NNS in_IN vitro_NN been_BEN unequivocally_RB proven_VBN ._. There_EX is_BEZ some_DTI reason_NN to_TO think_VB that_CS thyroglobulin_NN synthesis_NN may_MD proceed_VB independently_RB of_IN iodination_NN ,_, for_CS in_IN certain_AP transplantable_JJ tumour_NNS of_IN the_AT rat_NN thyroid_NN containing_VBG essentially_RB no_AT iodinated_VBN thyroglobulin_NN ,_, a_AT protein_NN that_WPS appears_VBZ to_TO be_BE thyroglobulin_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN observed_VBN in_IN ultracentrifuge_NN experiment_NNS (_( Wolff_NP ,_, Robbins_NP and_CC Rall_NP ,_, 1959_CD )_) ._. Similar_JJ finding_NNS have_HV been_BEN noted_VBN in_IN a_AT patient_NN with_IN congenital_JJ absence_NN of_IN the_AT organification_NN enzyme_NNS ,_, whose_WP$ thyroid_NN tissue_NN could_MD only_RB concentrate_VB iodide_NN ._.
