Secretion_NN Since_CS the_AT circulating_VBG thyroid_NN hormone_NNS are_BER the_AT amino_NN acid_NNS thyroxine_NN and_CC tri-iodothyronine_NN (_( cf._VB Section_NN C_NP )_) ,_, it_PPS is_BEZ clear_JJ that_CS some_DTI mechanism_NN must_MD exist_VB in_IN the_AT thyroid_NN gland_NN for_IN their_PP$ release_NN from_IN protein_NNS before_IN secretion_NN ._. The_AT presence_NN of_IN several_AP protease_NNS and_CC peptidase_NNS ha_HVZ been_BEN demonstrated_VBN in_IN the_AT thyroid_NN ._. One_CD of_IN the_AT protease_NNS ha_HVZ pH_NN optimum_NN of_IN about_RB 3.7_CD and_CC another_DT of_IN about_RB 5.7_CD (_( McQuillan_NP ,_, Stanley_NP and_CC Trikojus_NP ,_, 1954_CD ;_. ;_. Alpers_NP ,_, Robbins_NP and_CC Rall_NP ,_, 1955_CD )_) ._. The_AT finding_NN that_CS the_AT concentration_NN of_IN one_CD of_IN these_DTS protease_NNS is_BEZ increased_VBN in_IN thyroid_NN gland_NNS from_IN TSH-treated_NN animal_NNS suggests_VBZ that_CS this_DT protease_NN may_MD be_BE active_JJ in_IN vivo_NN ._. There_EX is_BEZ no_AT conclusive_JJ evidence_NN yet_RB that_CS either_DTX of_IN the_AT protease_NNS ha_HVZ been_BEN prepared_VBN in_IN highly_QL purified_VBN form_NN nor_CC is_BEZ their_PP$ specificity_NN known_VBN ._. A_AT study_NN of_IN their_PP$ activity_NN on_IN thyroglobulin_NN ha_HVZ shown_VBN that_DT thyroxine_NN is_BEZ not_* preferentially_RB released_VBN and_CC that_CS the_AT degradation_NN proceeds_VBZ stepwise_RB with_IN the_AT formation_NN of_IN macromolecular_JJ intermediate_NNS (_( Alpers_NP ,_, Petermann_NP and_CC Rall_NP ,_, 1956_CD )_) ._. Besides_IN proteolytic_JJ enzyme_NNS the_AT thyroid_NN posse_VBZ de-iodinating_VBG enzyme_NNS ._. A_AT microsomal_JJ de-iodinase_NN with_IN a_AT pH_NN optimum_NN of_IN around_RB 8_CD ,_, and_CC requiring_VBG reduced_VBN triphosphopyridine_NN nucleotide_NN for_IN activity_NN ,_, ha_HVZ been_BEN identified_VBN in_IN the_AT thyroid_NN (_( Stanbury_NP ,_, 1957_CD )_) ._. This_DT de-iodinating_VBG enzyme_NN is_BEZ effective_JJ against_IN mono-_JJ and_CC di-iodotyrosine_NN ,_, but_CC doe_DOZ not_* de-iodinate_VB thyroxine_NN or_CC tri-iodothyronine_NN ._. It_PPS is_BEZ assumed_VBN that_CS the_AT iodine_NN released_VBN from_IN the_AT iodotyrosine_NNS remains_VBZ in_IN the_AT iodide_NN pool_NN of_IN the_AT thyroid_NN ,_, where_WRB it_PPS is_BEZ oxidised_VBN and_CC re-incorporated_VBN into_IN thyroglobulin_NN ._. The_AT thyroxine_NN and_CC tri-iodothyronine_NN released_VBN by_IN proteolysis_NN and_CC so_RB escaping_VBG de-iodination_NN presumably_RB diffuse_VB into_IN the_AT blood_NN stream_NN ._. It_PPS ha_HVZ been_BEN shown_VBN that_CS thyroglobulin_NN bind_VBZ thyroxine_NN ,_, but_CC the_AT binding_NN doe_DOZ not_* appear_VB to_TO be_BE particularly_QL strong_JJ ._. It_PPS ha_HVZ been_BEN suggested_VBN that_CS the_AT plasma_NN thyroxine-binding_JJ protein_NNS ,_, which_WDT have_HV an_AT extremely_QL high_JJ affinity_NN for_IN thyroxine_NN ,_, compete_VB with_IN thyroglobulin_NN for_IN thyroxine_NN (_( Ingbar_NP and_CC Freinkel_NP ,_, 1957_CD )_) ._. E_NP ._. Antithyroid_JJ drug_NNS Antithyroid_JJ drug_NNS are_BER of_IN two_CD general_JJ type_NNS ._. One_CD type_NN ha_HVZ a_AT small_JJ univalent_JJ anion_NN of_IN the_AT thiocyanate-perchlorate-fluoro_NN type_NN ._. This_DT ion_NN inhibits_VBZ thyroid_NN hormone_NN synthesis_NN by_IN interfering_VBG with_IN iodide_NN concentration_NN in_IN the_AT thyroid_NN ._. It_PPS doe_DOZ not_* appear_VB to_TO affect_VB the_AT iodinating_VBG mechanism_NN a_CS such_JJ ._. The_AT other_AP group_NN of_IN antithyroid_JJ agent_NNS or_CC drug_NNS is_BEZ typified_VBN by_IN thiouracil_NN ._. These_DTS drug_NNS have_HV no_AT effect_NN on_IN the_AT iodide_NN concentrating_VBG mechanism_NN ,_, but_CC they_PPSS inhibit_VB organification_NN ._. The_AT mechanism_NN of_IN action_NN of_IN these_DTS drug_NNS ha_HVZ not_* been_BEN completely_RB worked_VBN out_RP ,_, but_CC certain_AP of_IN them_PPO appear_VB to_TO act_VB by_IN reducing_VBG the_AT oxidised_VBN form_NN of_IN iodine_NN before_CS it_PPS can_MD iodinate_VB thyroglobulin_NN (_( Astwood_NP ,_, 1954_CD )_) ._. On_IN the_AT other_AP hand_NN ,_, there_EX are_BER a_AT few_AP antithyroid_JJ drug_NNS of_IN this_DT same_AP general_JJ type_NN ,_, such_JJ a_CS resorcinol_NN ,_, possessing_VBG no_AT reducing_VBG activity_NN and_CC possibly_RB acting_VBG through_IN formation_NN of_IN a_AT complex_NN with_IN molecular_JJ iodine_NN ._. Any_DTI of_IN the_AT antithyroid_JJ drug_NNS ,_, of_IN either_DTX type_NN ,_, if_CS given_VBN in_IN large_JJ enough_QLP dos_NNS for_IN a_AT long_JJ period_NN of_IN time_NN will_MD cause_VB goitre_NN ,_, owing_VBG to_IN inhibition_NN of_IN thyroid_NN hormone_NN synthesis_NN ,_, with_IN production_NN of_IN hypothyroidism_NN ._. The_AT anterior_JJ lobe_NN of_IN the_AT pituitary_NN then_RB responds_VBZ by_IN an_AT increased_VBN output_NN of_IN TSH_NN ,_, causing_VBG the_AT thyroid_NN to_TO enlarge_VB ._. The_AT effect_NN of_IN drug_NNS that_WPS act_VB on_IN the_AT iodide-concentrating_JJ mechanism_NN can_MD be_BE counteracted_VBN by_IN addition_NN of_IN relatively_QL large_JJ amount_NNS of_IN iodine_NN to_IN the_AT diet_NN ._. The_AT antithyroid_JJ drug_NNS of_IN the_AT thiouracil_NN type_NN ,_, however_RB ,_, are_BER not_* antagonised_VBN by_IN such_JJ mean_NNS ._. Besides_IN those_DTS of_IN the_AT thiouracil_NN and_CC resorcinol_NN type_NNS ,_, certain_AP antithyroid_JJ drug_NNS have_HV been_BEN found_VBN in_IN naturally_RB occurring_VBG food_NNS ._. The_AT most_QL conclusively_RB identified_VBN is_BEZ L-5-vinyl-2-thio-oxazolidone_NP ,_, which_WDT wa_BEDZ isolated_VBN from_IN rutabaga_NN (_( Greer_NP ,_, 1950_CD )_) ._. It_PPS is_BEZ presumed_VBN to_TO occur_VB in_IN other_AP member_NNS of_IN the_AT Brassica_NP family_NN ._. There_EX is_BEZ some_DTI evidence_NN that_CS naturally_RB occurring_VBG goitrogen_NNS may_MD play_VB a_AT role_NN in_IN the_AT development_NN of_IN goitre_NN ,_, particularly_RB in_IN Tasmania_NP and_CC Australia_NP (_( Clements_NP and_CC Wishart_NP ,_, 1956_CD )_) ._. There_RB it_PPS seems_VBZ that_CS the_AT goitrogen_NN ingested_VBN by_IN dairy_NN animal_NNS is_BEZ itself_PPL inactive_JJ but_CC is_BEZ converted_VBN in_IN the_AT animal_NN to_IN an_AT active_JJ goitrogen_NN ,_, which_WDT is_BEZ then_RB secreted_VBN in_IN the_AT milk_NN ._. F_NP ._. Dietary_JJ influence_NNS Besides_IN the_AT presence_NN of_IN goitrogen_NNS in_IN the_AT diet_NN ,_, the_AT level_NN of_IN iodine_NN itself_PPL in_IN the_AT diet_NN play_VBZ a_AT major_JJ role_NN in_IN governing_VBG the_AT activity_NN of_IN the_AT thyroid_NN gland_NN ._. In_IN the_AT experimental_JJ animal_NN and_CC in_IN man_NN gross_JJ deficiency_NN in_IN dietary_JJ iodine_NN cause_VBZ thyroid_NN hyperplasia_NN ,_, hypertrophy_NN and_CC increased_VBN thyroid_NN activity_NN (_( Money_NN ,_, Rall_NP and_CC Rawson_NP ,_, 1952_CD ;_. ;_. Stanbury_NP ,_, Brownell_NP ,_, Riggs_NP ,_, Perinetti_NP ,_, Itoiz_NP ,_, and_CC Del_NP Castillo_NP ,_, 1954_CD )_) ._. In_IN man_NN the_AT normal_JJ level_NN of_IN iodine_NN in_IN the_AT diet_NN and_CC the_AT level_NN necessary_JJ to_TO prevent_VB development_NN of_IN goitre_NN is_BEZ about_RB 100_CD **ymg_NN per_IN day_NN ._. With_IN low_JJR level_NNS ,_, thyroid_NN hypertrophy_NN and_CC increased_VBN thyroid_NN blood-flow_NN enable_VB the_AT thyroid_NN to_TO accumulate_VB a_AT large_JJR proportion_NN of_IN the_AT daily_JJ intake_NN of_IN iodine_NN ._. Further_RBR ,_, the_AT gland_NN is_BEZ able_JJ to_TO re-use_VB a_AT large_JJR fraction_NN of_IN the_AT thyroid_NN hormone_NN de-iodinated_VBN peripherally_RB ._. In_IN the_AT presence_NN of_IN a_AT low_JJ iodine_NN intake_NN ,_, thyroglobulin_NN labelled_VBN in_IN vivo_NN with_IN Af_NN is_BEZ found_VBN to_TO contain_VB more_AP mono-iodotyrosine_NN than_CS normal_JJ ,_, the_AT amount_NNS of_IN di-iodotyrosine_NN and_CC iodothyronine_NNS being_BEG correspondingly_RB reduced_VBN ._. This_DT appears_VBZ to_TO result_VB from_IN both_ABX a_AT reduced_VBN amount_NN of_IN the_AT iodine_NN substrate_NN and_CC a_AT more_QL rapid_JJ secretion_NN of_IN newly_RB iodinated_VBN thyroglobulin_NN ._. If_CS the_AT deficiency_NN persists_VBZ long_RB enough_QLP ,_, it_PPS is_BEZ reasonable_JJ to_TO suppose_VB that_CS the_AT Af_NN label_NN will_MD reflect_VB the_AT Af_NN distribution_NN in_IN the_AT thyroglobulin_NN ._. B_NP ._. The_AT thyroid-stimulating_JJ hormone_NN The_AT name_NN thyroid-stimulating_JJ hormone_NN (_( TSH_NP )_) ha_HVZ been_BEN given_VBN to_IN a_AT substance_NN found_VBN in_IN the_AT anterior_JJ pituitary_JJ gland_NN of_IN all_ABN specie_NNS of_IN animal_NN so_RB tested_VBN for_IN it_PP$ presence_NN ._. The_AT hormone_NN ha_HVZ also_RB been_BEN called_VBN thyrotrophin_NP or_CC thyrotrophic_JJ hormone_NN ._. At_IN the_AT present_JJ time_NN we_PPSS do_DO not_* know_VB by_IN what_WDT biochemical_JJ mechanism_NN TSH_NN act_VBZ on_IN the_AT thyroid_NN ,_, but_CC for_IN bio-assay_NN of_IN the_AT hormone_NN there_EX are_BER a_AT number_NN of_IN property_NNS by_IN which_WDT it_PP$ activity_NN may_MD be_BE estimated_VBN ,_, including_IN release_NN of_IN iodine_NN from_IN the_AT thyroid_NN ,_, increase_NN in_IN thyroid_NN weight_NN ,_, increase_NN in_IN mean_JJ height_NN of_IN the_AT follicular_JJ cell_NNS and_CC increase_NN in_IN the_AT thyroidal_JJ uptake_NN of_IN Af_NN ._. Here_RB we_PPSS shall_MD restrict_VB discussion_NN to_IN those_DTS method_NNS that_WPS appear_VB sufficiently_QL sensitive_JJ and_CC precise_JJ for_IN determining_VBG the_AT concentration_NN of_IN TSH_NN in_IN blood_NN ._. Brown_NP (_( 1959_CD )_) ha_HVZ reviewed_VBN generally_RB the_AT various_JJ method_NNS of_IN assaying_VBG TSH_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT reader_NN is_BEZ referred_VBN to_IN her_PP$ paper_NN for_IN further_AP information_NN on_IN the_AT subject_NN ._. 1_CD ._. Chemical_NN constitution_NN and_CC physical_JJ property_NNS of_IN pituitary_JJ tsh_NN As_QL long_RB ago_RB a_CS 1851_CD it_PPS wa_BEDZ pointed_VBN out_RP by_IN Niepce_NP (_( 1851_CD )_) that_CS there_EX is_BEZ a_AT connection_NN between_IN the_AT pituitary_NN and_CC the_AT thyroid_NN ._. This_DT connection_NN wa_BEDZ clarified_VBN by_IN Smith_NP and_CC Smith_NP (_( 1922_CD )_) ,_, who_WPS showed_VBD that_CS saline_NN extract_NNS of_IN fresh_JJ bovine_JJ pituitary_JJ gland_NNS could_MD re-activate_VB the_AT atrophied_VBN thyroid_NNS of_IN hypophysectomised_VBN tadpole_NNS ._. The_AT first_OD attempt_NNS to_TO isolate_VB TSH_NN came_VBD a_AT decade_NN later_RBR ,_, when_WRB Janssen_NP and_CC Loeser_NP (_( 1931_CD )_) used_VBN trichloroacetic_JJ acid_NN to_TO separate_VB the_AT soluble_JJ TSH_NN from_IN insoluble_JJ impurity_NNS ._. After_CS their_PP$ work_NN other_AP investigator_NNS applied_VBD salt-fractionation_NN technique_NNS to_IN the_AT problem_NN ,_, a_QL well_RB a_CS fractionation_NN with_IN organic_JJ solvent_NNS ,_, such_JJ a_CS acetone_NN ._. Albert_NP (_( 1949_CD )_) ha_HVZ concluded_VBN that_CS the_AT most_QL active_JJ preparation_NNS of_IN TSH_NN made_VBN during_IN this_DT period_NN ,_, from_IN 1931_CD to_IN 1945_CD ,_, were_BED probably_RB about_RB 100_CD to_IN 300_CD time_NNS a_QL potent_JJ a_CS the_AT starting_VBG material_NN ._. Much_AP of_IN this_DT work_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN reviewed_VBN by_IN White_NP (_( 1944_CD )_) and_CC by_IN Albert_NP (_( 1949_CD )_) ._. Developments_NNS up_RP to_IN about_RB 1957_CD have_HV been_BEN discussed_VBN by_IN Sonenberg_NP (_( 1958_CD )_) ._. Pierce_NP ,_, Carsten_NP and_CC Wynston_NP ,_, 1960_CD )_) ._. The_AT most_QL active_JJ preparation_NNS obtained_VBN by_IN these_DTS two_CD group_NNS of_IN investigator_NNS appear_VB to_TO be_BE similar_JJ in_IN potency_NN ,_, composition_NN and_CC physical_JJ property_NNS ._. Two_CD problem_NNS present_VB themselves_PPLS in_IN considering_VBG any_DTI hormone_NN in_IN blood_NN ._. First_RB ,_, is_BEZ the_AT circulating_VBG form_NN of_IN the_AT hormone_NN the_AT same_AP a_CS that_DT found_VBN in_IN the_AT gland_NN where_WRB it_PPS is_BEZ synthesised_VBN and_CC stored_VBN ?_. Second_RB ,_, what_WDT is_BEZ it_PP$ concentration_NN in_IN normal_JJ circumstance_NNS and_CC in_IN what_WDT circumstance_NNS will_MD this_DT concentration_NN depart_VB from_IN the_AT normal_JJ level_NN and_CC in_IN which_WDT direction_NN ?_. It_PPS is_BEZ therefore_RB necessary_JJ to_TO consider_VB the_AT property_NNS of_IN pituitary_JJ TSH_NN if_CS the_AT fragmentary_JJ chemical_NN information_NN about_IN blood_NN TSH_NN is_BEZ to_TO be_BE discussed_VBN rationally_RB ._. The_AT introduction_NN of_IN the_AT United_VBN States_NNS Pharmacopoeia_NN reference_NN standard_NN in_IN 1952_CD and_CC the_AT redefinition_NN and_CC equating_NN of_IN the_AT USP_NN and_CC international_JJ unit_NNS of_IN thyroid-stimulating_JJ activity_NN have_HV made_VBN it_PPO possible_JJ to_TO compare_VB result_NNS published_VBN by_IN different_JJ investigator_NNS since_IN that_DT time_NN ._. Standard_JJ preparation_NNS and_CC unit_NNS of_IN thyroid-stimulating_JJ activity_NN The_AT international_JJ unit_NN (_( u._NN )_) ,_, adopted_VBN to_TO make_VB possible_JJ the_AT comparison_NN of_IN result_NNS from_IN different_JJ laboratory_NNS (_( Mussett_NP and_CC Perry_NP ,_, 1955_CD )_) ,_, ha_HVZ been_BEN defined_VBN a_CS the_AT amount_NN of_IN activity_NN present_RB in_IN 13.5_CD mg_NN of_IN the_AT International_JJ Standard_JJ Preparation_NN ._. Introduction_NN Muscle_NN weakness_NN is_BEZ now_RB recognized_VBN a_CS an_AT uncommon_JJ though_CC serious_JJ complication_NN of_IN steroid_NN therapy_NN ,_, with_IN most_AP of_IN the_AT synthetic_JJ adrenal_JJ corticosteroid_NNS in_IN clinical_JJ use_NN ._. Although_CS biopsy_NNS have_HV shown_VBN structural_JJ change_NNS in_IN some_DTI of_IN the_AT reported_VBN case_NNS of_IN steroid-induced_JJ weakness_NN ,_, this_DT case_NN provides_VBZ the_AT only_AP example_NN known_VBN to_IN u_PPO in_IN which_WDT necropsy_NN afforded_VBD the_AT opportunity_NN for_IN extensive_JJ study_NN of_IN multiple_JJ muscle_NN group_NNS ._. The_AT case_NN described_VBN in_IN this_DT paper_NN is_BEZ that_DT of_IN an_AT old_JJR man_NN who_WPS developed_VBD disabling_VBG muscular_JJ weakness_NN while_CS receiving_VBG a_AT variety_NN of_IN steroid_NNS for_IN a_AT refractory_JJ anemia_NN ._. Report_NN of_IN case_NN This_DT patient_NN wa_BEDZ a_AT 65-year-old_JJ white_JJ male_JJ accountant_NN who_WPS entered_VBD the_AT New_JJ York_NP Hospital_NN for_IN his_PP$ fourth_OD and_CC terminal_JJ admission_NN on_IN June_NP 26_CD ,_, 1959_CD ,_, because_RB of_IN disabling_VBG weakness_NN and_CC general_JJ debility_NN ._. In_IN 1953_CD the_AT patient_NN developed_VBD an_AT unexplained_JJ anemia_NN for_IN which_WDT 15_CD blood_NN transfusion_NNS were_BED given_VBN over_IN a_AT period_NN of_IN 4_CD year_NNS ._. Splenomegaly_NN wa_BEDZ first_RB noted_VBN in_IN 1956_CD ,_, and_CC a_AT sternal_JJ marrow_NN biopsy_NN at_IN that_DT time_NN showed_VBD ``_`` scattered_VBN focus_NNS of_IN fibrosis_NN ''_'' suggestive_JJ of_IN myelofibrosis_NN ._. No_AT additional_JJ transfusion_NNS were_BED necessary_JJ after_IN the_AT institution_NN of_IN prednisone_NN in_IN July_NP ,_, 1957_CD ,_, in_IN an_AT initial_JJ dose_NN of_IN 40_CD mg._NNS daily_RB with_IN gradual_JJ tapering_VBG to_IN 10_CD mg._NNS daily_RB ._. This_DT medication_NN wa_BEDZ continued_VBN until_IN February_NP ,_, 1958_CD ._. In_IN February_NP ,_, 1958_CD ,_, the_AT patient_NN suffered_VBD a_AT myocardial_JJ infarction_NN complicated_VBN by_IN pulmonary_JJ edema_NN ._. Additional_JJ finding_NNS at_IN this_DT time_NN included_VBD cardiomegaly_NN ,_, peripheral_JJ arteriosclerosis_NN obliterans_VBG ,_, and_CC cholelithiasis_NN ._. The_AT hemoglobin_NN wa_BEDZ 11.6_CD gm._NNS ._. Therapy_NN included_VBD digitalization_NN and_CC anticoagulation_NN ._. Later_RBR ,_, chlorothiazide_NN and_CC salt_NN restriction_NN became_VBD necessary_JJ to_TO control_VB the_AT edema_NN of_IN chronic_JJ congestive_JJ failure_NN ._. Because_RB of_IN increasing_VBG anemia_NN ,_, triamcinolone_NN ,_, 8_CD mg._NNS daily_RB ,_, wa_BEDZ started_VBN on_IN Feb._NP 23_CD ,_, 1958_CD ,_, and_CC wa_BEDZ continued_VBN until_IN July_NP ,_, 1958_CD ._. In_IN an_AT attempt_NN to_TO reverse_VB the_AT downhill_JJ trend_NN by_IN stimulating_VBG the_AT bone_NN marrow_NN and_CC controlling_VBG any_DTI hemolytic_JJ component_NN ,_, triamcinolone_NN ,_, 16_CD mg._NNS daily_RB ,_, wa_BEDZ begun_VBN on_IN Sept._NP 26_CD ,_, 1958_CD ,_, and_CC continued_VBN until_IN Feb._NP 18_CD ,_, 1959_CD ._. At_IN first_RB the_AT patient_NN felt_VBD strong_JJR ,_, and_CC the_AT hemoglobin_NN rose_VBD to_IN 13.8_CD gm._NNS ,_, but_CC on_IN Oct._NP 20_CD ,_, 1958_CD ,_, he_PPS complained_VBD of_IN ``_`` caving_VBG in_RP ''_'' in_IN his_PP$ knee_NNS ._. Serum_NN potassium_NN at_IN this_DT time_NN wa_BEDZ 3.8_CD mEq._NN per_IN liter_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT hemoglobin_NN wa_BEDZ 13.9_CD gm._NNS By_IN Dec._NP 1_CD ,_, 1958_CD ,_, the_AT weakness_NN in_IN the_AT pelvic_JJ and_CC quadriceps_NN muscle_NN group_NNS wa_BEDZ appreciably_QL bad_JJR ,_, and_CC it_PPS became_VBD difficult_JJ for_IN the_AT patient_NN to_TO rise_VB unaided_JJ from_IN a_AT sitting_VBG or_CC reclining_VBG position_NN ._. At_IN this_DT time_NN a_AT detailed_VBN neuromuscular_JJ examination_NN revealed_VBD diffuse_JJ muscle_NN atrophy_NN that_WPS wa_BEDZ moderate_JJ in_IN the_AT hand_NNS and_CC foot_NNS ,_, but_CC marked_VBN in_IN the_AT shoulder_NNS ,_, hip_NNS ,_, and_CC pelvic_JJ girdle_NN ,_, with_IN hypoactive_JJ deep-tendon_NN reflex_NNS ._. Serial_NN serum_NN potassium_NN level_NNS remained_VBD normal_JJ ;_. ;_. the_AT serum_NN glutamic_JJ oxaloacetic_JJ transaminase_NN wa_BEDZ 10_CD unit_NNS per_IN ml._NN per_IN min._NN ._. Repeated_VBN attempt_NNS to_TO withdraw_VB steroid_NNS entirely_RB were_BED unsuccessful_JJ because_CS increased_VBN muscle_NN weakness_NN resulted_VBD ,_, a_QL well_RB a_CS fever_NN ,_, malaise_NN ,_, anorexia_NN ,_, anxiety_NN ,_, and_CC an_AT exacerbation_NN of_IN the_AT anemia_NN ._. Findings_NNS at_IN necropsy_NN The_AT body_NN wa_BEDZ that_DT of_IN a_AT well-developed_JJ ,_, somewhat_QL debilitated_VBN white_JJ man_NN weighing_VBG 108_CD lb._NNS ._. In_IN particular_JJ ,_, the_AT orifice_NNS of_IN the_AT right_JJ renal_JJ and_CC celiac_JJ artery_NNS were_BED virtually_QL occluded_VBN ,_, and_CC both_ABX calcified_VBN common_JJ iliac_JJ artery_NNS were_BED completely_QL occluded_VBN ._. The_AT lung_NNS weighed_VBD together_RB 950_CD gm._NNS ._. On_IN the_AT surface_NNS of_IN both_ABX lung_NNS there_EX were_BED emphysematous_JJ bleb_NNS measuring_VBG up_RP to_IN 3_CD cm._NNS in_IN diameter_NN ._. Microscopically_RB ,_, there_EX wa_BEDZ emphysema_NN ,_, fibrosis_NN ,_, and_CC vascular_JJ congestion_NN ._. The_AT firm_JJ red_JJ spleen_NN weighed_VBD 410_CD gm._NNS ,_, and_CC it_PP$ surface_NN wa_BEDZ mottled_VBN by_IN discrete_JJ ,_, small_JJ patch_NNS of_IN white_JJ material_NN ._. The_AT endothelial_JJ cell_NNS lining_VBG the_AT sinusoid_NNS were_BED prominent_JJ ,_, and_CC many_AP contained_VBN large_JJ quantity_NNS of_IN hemosiderin_NN ._. Some_DTI of_IN the_AT sinusoid_NNS contained_VBD large_JJ number_NNS of_IN nucleated_VBN red_JJ cell_NNS ,_, and_CC cell_NNS of_IN the_AT granulocytic_JJ series_NNS were_BED found_VBN in_IN small_JJ number_NNS ._. The_AT liver_NN weighed_VBD 2,090_CD gm._NNS ,_, wa_BEDZ brown_JJ in_IN color_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT cut_VBN surface_NN wa_BEDZ mottled_VBN by_IN irregular_JJ pale_JJ area_NNS ._. Some_DTI liver_NN cord_NN cell_NNS contained_VBD vacuolated_VBN cytoplasm_NN ,_, while_CS others_NNS had_HVD small_JJ amount_NNS of_IN brown_JJ hemosiderin_NN pigment_NN ._. A_AT careful_JJ search_NN failed_VBD to_TO show_VB occlusion_NN of_IN any_DTI of_IN the_AT mesenteric_JJ vessel_NNS ._. In_IN all_ABN of_IN the_AT section_NNS examined_VBN ,_, the_AT arteriole_NNS and_CC small_JJ artery_NNS were_BED essentially_QL normal_JJ ._. Purification_NN of_IN the_AT conjugate_NNS In_IN attempting_VBG to_TO improve_VB specificity_NN of_IN staining_VBG ,_, the_AT fluorescein-labeled_JJ antiserum_NNS used_VBN in_IN both_ABX direct_JJ and_CC indirect_JJ method_NNS were_BED treated_VBN in_IN one_CD of_IN several_AP way_NNS :_: (_( 1_CD )_) They_PPSS were_BED passed_VBN through_IN Dowex-2-chloride_NP twice_RB and_CC treated_VBN with_IN acetone_NN insoluble_JJ powder_NNS (_( Coons_NP ,_, 1958_CD )_) prepared_VBN from_IN mouse_NN liver_NN or_CC from_IN healthy_JJ sweet_JJ clover_NN stem_NNS or_CC crown_NN gall_NN tissue_NN produced_VBN by_IN Agrobacterium_NP tumefaciens_NP (_( E._NP F._NP Smith_NP &_CC Townsend_NP )_) on_IN sweet_JJ clover_NN stem_NNS ._. (_( 2_CD )_) The_AT conjugate_NNS a_QL well_RB a_CS the_AT intermediate_JJ serum_NNS were_BED absorbed_VBN for_IN 30_CD minute_NNS with_IN 20_CD -_IN 50_CD mg_NN of_IN protein_NNS extracted_VBN from_IN healthy_JJ sweet_JJ clover_NN stem_NNS ._. Preparation_NN of_IN frozen_VBN section_NNS The_AT technique_NN of_IN cutting_VBG section_NNS wa_BEDZ essentially_RB the_AT same_AP a_CS that_DT described_VBN by_IN Coons_NP et_CC al_NNS (_( 1951_CD )_) ._. Root_NN and_CC stem_NN tumor_NNS from_IN sweet_JJ clover_NN plant_NNS infected_VBN with_IN WTV_NN were_BED quick-frozen_VBN in_IN liquid_JJ nitrogen_NN ,_, embedded_VBN in_IN ice_NN ,_, and_CC cut_VBN at_IN 3_CD -_IN 6_CD **ym_NN in_IN a_AT cryostat_NN maintained_VBN at_IN -16-degrees_NNS to_IN -20-degrees_NNS ._. The_AT section_NNS were_BED mounted_VBN on_IN cold_JJ slide_NNS smeared_VBN with_IN Haupts'_NP$ adhesive_NN (_( Johansen_NP ,_, 1940_CD )_) in_IN early_JJR experiment_NNS ,_, and_CC in_IN late_JJR experiment_NNS with_IN a_AT different_JJ mixture_NN of_IN the_AT same_AP component_NNS reported_VBN by_IN Schramm_NP and_CC Rottger_NP (_( 1959_CD )_) ._. The_AT latter_AP adhesive_NN wa_BEDZ found_VBN to_TO be_BE much_QL more_QL satisfactory_JJ ._. Staining_VBG technique_NN indirect_JJ method_NN ._. The_AT section_NNS were_BED fixed_VBN in_IN acetone_NN for_IN 15_CD minute_NNS and_CC dried_VBN at_IN 37-degrees_NNS for_IN 30_CD minute_NNS ._. Some_DTI of_IN them_PPO were_BED then_RB covered_VBN with_IN a_AT drop_NN of_IN Af_NN in_IN a_AT moist_JJ chamber_NN at_IN 24-degrees_NNS for_IN 30_CD -_IN 40_CD minute_NNS ._. Direct_JJ method_NN ._. Fluorescence_NN microscopy_NN Stained_VBN or_CC unstained_JJ section_NNS were_BED examined_VBN under_IN dark_JJ field_NN illumination_NN in_IN a_AT Zeiss_NP fluorescence_NN microscope_NN equipped_VBN with_IN a_AT mercury_NN vapor_NN lamp_NN (_( Osram_NP HBO_NN 200_CD )_) ._. Results_NNS specificity_NN of_IN staining_VBG indirect_JJ method_NN ._. Such_JJ section_NNS showed_VBD bright_JJ yellow-green_JJ specific_JJ fluorescence_NN in_IN the_AT cell_NNS of_IN the_AT pseudophloem_NN tissue_NN (_( Lee_NP and_CC Black_NP ,_, 1955_CD )_) ._. This_DT specific_JJ fluorescence_NN wa_BEDZ readily_RB distinguished_VBN from_IN the_AT light_JJ green_JJ nonspecific_JJ fluorescence_NN in_IN consecutive_JJ section_NNS stained_VBN with_IN 1_CD :_IN 10_CD dilution_NN of_IN NS_NN and_CC Af_NN or_CC with_IN Af_NN alone_RB ._. When_WRB 1_CD ml_NN of_IN conjugate_NN wa_BEDZ passed_VBN through_IN a_AT column_NN (_( Af_NN )_) ,_, the_AT first_OD and_CC second_OD milliliter_NN fraction_NNS collected_VBN were_BED the_AT most_QL specific_JJ and_CC gave_VBD no_AT nonspecific_JJ staining_NN in_IN some_DTI experiment_NNS ,_, and_CC very_QL little_AP in_IN others_NNS ._. In_IN the_AT latter_AP case_NNS an_AT additional_JJ treatment_NN of_IN the_AT DEAE-cellulose-treated_NN Af_NN with_IN 50_CD mg_NN of_IN sweet_JJ clover_NN stem_NN tissue_NN powder_NN far_RBR improved_VBD the_AT specificity_NN ._. After_IN these_DTS treatment_NNS the_AT conjugate_NN did_DOD not_* stain_VB healthy_JJ or_CC crown_NN gall_NN sweet_JJ clover_NN tissue_NNS or_CC stained_VBD them_PPO a_AT very_QL faint_JJ green_NN which_WDT wa_BEDZ easily_RB distinguishable_JJ from_IN the_AT bright_JJ yellow-green_JJ specific_JJ staining_NN ._. With_IN this_DT purified_VBN conjugate_NN the_AT best_JJT staining_VBG procedure_NN consisted_VBD of_IN treating_VBG the_AT section_NNS with_IN 1_CD :_IN 10_CD dilution_NN of_IN Af_NN for_IN 30_CD minute_NNS ,_, washing_VBG with_IN PBS_NN for_IN 15_CD minute_NNS ,_, staining_VBG with_IN Af_NN for_IN 30_CD minute_NNS ,_, and_CC washing_VBG with_IN PBS_NN for_IN 15_CD minute_NNS ._. The_AT specificity_NN of_IN staining_VBG in_IN WTV_NN tumor_NNS with_IN Af_NN and_CC Af_NN but_CC not_* with_IN NS_NN and_CC Af_NN or_CC with_IN antiserum_NN to_IN potato_NN yellow-dwarf_NN virus_NN and_CC Af_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT absence_NN of_IN such_JJ staining_NN in_IN crown_NN gall_NN tumor_NN tissue_NN from_IN sweet-clover_NN ,_, indicate_VB that_CS an_AT antigen_NN of_IN WTV_NN wa_BEDZ being_BEG stained_VBN ._. Direct_JJ method_NN ._. Af_NN wa_BEDZ first_RB conjugated_VBN with_IN 50_CD mg_NN of_IN FITC_NN per_IN gram_NN of_IN globulin_NN ._. Hypothalamic_JJ balance_NN and_CC it_PP$ significance_NN After_IN this_DT brief_JJ discussion_NN of_IN neo-_JJ ,_, paleocortical_JJ ,_, and_CC cortico-hypothalamic_JJ relation_NNS ,_, let_VB u_PPO return_VB once_RB more_RBR to_IN the_AT problem_NN of_IN hypothalamic_JJ balance_NN and_CC it_PP$ physiological_JJ and_CC pathological_JJ significance_NN ._. Facilitatory_JJ process_NNS take_VB place_NN between_IN neocortex_NN and_CC hypothalamus_NN via_IN ascending_VBG and_CC descending_VBG pathway_NNS ._. Thus_RB cortico-fugal_JJ discharge_NNS induced_VBN by_IN topical_JJ application_NN of_IN strychnine_NN to_IN a_AT minute_JJ area_NN in_IN the_AT neocortex_NN summate_VB with_IN spike_NNS present_RB in_IN the_AT hypothalamus_NN and_CC cause_VB increased_VBN convulsive_JJ discharge_NNS ._. On_IN the_AT other_AP hand_NN ,_, the_AT temporary_JJ reduction_NN in_IN hypothalamic_JJ excitability_NN through_IN the_AT injection_NN of_IN a_AT barbiturate_NN into_IN the_AT posterior_JJ hypothalamus_NN cause_VBZ a_AT lessening_NN in_IN frequency_NN and_CC amplitude_NN of_IN cortical_JJ strychnine_NN spike_NNS until_CS the_AT hypothalamic_JJ excitability_NN is_BEZ restored_VBN ._. Apparently_RB ,_, a_AT positive_JJ feedback_NN exists_VBZ between_IN the_AT posterior_JJ hypothalamus_NN and_CC the_AT cerebral_JJ cortex_NN ._. Consequently_RB ,_, if_CS for_IN any_DTI reason_NN the_AT hypothalamic_JJ excitability_NN fall_VBZ below_IN the_AT physiological_JJ level_NN ,_, the_AT lessened_VBN hypothalamic-cortical_JJ discharge_NNS lead_VB to_IN a_AT diminished_VBN state_NN of_IN activity_NN in_IN the_AT cortex_NN with_IN consequent_JJ reduction_NN in_IN the_AT cortico-fugal_JJ discharge_NNS ._. Obviously_RB ,_, a_AT vicious_JJ cycle_NN develops_VBZ ._. This_DT tendency_NN can_MD be_BE broken_VBN either_CC by_IN restoring_VBG hypothalamic_JJ excitability_NN directly_RB or_CC via_IN cortico-hypothalamic_JJ pathway_NNS ._. It_PPS is_BEZ believed_VBN that_CS drug_NN therapy_NN and_CC electroshock_NN involve_VB the_AT former_AP and_CC psychotherapy_NN the_AT latter_AP mechanism_NN ._. Before_CS we_PPSS comment_VB far_RBR on_IN these_DTS pathological_JJ condition_NNS ,_, we_PPSS should_MD remember_VB that_CS change_NNS in_IN the_AT state_NN of_IN the_AT hypothalamus_NN within_IN physiological_JJ limit_NNS distinguish_VB sleep_NN from_IN wakefulness_NN ._. Thus_RB ,_, a_AT low_JJ intensity_NN of_IN hypothalamic-cortical_JJ discharge_NNS prevails_VBZ in_IN sleep_NN and_CC a_AT high_JJ one_CD during_IN wakefulness_NN ,_, resulting_VBG in_IN synchronous_JJ EEG_NN potential_NNS in_IN the_AT former_AP and_CC asynchrony_NN in_IN the_AT latter_AP condition_NN ._. Moreover_RB ,_, the_AT dominance_NN in_IN parasympathetic_JJ action_NN (_( with_IN reciprocal_JJ inhibition_NN of_IN the_AT sympathetic_JJ )_) at_IN the_AT hypothalamic_JJ level_NN induces_VBZ ,_, by_IN it_PP$ peripheral_JJ action_NN ,_, the_AT autonomic_JJ symptom_NNS of_IN sleep_NN and_CC ,_, by_IN it_PP$ action_NN on_IN the_AT cortex_NN ,_, a_AT lessening_NN in_IN the_AT reactivity_NN of_IN the_AT sensory_JJ and_CC motor_NN apparatus_NN of_IN the_AT somatic_JJ nervous_JJ system_NN ._. With_IN the_AT dominance_NN of_IN the_AT sympathetic_JJ division_NN of_IN the_AT hypothalamus_NN ,_, the_AT opposite_JJ change_NNS occur_VB ._. Since_CS electrical_JJ stimulation_NN of_IN the_AT posterior_JJ hypothalamus_NN produce_VBZ the_AT effect_NNS of_IN wakefulness_NN while_CS stimulation_NN of_IN the_AT anterior_JJ hypothalamus_NN induces_VBZ sleep_NN ,_, it_PPS may_MD be_BE said_VBN that_CS the_AT reactivity_NN of_IN the_AT whole_JJ organism_NN is_BEZ altered_VBN by_IN a_AT change_NN in_IN the_AT autonomic_JJ reactivity_NN of_IN the_AT hypothalamus_NN ._. Similar_JJ effect_NNS can_MD be_BE induced_VBN reflexly_RB via_IN the_AT baroreceptor_NN reflex_NNS in_IN man_NN and_CC animal_NNS ._. Of_IN particular_JJ importance_NN is_BEZ the_AT study_NN of_IN the_AT action_NNS of_IN drug_NNS in_IN this_DT respect_NN ._. Although_CS no_AT drug_NNS act_VB exclusively_RB on_IN the_AT hypothalamus_NN or_CC a_AT part_NN of_IN it_PPO ,_, there_EX is_BEZ sufficient_JJ specificity_NN to_TO distinguish_VB drug_NNS which_WDT shift_VB the_AT hypothalamic_JJ balance_NN to_IN the_AT sympathetic_JJ side_NN from_IN those_DTS which_WDT produce_VB a_AT parasympathetic_JJ dominance_NN ._. The_AT former_AP comprise_VB analeptic_JJ and_CC psychoactive_JJ drug_NNS ,_, the_AT latter_AP the_AT tranquilizer_NNS ._. Specific_JJ difference_NNS exist_VB in_IN the_AT action_NN of_IN different_JJ drug_NNS belonging_VBG to_IN the_AT same_AP group_NN a_CS ,_, for_IN instance_NN ,_, between_IN reserpine_NN and_CC chlorpromazine_NN ._. Important_JJ a_CS these_DTS difference_NNS are_BER ,_, they_PPSS should_MD not_* obscure_VB the_AT basic_JJ fact_NN that_CS by_IN shifting_VBG the_AT hypothalamic_JJ balance_NN sufficiently_RB to_IN the_AT parasympathetic_JJ side_NN ,_, we_PPSS produce_VB depression_NNS ,_, whereas_CS a_AT shift_NN in_IN the_AT opposite_JJ direction_NN cause_VBZ excitatory_JJ effect_NNS and_CC ,_, eventually_RB ,_, maniclike_JJ change_NNS ._. The_AT emotional_JJ state_NNS produced_VBN by_IN drug_NNS influence_VB the_AT cortical_JJ potential_NNS in_IN a_AT characteristic_JJ manner_NN ;_. ;_. synchrony_NN prevails_VBZ in_IN the_AT EEG_NN of_IN the_AT experimental_JJ animal_NN after_IN administration_NN of_IN tranquilizer_NNS ,_, but_CC asynchrony_NN after_IN application_NN of_IN analeptic_JJ and_CC psychoactive_JJ drug_NNS ._. The_AT shock_NN therapy_NNS act_VB likewise_RB on_IN the_AT hypothalamic_JJ balance_NN ._. Physiological_JJ experiment_NNS and_CC clinical_JJ observation_NNS have_HV shown_VBN that_CS these_DTS procedure_NNS influence_VB the_AT hypothalamically_RB controlled_VBN hypophyseal_JJ secretion_NNS and_CC increase_VB sympathetic_JJ discharge_NNS ._. They_PPSS shift_VB the_AT hypothalamic_JJ balance_NN to_IN the_AT sympathetic_JJ side_NN ._. This_DT explains_VBZ the_AT beneficial_JJ effect_NN of_IN electroshock_NN therapy_NN in_IN certain_AP depression_NNS and_CC a_AT shift_NN in_IN the_AT reaction_NN from_IN hypo-_JJ to_IN normal_JJ reactivity_NN of_IN the_AT sympathetic_JJ system_NN a_CS shown_VBN by_IN the_AT Mecholyl_NP test_NN ._. Some_DTI investigator_NNS have_HV found_VBN a_AT parallelism_NN between_IN remission_NNS and_CC return_NN of_IN the_AT sympathetic_JJ reactivity_NN of_IN the_AT hypothalamus_NN to_IN the_AT normal_JJ level_NN a_CS indicated_VBN by_IN the_AT Mecholyl_NP test_NN and_CC ,_, conversely_RB ,_, between_IN clinical_JJ impairment_NN and_CC increasing_VBG deviation_NN of_IN this_DT test_NN from_IN the_AT norm_NN ._. Nevertheless_RB ,_, the_AT theory_NN that_CS the_AT determining_VBG influence_NN of_IN the_AT hypothalamic_JJ balance_NN ha_HVZ a_AT profound_JJ influence_NN on_IN the_AT clinical_JJ behavior_NN of_IN neuropsychiatric_JJ patient_NNS ha_HVZ not_* yet_RB been_BEN tested_VBN on_IN an_AT adequate_JJ number_NN of_IN patient_NNS ._. The_AT Mecholyl_NP and_CC noradrenalin_NN test_NNS applied_VBN with_IN certain_AP precaution_NNS are_BER reliable_JJ indicator_NNS of_IN this_DT central_JJ autonomic_JJ balance_NN ,_, but_CC for_IN the_AT sake_NN of_IN correlating_VBG autonomic_JJ and_CC clinical_JJ state_NNS ,_, and_CC of_IN studying_VBG the_AT effect_NN of_IN certain_AP therapeutic_JJ procedure_NNS on_IN central_JJ autonomic_JJ reaction_NNS ,_, additional_JJ test_NNS seem_VB to_TO be_BE desirable_JJ ._. It_PPS wa_BEDZ assumed_VBN that_CS the_AT shift_NN in_IN autonomic_JJ hypothalamic_JJ balance_NN occurring_VBG spontaneously_RB in_IN neuropsychiatric_JJ patient_NNS from_IN the_AT application_NN of_IN certain_AP therapeutic_JJ procedure_NNS follows_VBZ the_AT pattern_NN known_VBN from_IN the_AT sleep-wakefulness_NN cycle_NN ._. A_AT change_NN in_IN the_AT balance_NN to_IN the_AT parasympathetic_JJ side_NN lead_VBZ in_IN the_AT normal_JJ individual_NN to_IN sleep_NN or_CC ,_, in_IN special_JJ circumstance_NNS ,_, to_IN cardiovascular_JJ collapse_NN or_CC nausea_NN and_CC vomiting_VBG ._. In_IN both_ABX condition_NNS the_AT emotional_JJ and_CC perceptual_JJ sensitivity_NN is_BEZ diminished_VBN ,_, but_CC no_AT depression_NN occurs_VBZ such_JJ a_CS is_BEZ seen_VBN clinically_RB or_CC may_MD be_BE produced_VBN in_IN normal_JJ person_NNS by_IN drug_NNS ._. The_AT fundamental_JJ difference_NNS between_IN physiological_JJ and_CC pathological_JJ state_NNS of_IN parasympathetic_JJ (_( and_CC also_RB of_IN sympathetic_JJ )_) dominance_NN remain_VB to_TO be_BE elucidated_VBN ._. Perhaps_RB a_AT clue_NN to_IN these_DTS and_CC related_VBN problem_NNS lie_VBZ in_IN the_AT fact_NN that_CS change_NNS in_IN the_AT intensity_NN of_IN hypothalamic_JJ discharge_NNS which_WDT are_BER associated_VBN with_IN change_NNS in_IN it_PP$ balance_NN lead_VB also_RB to_IN qualitative_JJ alteration_NNS in_IN reactivity_NN ._. A_AT state_NN of_IN parasympathetic_JJ ``_`` tuning_NN ''_'' of_IN the_AT hypothalamus_NN induced_VBN experimentally_RB cause_VBZ not_* only_RB an_AT increase_NN in_IN the_AT parsympathetic_JJ reactivity_NN of_IN this_DT structure_NN to_IN direct_JJ and_CC reflexly_RB induced_VBN stimulus_NNS ,_, but_CC lead_VBZ also_RB to_IN an_AT autonomic_JJ reversal_NN :_: a_AT stimulus_NN acting_VBG sympathetically_RB under_IN control_NN condition_NNS elicits_VBZ in_IN this_DT state_NN of_IN tuning_VBG a_AT parasympathetic_JJ response_NN !_. Furthermore_RB ,_, conditioned_VBN reaction_NNS are_BER fundamentally_RB altered_VBN when_WRB the_AT hypothalamic_JJ sympathetic_JJ reactivity_NN is_BEZ augmented_VBN beyond_IN a_AT critical_JJ level_NN ,_, and_CC several_AP type_NNS of_IN behavioral_JJ change_NNS probably_RB related_VBN to_IN the_AT degree_NN of_IN central_JJ autonomic_JJ ``_`` tuning_NN ''_'' are_BER observed_VBN ._. If_CS ,_, for_IN instance_NN ,_, such_ABL a_AT change_NN is_BEZ produced_VBN by_IN one_CD or_CC a_AT few_AP insulin_NN coma_NNS or_CC electroshock_NNS ,_, previously_RB inhibited_VBN conditioned_VBN reaction_NNS reappear_VB ._. However_RB ,_, if_CS these_DTS procedure_NNS are_BER applied_VBN more_QL often_RB ,_, conditioned_VBN emotional_JJ response_NNS are_BER temporarily_RB abolished_VBN ._. In_IN other_AP study_NNS ,_, loss_NN of_IN differentiation_NN in_IN previously_RB established_VBN conditioned_VBN reflex_NNS resulted_VBD from_IN repeated_VBN convulsive_JJ (_( metrazol_NN )_) treatment_NNS ,_, suggesting_VBG a_AT fundamental_JJ disturbance_NN in_IN the_AT balance_NN between_IN excitatory_JJ and_CC inhibitory_JJ cerebral_JJ process_NNS ._. It_PPS ha_HVZ far_RBR been_BEN shown_VBN that_CS :_: (_( 1_CD )_) an_AT experimental_JJ neurosis_NN in_IN it_PP$ initial_JJ stage_NNS is_BEZ associated_VBN with_IN a_AT reversible_JJ shift_NN in_IN the_AT central_JJ autonomic_JJ balance_NN ;_. ;_. From_IN these_DTS result_NNS ,_, one_PN see_VBZ that_CS the_AT study_NN of_IN linear_JJ operator_NNS on_IN vector_NN space_NNS over_IN an_AT algebraically_RB closed_VBN field_NN is_BEZ essentially_RB reduced_VBN to_IN the_AT study_NN of_IN nilpotent_JJ operator_NNS ._. It_PPS is_BEZ a_AT very_QL interesting_JJ fact_NN that_CS these_DTS two_CD problem_NNS can_MD be_BE handled_VBN simultaneously_RB and_CC this_DT is_BEZ what_WDT we_PPSS shall_MD do_DO in_IN the_AT next_AP chapter_NN ._. In_IN concluding_VBG this_DT section_NN ,_, we_PPSS should_MD like_VB to_TO give_VB an_AT example_NN which_WDT illustrates_VBZ some_DTI of_IN the_AT idea_NNS of_IN the_AT primary_JJ decomposition_NN theorem_NN ._. Example_NN 11_CD ._. In_IN the_AT primary_JJ decomposition_NN theorem_NN ,_, it_PPS is_BEZ not_* necessary_JJ that_CS the_AT vector_NN space_NN V_NN be_BE finite_JJ dimensional_JJ ,_, nor_CC is_BEZ it_PPS necessary_JJ for_IN part_NNS (_( A_NP )_) and_CC (_( B_NP )_) that_CS P_NP be_BE the_AT minimal_JJ polynomial_NN for_IN T_NN ._. If_CS T_NN is_BEZ a_AT linear_JJ operator_NN on_IN an_AT arbitrary_JJ vector_NN space_NN and_CC if_CS there_EX is_BEZ a_AT monic_JJ polynomial_NN P_NP such_JJ that_CS Af_NN ,_, then_RB part_NNS (_( A_NP )_) and_CC (_( B_NP )_) of_IN Theorem_NN 12_CD are_BER valid_JJ for_IN T_NN with_IN the_AT proof_NN which_WDT we_PPSS gave_VBD ._. Let_VB N_NN be_BE a_AT positive_JJ integer_NN and_CC let_VB V_NN be_BE the_AT space_NN of_IN all_ABN N_NN time_NNS continuously_RB differentiable_JJ function_NNS F_NP on_IN the_AT real_JJ line_NN which_WDT satisfy_VB the_AT differential_JJ equation_NN Af_NN where_WRB Af_NN are_BER some_DTI fixed_VBN constant_NNS ._. If_CS Af_NN denotes_VBZ the_AT space_NN of_IN N_NN time_NNS continuously_RB differentiable_JJ function_NNS ,_, then_RB the_AT space_NN V_NN of_IN solution_NNS of_IN this_DT differential_JJ equation_NN is_BEZ a_AT subspace_NN of_IN Af_NN ._. If_CS D_NN denotes_VBZ the_AT differentiation_NN operator_NN and_CC P_NP is_BEZ the_AT polynomial_NN Af_NN then_RB V_NN is_BEZ the_AT null_JJ space_NN of_IN the_AT operator_NN p_NN (_( ,_, )_) ,_, because_CS Af_NN simply_RB say_VBZ Af_NN ._. Let_VB u_PPO now_RB regard_VB D_NN a_CS a_AT linear_JJ operator_NN on_IN the_AT subspace_NN V_NN ._. Then_RB Af_NN ._. If_CS we_PPSS are_BER discussing_VBG differentiable_JJ complex-valued_JJ function_NNS ,_, then_JJ Af_NN and_CC V_NN are_BER complex_JJ vector_NN space_NNS ,_, and_CC Af_NN may_MD be_BE any_DTI complex_JJ number_NNS ._. We_PPSS now_RB write_VB Af_NN where_WRB Af_NN are_BER distinct_JJ complex_JJ number_NNS ._. If_CS Af_NN is_BEZ the_AT null_JJ space_NN of_IN Af_NN ,_, then_RB Theorem_NN 12_CD say_VBZ that_CS Af_NN ._. In_IN other_AP word_NNS ,_, if_CS F_NP satisfies_VBZ the_AT differential_JJ equation_NN Af_NN ,_, then_RB F_NP is_BEZ uniquely_RB expressible_JJ in_IN the_AT form_NN Af_NN where_WRB Af_NN satisfies_VBZ the_AT differential_JJ equation_NN Af_NN ._. Thus_RB ,_, the_AT study_NN of_IN the_AT solution_NNS to_IN the_AT equation_NN Af_NN is_BEZ reduced_VBN to_IN the_AT study_NN of_IN the_AT space_NN of_IN solution_NNS of_IN a_AT differential_JJ equation_NN of_IN the_AT form_NN Af_NN ._. This_DT reduction_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN accomplished_VBN by_IN the_AT general_JJ method_NNS of_IN linear_JJ algebra_NN ,_, i.e._RB ,_, by_IN the_AT primary_JJ decomposition_NN theorem_NN ._. To_TO describe_VB the_AT space_NN of_IN solution_NNS to_IN Af_NN ,_, one_PN must_MD know_VB something_PN about_IN differential_JJ equation_NNS ;_. ;_. that_DT is_BEZ ,_, one_PN must_MD know_VB something_PN about_IN D_NN other_AP than_CS the_AT fact_NN that_CS it_PPS is_BEZ a_AT linear_JJ operator_NN ._. However_RB ,_, one_PN doe_DOZ not_* need_VB to_TO know_VB very_QL much_AP ._. Thus_RB Af_NN if_CS and_CC only_RB if_CS Af_NN ._. A_AT function_NN G_NP such_JJ that_CS Af_NN ,_, i.e._RB ,_, Af_NN ,_, must_MD be_BE a_AT polynomial_JJ function_NN of_IN degree_NN Af_NN or_CC le_AP :_: Af_NN ._. Thus_RB F_NP satisfies_VBZ Af_NN if_CS and_CC only_RB if_CS F_NP ha_HVZ the_AT form_NN Af_NN ._. Examples_NNS of_IN binomial_JJ experiment_NNS Some_DTI experiment_NNS are_BER composed_VBN of_IN repetition_NNS of_IN independent_JJ trial_NNS ,_, each_DT with_IN two_CD possible_JJ outcome_NNS ._. The_AT binomial_JJ probability_NN distribution_NN may_MD describe_VB the_AT variation_NN that_WPS occurs_VBZ from_IN one_CD set_NN of_IN trial_NNS of_IN such_ABL a_AT binomial_JJ experiment_NN to_IN another_DT ._. We_PPSS devote_VB a_AT chapter_NN to_IN the_AT binomial_JJ distribution_NN not_* only_RB because_CS it_PPS is_BEZ a_AT mathematical_JJ model_NN for_IN an_AT enormous_JJ variety_NN of_IN real_JJ life_NN phenomenon_NNS ,_, but_CC also_RB because_CS it_PPS ha_HVZ important_JJ property_NNS that_WPS recur_VB in_IN many_AP other_AP probability_NN model_NNS ._. We_PPSS begin_VB with_IN a_AT few_AP example_NNS of_IN binomial_JJ experiment_NNS ._. Marksmanship_NN example_NN ._. A_AT trained_VBN marksman_NN shooting_VBG five_CD round_NNS at_IN a_AT target_NN ,_, all_ABN under_IN practically_RB the_AT same_AP condition_NNS ,_, may_MD hit_VB the_AT bull's-eye_NN from_IN 0_CD to_IN 5_CD time_NNS ._. In_IN repeated_VBN set_NNS of_IN five_CD shot_NNS his_PP$ number_NNS of_IN bull's-eye_NNS vary_VB ._. What_WDT can_MD we_PPSS say_VB of_IN the_AT probability_NNS of_IN the_AT different_JJ possible_JJ number_NNS of_IN bull's-eye_NNS ?_. Inheritance_NN in_IN mouse_NNS ._. In_IN litter_NNS of_IN eight_CD mouse_NNS from_IN similar_JJ parent_NNS ,_, the_AT number_NN of_IN mouse_NNS with_IN straight_JJ instead_RB of_IN wavy_JJ hair_NN is_BEZ an_AT integer_NN from_IN 0_CD to_IN 8_CD ._. What_WDT probability_NNS should_MD be_BE attached_VBN to_IN these_DTS possible_JJ outcome_NNS ?_. Aces_NNS (_( one_NNS )_) with_IN three_CD dice_NNS ._. When_WRB three_CD dice_NNS are_BER tossed_VBN repeatedly_RB ,_, what_WDT is_BEZ the_AT probability_NN that_CS the_AT number_NN of_IN ace_NNS is_BEZ 0_CD (_( or_CC 1_CD ,_, or_CC 2_CD ,_, or_CC 3_CD )_) ?_. General_JJ binomial_JJ problem_NN ._. More_QL generally_RB ,_, suppose_VB that_CS an_AT experiment_NN consists_VBZ of_IN a_AT number_NN of_IN independent_JJ trial_NNS ,_, that_CS each_DT trial_NN result_VBZ in_IN either_CC a_AT ``_`` success_NN ''_'' or_CC a_AT ``_`` non-success_NN ''_'' (_( ``_`` failure_NN ''_'' )_) ,_, and_CC that_CS the_AT probability_NN of_IN success_NN remains_VBZ constant_JJ from_IN trial_NN to_IN trial_NN ._. In_IN the_AT example_NNS above_RB ,_, the_AT occurrence_NN of_IN a_AT bull's-eye_NN ,_, a_AT straight-haired_JJ mouse_NN ,_, or_CC an_AT ace_NN could_MD be_BE called_VBN a_AT ``_`` success_NN ''_'' ._. In_IN general_JJ ,_, any_DTI outcome_NN we_PPSS choose_VB may_MD be_BE labeled_VBN ``_`` success_NN ''_'' ._. The_AT major_JJ question_NN in_IN this_DT chapter_NN is_BEZ :_: What_WDT is_BEZ the_AT probability_NN of_IN exactly_RB X_NP success_NNS in_IN N_NP trial_NNS ?_. In_IN Chapters_NNS 3_CD and_CC 4_CD we_PPSS answered_VBD question_NNS like_CS those_DTS in_IN the_AT example_NNS ,_, usually_RB by_IN counting_VBG point_NNS in_IN a_AT sample_NN space_NN ._. Fortunately_RB ,_, a_AT general_JJ formula_NN of_IN wide_JJ applicability_NN solves_VBZ all_ABN problem_NNS of_IN this_DT kind_NN ._. Before_CS deriving_VBG this_DT formula_NN ,_, we_PPSS explain_VB what_WDT we_PPSS mean_VB by_IN ``_`` problem_NNS of_IN this_DT kind_NN ''_'' ._. Experiments_NNS are_BER often_RB composed_VBN of_IN several_AP identical_JJ trial_NNS ,_, and_CC sometimes_RB experiment_NNS themselves_PPLS are_BER repeated_VBN ._. In_IN the_AT marksmanship_NN example_NN ,_, a_AT trial_NN consists_VBZ of_IN ``_`` one_CD round_NN shot_VBN at_IN a_AT target_NN ''_'' with_IN outcome_NN either_CC one_CD bull's-eye_NN (_( success_NN )_) or_CC none_PN (_( failure_NN )_) ._. Further_RBR ,_, an_AT experiment_NN might_MD consist_VB of_IN five_CD round_NNS ,_, and_CC several_AP set_NNS of_IN five_CD round_NNS might_MD be_BE regarded_VBN a_CS a_AT super-experiment_NN composed_VBN of_IN several_AP repetition_NNS of_IN the_AT five-round_JJ experiment_NN ._. If_CS three_CD dice_NNS are_BER tossed_VBN ,_, a_AT trial_NN is_BEZ one_CD toss_NN of_IN one_CD die_NN and_CC the_AT experiment_NN is_BEZ composed_VBN of_IN three_CD trial_NNS ._. Or_CC ,_, what_WDT amount_VBZ to_IN the_AT same_AP thing_NN ,_, if_CS one_CD die_NN is_BEZ tossed_VBN three_CD time_NNS ,_, each_DT toss_NN is_BEZ a_AT trial_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT three_CD toss_NNS form_VB the_AT experiment_NN ._. Mathematically_RB ,_, we_PPSS shall_MD not_* distinguish_VB the_AT experiment_NN of_IN three_CD dice_NNS tossed_VBN once_RB from_IN that_DT of_IN one_CD die_NN tossed_VBN three_CD time_NNS ._. These_DTS example_NNS are_BER illustrative_JJ of_IN the_AT use_NN of_IN the_AT word_NNS ``_`` trial_NN ''_'' and_CC ``_`` experiment_NN ''_'' a_CS they_PPSS are_BER used_VBN in_IN this_DT chapter_NN ,_, but_CC they_PPSS are_BER quite_QL flexible_JJ word_NNS and_CC it_PPS is_BEZ well_RB not_* to_TO restrict_VB them_PPO too_QL narrowly_RB ._. Example_NN 1_CD ._. Student_NN football_NN manager_NNS ._. Ten_CD student_NNS act_VB a_CS manager_NNS for_IN a_AT high-school_NN football_NN team_NN ,_, and_CC of_IN these_DTS manager_NNS a_AT proportion_NN P_NP are_BER licensed_VBN driver_NNS ._. Each_DT Friday_NR one_CD manager_NN is_BEZ chosen_VBN by_IN lot_NN to_TO stay_VB late_RB and_CC load_VB the_AT equipment_NN on_IN a_AT truck_NN ._. On_IN three_CD Fridays_NRS the_AT coach_NN ha_HVZ needed_VBN a_AT driver_NN ._. Considering_IN only_RB these_DTS Fridays_NRS ,_, what_WDT is_BEZ the_AT probability_NN that_CS the_AT coach_NN had_HVD driver_NNS all_ABN 3_CD time_NNS ?_. Exactly_RB 2_CD time_NNS ?_. 1_CD time_NN ?_. 0_CD time_NNS ?_. Discussion_NN ._. Note_VB that_CS there_EX are_BER 3_CD trial_NNS of_IN interest_NN ._. Each_DT trial_NN consists_VBZ of_IN choosing_VBG a_AT student_NN manager_NN at_IN random_NN ._. The_AT 2_CD possible_JJ outcome_NNS on_IN each_DT trial_NN are_BER ``_`` driver_NN ''_'' or_CC ``_`` nondriver_NN ''_'' ._. Since_CS the_AT choice_NN is_BEZ by_IN lot_NN each_DT week_NN ,_, the_AT outcome_NNS of_IN different_JJ trial_NNS are_BER independent_JJ ._. The_AT manager_NNS stay_VB the_AT same_AP ,_, so_CS that_CS Af_NN is_BEZ the_AT same_AP for_IN all_ABN week_NNS ._. We_PPSS now_RB generalize_VB these_DTS idea_NNS for_IN general_JJ binomial_JJ experiment_NNS ._. For_IN an_AT experiment_NN to_TO qualify_VB a_CS a_AT binomial_JJ experiment_NN ,_, it_PPS must_MD have_HV four_CD property_NNS :_: (_( 1_CD )_) there_EX must_MD be_BE a_AT fixed_VBN number_NN of_IN trial_NNS ,_, (_( 2_CD )_) each_DT trial_NN must_MD result_VB in_IN a_AT ``_`` success_NN ''_'' or_CC a_AT ``_`` failure_NN ''_'' (_( a_AT binomial_JJ trial_NN )_) ,_, (_( 3_CD )_) all_ABN trial_NNS must_MD have_HV identical_JJ probability_NNS of_IN success_NN ,_, (_( 4_CD )_) the_AT trial_NNS must_MD be_BE independent_JJ of_IN each_DT other_AP ._. Below_RB we_PPSS use_VB our_PP$ early_JJR example_NNS to_TO describe_VB and_CC illustrate_VB these_DTS four_CD property_NNS ._. We_PPSS also_RB give_VB ,_, for_IN each_DT property_NN ,_, an_AT example_NN where_WRB the_AT property_NN is_BEZ absent_JJ ._. The_AT language_NN and_CC notation_NN introduced_VBN are_BER standard_JJ throughout_IN the_AT chapter_NN ._. 1_CD ._. There_EX must_MD be_BE a_AT fixed_VBN number_NN n_NN of_IN repeated_VBN trial_NNS ._. For_IN the_AT marksman_NN ,_, we_PPSS study_VB set_NNS of_IN five_CD shot_NNS (_( Af_NN )_) ;_. ;_. for_IN the_AT mouse_NNS ,_, we_PPSS restrict_VB attention_NN to_IN litter_NNS of_IN eight_CD (_( Af_NN )_) ;_. ;_. and_CC for_IN the_AT ace_NNS ,_, we_PPSS toss_VB three_CD dice_NNS (_( Af_NN )_) ._. Experiment_NN without_IN a_AT fixed_VBN number_NN of_IN trial_NNS ._. Toss_VB a_AT die_NN until_CS an_AT ace_NN appears_VBZ ._. Here_RB the_AT number_NN of_IN trial_NNS is_BEZ a_AT random_JJ variable_NN ,_, not_* a_AT fixed_VBN number_NN ._. 2_CD ._. Binomial_JJ trial_NNS ._. Each_DT of_IN the_AT N_NN trial_NNS is_BEZ either_CC a_AT success_NN or_CC a_AT failure_NN ._. ``_`` Success_NN ''_'' and_CC ``_`` failure_NN ''_'' are_BER just_RB convenient_JJ label_NNS for_IN the_AT two_CD category_NNS of_IN outcome_NNS when_WRB we_PPSS talk_VB about_IN binomial_JJ trial_NNS in_IN general_JJ ._. These_DTS word_NNS are_BER more_QL expressive_JJ than_CS label_NNS like_VB ``_`` A_NP ''_'' and_CC ``_`` not-A_NP ''_'' ._. It_PPS is_BEZ natural_JJ from_IN the_AT marksman's_NN$ viewpoint_NN to_IN call_NN a_AT bull's-eye_NN a_AT success_NN ,_, but_CC in_IN the_AT mouse_NNS example_NN it_PPS is_BEZ arbitrary_JJ which_WDT category_NN corresponds_VBZ to_IN straight_JJ hair_NN in_IN a_AT mouse_NN ._. The_AT word_NN ``_`` binomial_JJ ''_'' mean_VBZ ``_`` of_IN two_CD name_NNS ''_'' or_CC ``_`` of_IN two_CD term_NNS ''_'' ,_, and_CC both_ABX usage_NNS apply_VB in_IN our_PP$ work_NN :_: the_AT first_OD to_IN the_AT name_NNS of_IN the_AT two_CD outcome_NNS of_IN a_AT binomial_JJ trial_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT second_OD to_IN the_AT term_NNS P_NP and_CC Af_NN that_WPS represent_VB the_AT probability_NNS of_IN ``_`` success_NN ''_'' and_CC ``_`` failure_NN ''_'' ._. Sometimes_RB when_WRB there_EX are_BER many_AP outcome_NNS for_IN a_AT single_AP trial_NN ,_, we_PPSS group_VB these_DTS outcome_NNS into_IN two_CD class_NNS ,_, a_CS in_IN the_AT example_NN of_IN the_AT die_NN ,_, where_WRB we_PPSS have_HV arbitrarily_RB constructed_VBN the_AT class_NNS ``_`` ace_NN ''_'' and_CC ``_`` not-ace_NN ''_'' ._. Experiment_NN without_IN the_AT two-class_JJ property_NN ._. We_PPSS classify_VB mouse_NNS a_CS ``_`` straight-haired_JJ ''_'' or_CC ``_`` wavy-haired_JJ ''_'' ,_, but_CC a_AT hairless_JJ mouse_NN appears_VBZ ._. We_PPSS can_MD escape_VB from_IN such_ABL a_AT difficulty_NN by_IN ruling_VBG out_RP the_AT animal_NN a_CS not_* constituting_VBG a_AT trial_NN ,_, but_CC such_ABL a_AT solution_NN is_BEZ not_* always_RB satisfactory_JJ ._. 3_CD ._. All_ABN trial_NNS have_HV identical_JJ probability_NNS of_IN success_NN ._. Each_DT die_NN ha_HVZ probability_NN Af_NN of_IN producing_VBG an_AT ace_NN ;_. ;_. the_AT marksman_NN ha_HVZ some_DTI probability_NN p_NN ,_, perhaps_RB 0.1_CD ,_, of_IN making_VBG a_AT bull's-eye_NN ._. Note_VB that_CS we_PPSS need_MD not_* know_VB the_AT value_NN of_IN p_NN ,_, for_CS the_AT experiment_NN to_TO be_BE binomial_JJ ._. Experiment_NN where_WRB p_NN is_BEZ not_* constant_JJ ._. During_IN a_AT round_NN of_IN target_NN practice_NN the_AT sun_NN come_VBZ from_IN behind_IN a_AT cloud_NN and_CC dazzle_VBZ the_AT marksman_NN ,_, lowering_VBG his_PP$ chance_NN of_IN a_AT bull's-eye_NN ._. 4_CD ._. The_AT trial_NNS are_BER independent_JJ ._. Strictly_RB speaking_VBG ,_, this_DT mean_VBZ that_CS the_AT probability_NN for_IN each_DT possible_JJ outcome_NN of_IN the_AT experiment_NN can_MD be_BE computed_VBN by_IN multiplying_VBG together_RB the_AT probability_NNS of_IN the_AT possible_JJ outcome_NNS of_IN the_AT single_AP binomial_JJ trial_NNS ._. Thus_RB in_IN the_AT three-dice_NN example_NN Af_NN ,_, Af_NN ,_, and_CC the_AT independence_NN assumption_NN imply_VB that_CS the_AT probability_NN that_CS the_AT three_CD dice_NNS fall_VB ace_NN ,_, not-ace_NN ,_, ace_NN in_IN that_DT order_NN is_BEZ Af_NN ._. Experimentally_RB ,_, we_PPSS expect_VB independence_NN when_WRB the_AT trial_NNS have_HV nothing_PN to_TO do_DO with_IN one_CD another_DT ._. Examples_NNS where_WRB independence_NN fails_VBZ ._. A_AT family_NN of_IN five_CD plan_VBZ to_TO go_VB together_RB either_CC to_IN the_AT beach_NN or_CC to_IN the_AT mountain_NNS ,_, and_CC a_AT coin_NN is_BEZ tossed_VBN to_TO decide_VB ._. We_PPSS want_VB to_TO know_VB the_AT number_NN of_IN people_NNS going_VBG to_IN the_AT mountain_NNS ._. When_WRB this_DT experiment_NN is_BEZ viewed_VBN a_CS composed_VBN of_IN five_CD binomial_JJ trial_NNS ,_, one_CD for_IN each_DT member_NN of_IN the_AT family_NN ,_, the_AT outcome_NNS of_IN the_AT trial_NNS are_BER obviously_RB not_* independent_JJ ._. Indeed_RB ,_, the_AT experiment_NN is_BEZ well_RBR viewed_VBN a_CS consisting_VBG of_IN one_CD binomial_JJ trial_NN for_IN the_AT entire_JJ family_NN ._. The_AT following_VBG is_BEZ a_AT le_QL extreme_JJ example_NN of_IN dependence_NN ._. Consider_VB couple_NNS visiting_VBG an_AT art_NN museum_NN ._. Each_DT person_NN vote_VBZ for_IN one_CD of_IN a_AT pair_NN of_IN picture_NNS to_TO receive_VB a_AT popular_JJ prize_NN ._. Voting_VBG for_IN one_CD picture_NN may_MD be_BE called_VBN ``_`` success_NN ''_'' ,_, for_IN the_AT other_AP ``_`` failure_NN ''_'' ._. An_AT experiment_NN consists_VBZ of_IN the_AT voting_NN of_IN one_CD couple_NN ,_, or_CC two_CD trial_NNS ._. In_IN repetition_NNS of_IN the_AT experiment_NN from_IN couple_NN to_IN couple_NN ,_, the_AT vote_NNS of_IN the_AT two_CD person_NNS in_IN a_AT couple_NN probably_RB agree_VB more_QL often_RB than_CS independence_NN would_MD imply_VB ,_, because_CS couple_NNS who_WPS visit_VB the_AT museum_NN together_RB are_BER more_QL likely_JJ to_TO have_HV similar_JJ taste_NNS than_CS are_BER a_AT random_JJ pair_NN of_IN people_NNS drawn_VBN from_IN the_AT entire_JJ population_NN of_IN visitor_NNS ._. Table_NN 7-1_CD illustrates_VBZ the_AT point_NN ._. The_AT table_NN show_VBZ that_CS 0.6_CD of_IN the_AT boy_NNS and_CC 0.6_CD of_IN the_AT girl_NNS vote_VB for_IN picture_NN A_NN ._. Therefore_RB ,_, under_IN independent_JJ voting_NN ,_, Af_NN or_CC 0.36_CD of_IN the_AT couple_NNS would_MD cast_VB two_CD vote_NNS for_IN picture_NN A_NN ,_, and_CC Af_NN or_CC 0.16_CD would_MD cast_VB two_CD vote_NNS for_IN picture_NN B_NN ._. Thus_RB in_IN independent_JJ voting_NN ,_, Af_NN or_CC 0.52_CD of_IN the_AT couple_NNS would_MD agree_VB ._. But_CC Table_NN 7-1_CD show_VBZ that_DT Af_NN or_CC 0.70_CD agree_VB ,_, too_QL many_AP for_IN independent_JJ voting_NN ._. Each_DT performance_NN of_IN an_AT n-trial_NN binomial_JJ experiment_NN result_VBZ in_IN some_DTI whole_JJ number_NN from_IN 0_CD through_IN N_NP a_CS the_AT value_NN of_IN the_AT random_JJ variable_NN X_NN ,_, where_WRB Af_NN ._. We_PPSS want_VB to_TO study_VB the_AT probability_NN function_NN of_IN this_DT random_JJ variable_NN ._. For_IN example_NN ,_, we_PPSS are_BER interested_VBN in_IN the_AT number_NN of_IN bull's-eye_NNS ,_, not_* which_WDT shot_NNS were_BED bull's-eye_NNS ._. A_AT binomial_JJ experiment_NN can_MD produce_VB random_JJ variable_NNS other_AP than_CS the_AT number_NN of_IN success_NNS ._. For_IN example_NN ,_, the_AT marksman_NN get_VBZ 5_CD shot_NNS ,_, but_CC we_PPSS take_VB his_PP$ score_NN to_TO be_BE the_AT number_NN of_IN shot_NNS before_IN his_PP$ first_OD bull's-eye_NN ,_, that_DT is_BEZ ,_, 0_CD ,_, 1_CD ,_, 2_CD ,_, 3_CD ,_, 4_CD (_( or_CC 5_CD ,_, if_CS he_PPS get_VBZ no_AT bull's-eye_NN )_) ._. Thus_RB we_PPSS do_DO not_* score_VB the_AT number_NN of_IN bull's-eye_NNS ,_, and_CC the_AT random_JJ variable_NN is_BEZ not_* the_AT number_NN of_IN success_NNS ._. The_AT constancy_NN of_IN P_NP and_CC the_AT independence_NN are_BER the_AT condition_NNS most_QL likely_JJ to_TO give_VB trouble_NN in_IN practice_NN ._. Obviously_RB ,_, very_QL slight_JJ change_NNS in_IN P_NP do_DO not_* change_VB the_AT probability_NNS much_RB ,_, and_CC a_AT slight_JJ lack_NN of_IN independence_NN may_MD not_* make_VB an_AT appreciable_JJ difference_NN ._. (_( For_IN instance_NN ,_, see_VB Example_NN 2_CD of_IN Section_NN 5-5_CD ,_, on_IN red_JJ card_NNS in_IN hand_NNS of_IN 5_CD ._. )_) On_IN the_AT other_AP hand_NN ,_, even_RB when_WRB the_AT binomial_JJ model_NN doe_DOZ not_* describe_VB well_RB the_AT physical_JJ phenomenon_NN being_BEG studied_VBN ,_, the_AT binomial_JJ model_NN may_MD still_RB be_BE used_VBN a_CS a_AT baseline_NN for_IN comparative_JJ purpose_NNS ;_. ;_. that_DT is_BEZ ,_, we_PPSS may_MD discus_VB the_AT phenomenon_NN in_IN term_NNS of_IN it_PP$ departure_NNS from_IN the_AT binomial_JJ model_NN ._. To_TO summarize_VB :_: A_AT binomial_JJ experiment_NN consists_VBZ of_IN Af_NN independent_JJ binomial_JJ trial_NNS ,_, all_ABN with_IN the_AT same_AP probability_NN Af_NN of_IN yielding_VBG a_AT success_NN ._. The_AT outcome_NN of_IN the_AT experiment_NN is_BEZ X_NN success_NNS ._. The_AT random_JJ variable_NN X_NN take_VBZ the_AT value_NNS Af_NN with_IN probability_NNS Af_NN or_CC ,_, more_QL briefly_RB Af_NN ._. We_PPSS shall_MD find_VB a_AT formula_NN for_IN the_AT probability_NN of_IN exactly_RB X_NP success_NNS for_IN given_VBN value_NNS of_IN P_NP and_CC N_NP ._. When_WRB each_DT number_NN of_IN success_NNS X_NP is_BEZ paired_VBN with_IN it_PP$ probability_NN of_IN occurrence_NN Af_NN ,_, the_AT set_NN of_IN pair_NNS Af_NN ,_, is_BEZ a_AT probability_NN function_NN called_VBN a_AT binomial_JJ distribution_NN ._. The_AT choice_NN of_IN P_NP and_CC N_NP determines_VBZ the_AT binomial_JJ distribution_NN uniquely_RB ,_, and_CC different_JJ choice_NNS always_RB produce_VB different_JJ distribution_NNS (_( except_IN when_WRB Af_NN ;_. ;_. then_RB the_AT number_NN of_IN success_NNS is_BEZ always_RB 0_CD )_) ._. The_AT set_NN of_IN all_ABN binomial_JJ distribution_NNS is_BEZ called_VBN the_AT family_NN of_IN binomial_JJ distribution_NNS ,_, but_CC in_IN general_JJ discussion_NNS this_DT expression_NN is_BEZ often_RB shortened_VBN to_IN ``_`` the_AT binomial_JJ distribution_NN ''_'' ,_, or_CC even_RB ``_`` the_AT binomial_JJ ''_'' when_WRB the_AT context_NN is_BEZ clear_JJ ._. Binomial_JJ distribution_NNS were_BED treated_VBN by_IN James_NP Bernoulli_NP about_RB 1700_CD ,_, and_CC for_IN this_DT reason_NN binomial_JJ trial_NNS are_BER sometimes_RB called_VBN Bernoulli_NP trial_NNS ._. Random_JJ variable_NNS ._. Each_DT binomial_JJ trial_NN of_IN a_AT binomial_JJ experiment_NN produce_VBZ either_CC 0_CD or_CC 1_CD success_NN ._. Therefore_RB each_DT binomial_JJ trial_NN can_MD be_BE thought_VBN of_IN a_CS producing_VBG a_AT value_NN of_IN a_AT random_JJ variable_NN associated_VBN with_IN that_DT trial_NN and_CC taking_VBG the_AT value_NNS 0_CD and_CC 1_CD ,_, with_IN probability_NNS Q_NP and_CC P_NP respectively_RB ._. The_AT several_AP trial_NNS of_IN a_AT binomial_JJ experiment_NN produce_VB a_AT new_JJ random_JJ variable_NN X_NN ,_, the_AT total_NN number_NN of_IN success_NNS ,_, which_WDT is_BEZ just_RB the_AT sum_NN of_IN the_AT random_JJ variable_NNS associated_VBN with_IN the_AT single_AP trial_NNS ._. Example_NN 2_CD ._. The_AT marksman_NN get_VBZ two_CD bull's-eye_NNS ,_, one_CD on_IN his_PP$ third_OD shot_NN and_CC one_CD on_IN his_PP$ fifth_OD ._. The_AT number_NNS of_IN success_NNS on_IN the_AT five_CD individual_JJ shot_NNS are_BER ,_, then_RB ,_, 0_CD ,_, 0_CD ,_, 1_CD ,_, 0_CD ,_, 1_CD ._. The_AT number_NN of_IN success_NNS on_IN each_DT shot_NN is_BEZ a_AT value_NN of_IN a_AT random_JJ variable_NN that_WPS ha_HVZ value_NNS 0_CD or_CC 1_CD ,_, and_CC there_EX are_BER 5_CD such_JJ random_JJ variable_NNS here_RB ._. Their_PP$ sum_NN is_BEZ X_NN ,_, the_AT total_NN number_NN of_IN success_NNS ,_, which_WDT in_IN this_DT experiment_NN ha_HVZ the_AT value_NN Af_NN ._. Consider_VB a_AT simple_JJ ,_, closed_VBN ,_, plane_NN curve_NN C_NN which_WDT is_BEZ a_AT real-analytic_JJ image_NN of_IN the_AT unit_NN circle_NN ,_, and_CC which_WDT is_BEZ given_VBN by_IN Af_NN ._. These_DTS are_BER real_JJ analytic_JJ periodic_JJ function_NNS with_IN period_NN T_NN ._. In_IN the_AT following_VBG paper_NN it_PPS is_BEZ shown_VBN that_CS in_IN a_AT certain_AP definite_JJ sense_NN ,_, exactly_RB an_AT odd_JJ number_NN of_IN square_NNS can_MD be_BE inscribed_VBN in_IN every_AT such_JJ curve_NN which_WDT doe_DOZ not_* contain_VB an_AT infinite_JJ number_NN of_IN inscribed_VBN square_NNS ._. This_DT theorem_NN is_BEZ similar_JJ to_IN the_AT theorem_NN of_IN Kakutani_NP that_CS there_EX exists_VBZ a_AT circumscribing_VBG cube_NN around_IN any_DTI closed_VBN ,_, bounded_VBN convex_JJ set_NN in_IN Af_NN ._. The_AT latter_AP theorem_NN ha_HVZ been_BEN generalized_VBN by_IN Yamabe_NP and_CC Yujobo_NP ,_, and_CC Cairns_NP to_TO show_VB that_CS in_IN Af_NN there_EX are_BER family_NNS of_IN such_JJ cube_NNS ._. Here_RB ,_, for_IN the_AT case_NN of_IN square_NNS inscribed_VBN in_IN plane_NN curve_NNS ,_, we_PPSS remove_VB the_AT restriction_NN to_IN convexity_NN and_CC give_VB certain_AP other_AP result_NNS ._. A_AT square_NN inscribed_VBN in_IN a_AT curve_NN C_NN mean_VBZ a_AT square_NN with_IN it_PP$ four_CD corner_NN point_NNS on_IN the_AT curve_NN ,_, though_CS it_PPS may_MD not_* lie_VB entirely_RB in_IN the_AT interior_NN of_IN C_NN ._. Indeed_RB ,_, the_AT spiral_NN Af_NN ,_, with_IN the_AT two_CD endpoint_NNS connected_VBN by_IN a_AT straight_JJ line_NN posse_VBZ only_RB one_CD inscribed_VBN square_NN ._. The_AT square_NN ha_HVZ one_CD corner_NN point_NN on_IN the_AT straight_JJ line_NN segment_NN ,_, and_CC doe_DOZ not_* lie_VB entirely_RB in_IN the_AT interior_NN ._. On_IN C_NN ,_, from_IN the_AT point_NN P_NN at_IN Af_NN to_IN the_AT point_NN Q_NN at_IN Af_NN ,_, we_PPSS construct_VB the_AT chord_NN ,_, and_CC upon_IN the_AT chord_NN a_CS a_AT side_NN erect_VB a_AT square_NN in_IN such_ABL a_AT way_NN that_CS a_CS S_NP approach_VBZ zero_CD the_AT square_NN is_BEZ inside_IN C_NN ._. As_CS S_NP increase_VBZ we_PPSS consider_VB the_AT two_CD free_JJ corner_NN point_NNS of_IN the_AT square_NN ,_, Af_NN and_CC Af_NN ,_, adjacent_JJ to_IN P_NN and_CC Q_NN respectively_RB ._. As_CS S_NP approach_VBZ T_NN the_AT square_NN will_MD be_BE outside_IN C_NN and_CC therefore_RB both_ABX Af_NN and_CC Af_NN must_MD cross_VB C_NN an_AT odd_JJ number_NN of_IN time_NNS a_CS S_NP varies_VBZ from_IN zero_CD to_IN T_NN ._. The_AT point_NNS may_MD also_RB touch_VB C_NN without_IN crossing_VBG ._. Suppose_VB Af_NN cross_VBZ C_NN when_WRB Af_NN ._. We_PPSS now_RB have_HV certain_AP square_NNS with_IN three_CD corner_NNS on_IN C_NN ._. For_IN any_DTI such_JJ square_NN the_AT middle_JJ corner_NN of_IN these_DTS will_MD be_BE called_VBN the_AT vertex_NN of_IN the_AT square_NN and_CC the_AT corner_NN not_* on_IN the_AT curve_NN will_MD be_BE called_VBN the_AT diagonal_JJ point_NN of_IN the_AT square_NN ._. Each_DT point_NN on_IN C_NN ,_, a_CS a_AT vertex_NN ,_, may_MD posse_VB a_AT finite_JJ number_NN of_IN corresponding_JJ diagonal_JJ point_NNS by_IN the_AT above_JJ construction_NN ._. To_IN each_DT paired_VBN vertex_NN and_CC diagonal_JJ point_NN there_EX corresponds_VBZ a_AT unique_JJ forward_JJ corner_NN point_NN ,_, i.e._RB ,_, the_AT corner_NN on_IN C_NN reached_VBN first_RB by_IN proceeding_VBG along_IN C_NN from_IN the_AT vertex_NN in_IN the_AT direction_NN of_IN increasing_VBG T_NP ._. If_CS the_AT vertex_NN is_BEZ at_IN Af_NN ,_, and_CC if_CS the_AT interior_NN of_IN C_NN is_BEZ on_IN the_AT left_NR a_CS one_PN move_VBZ in_IN the_AT direction_NN of_IN increasing_VBG t_NN ,_, then_RB every_AT such_JJ corner_NN can_MD be_BE found_VBN from_IN the_AT curve_NN obtained_VBN by_IN rotating_VBG C_NN clockwise_RB through_IN 90-degrees_NNS about_IN the_AT vertex_NN ._. The_AT set_NN of_IN intersection_NNS of_IN Af_NN ,_, the_AT rotated_VBN curve_NN ,_, with_IN the_AT original_JJ curve_NN C_NN consists_VBZ of_IN just_RB the_AT set_NN of_IN forward_JJ corner_NN point_NNS on_IN C_NN corresponding_VBG to_IN the_AT vertex_NN at_IN Af_NN ,_, plus_IN the_AT vertex_NN itself_PPL ._. We_PPSS note_VB that_CS two_CD such_JJ curve_NNS C_NN and_CC Af_NN ,_, cannot_MD* coincide_VB at_IN more_AP than_IN a_AT finite_JJ number_NN of_IN point_NNS ;_. ;_. otherwise_RB ,_, being_BEG analytic_JJ ,_, they_PPSS would_MD coincide_VB at_IN all_ABN point_NNS ,_, which_WDT is_BEZ impossible_JJ since_CS they_PPSS do_DO not_* coincide_VB near_IN Af_NN ._. With_IN each_DT vertex_NN we_PPSS associate_VB certain_AP numerical_JJ value_NNS ,_, namely_RB the_AT set_NN of_IN positive_JJ difference_NNS in_IN the_AT parameter_NN T_NP between_IN the_AT vertex_NN and_CC it_PP$ corresponding_JJ forward_JJ corner_NN point_NNS ._. For_IN the_AT vertex_NN at_IN Af_NN ,_, these_DTS value_NNS will_MD be_BE denoted_VBN by_IN Af_NN ._. The_AT function_NN f{t}_NN defined_VBN in_IN this_DT way_NN is_BEZ multi-valued_JJ ._. We_PPSS consider_VB now_RB the_AT graph_NN of_IN the_AT function_NN f{t}_NN on_IN Af_NN ._. We_PPSS will_MD refer_VB to_IN the_AT plane_NN of_IN C_NN and_CC Af_NN a_CS the_AT C-plane_NN and_CC to_IN the_AT plane_NN of_IN the_AT graph_NN a_CS the_AT Aj_NN ._. The_AT graph_NN ,_, a_CS a_AT set_NN ,_, may_MD have_HV a_AT finite_JJ number_NN of_IN component_NNS ._. We_PPSS will_MD denote_VB the_AT value_NNS of_IN f{t}_NN on_IN different_JJ component_NNS by_IN Af_NN ._. Each_DT point_NN with_IN abscissa_NN T_NP on_IN the_AT graph_NN represents_VBZ an_AT intersection_NN between_IN C_NN and_CC Af_NN ._. There_EX are_BER two_CD type_NNS of_IN such_JJ intersection_NNS ,_, depending_IN essentially_RB on_IN whether_CS the_AT curve_NNS cross_VB at_IN the_AT point_NN of_IN intersection_NN ._. An_AT ordinary_JJ point_NN will_MD be_BE any_DTI point_NN of_IN intersection_NN A_NN such_JJ that_CS in_IN every_AT neighborhood_NN of_IN A_NN in_IN the_AT C-plane_NN ,_, Af_NN meet_VBZ both_ABX the_AT interior_NN and_CC the_AT exterior_NN of_IN C_NN ._. Any_DTI other_AP point_NN of_IN intersection_NN between_IN C_NN and_CC Af_NN will_MD be_BE called_VBN a_AT tangent_JJ point_NN ._. This_DT terminology_NN will_MD also_RB be_BE applied_VBN to_IN the_AT corresponding_JJ point_NNS in_IN the_AT Aj_NN ._. We_PPSS can_MD now_RB prove_VB several_AP lemma_NNS ._. Lemma_NN 1_CD ._. In_IN some_DTI neighborhood_NN in_IN the_AT f-plane_NN of_IN any_DTI ordinary_JJ point_NN of_IN the_AT graph_NN ,_, the_AT function_NN f_NN is_BEZ a_AT single-valued_JJ ,_, continuous_JJ function_NN ._. Proof_NN ._. We_PPSS first_RB show_VB that_CS the_AT function_NN is_BEZ single-valued_JJ in_IN some_DTI neighborhood_NN ._. With_IN the_AT vertex_NN at_IN Af_NN in_IN the_AT C-plane_NN we_PPSS assume_VB that_CS Af_NN is_BEZ the_AT parametric_JJ location_NN on_IN C_NN of_IN an_AT ordinary_JJ intersection_NN Q_NN between_IN C_NN and_CC Af_NN ._. In_IN the_AT f-plane_NN the_AT coordinate_NNS of_IN the_AT corresponding_JJ point_NN are_BER Af_NN ._. We_PPSS know_VB that_CS in_IN the_AT C-plane_NN both_ABX C_NN and_CC Af_NN are_BER analytic_JJ ._. In_IN the_AT C-plane_NN we_PPSS construct_VB a_AT set_NN of_IN rectangular_JJ Cartesian_JJ coordinate_NNS u_NN ,_, V_NP with_IN the_AT origin_NN at_IN Q_NN and_CC such_JJ that_CS both_ABX C_NN and_CC Af_NN have_HV finite_JJ slope_NN at_IN Q_NN ._. Near_IN Q_NN ,_, both_ABX curve_NNS can_MD be_BE represented_VBN by_IN analytic_JJ function_NNS of_IN U_NP ._. In_IN a_AT neighborhood_NN of_IN Q_NN the_AT difference_NN between_IN these_DTS function_NNS is_BEZ also_RB a_AT single-valued_JJ ,_, analytic_JJ function_NN of_IN U_NP ._. Furthermore_RB ,_, one_PN can_MD find_VB a_AT neighborhood_NN of_IN Q_NN in_IN which_WDT the_AT difference_NN function_NN is_BEZ monotone_JJ ,_, for_CS since_CS it_PPS is_BEZ analytic_JJ it_PPS can_MD have_HV only_RB a_AT finite_JJ number_NN of_IN extremum_NNS in_IN any_DTI interval_NN ._. Now_RB ,_, to_TO find_VB Af_NN ,_, one_PN need_VBZ the_AT intersection_NN of_IN C_NN and_CC Af_NN near_IN Q_NN ._. But_CC Af_NN is_BEZ just_RB the_AT curve_NN Af_NN translated_VBN without_IN rotation_NN through_IN a_AT small_JJ arc_NN ,_, for_CS Af_NN is_BEZ always_RB obtained_VBN by_IN rotating_VBG C_NN through_IN exactly_RB 90-degrees_NNS ._. The_AT arc_NN is_BEZ itself_PPL a_AT segment_NN of_IN an_AT analytic_JJ curve_NN ._. Thus_RB if_CS E_NP is_BEZ sufficiently_QL small_JJ ,_, there_EX can_MD be_BE only_RB one_CD intersection_NN of_IN C_NN and_CC Af_NN near_IN Q_NN ,_, for_CS if_CS there_EX were_BED more_AP than_IN one_CD intersection_NN for_IN every_AT E_NP then_RB the_AT difference_NN between_IN C_NN and_CC Af_NN near_IN Q_NN would_MD not_* be_BE a_AT monotone_JJ function_NN ._. Therefore_RB ,_, Af_NN is_BEZ single-valued_JJ near_IN Q_NN ._. It_PPS is_BEZ also_RB seen_VBN that_CS Af_NN ,_, since_CS the_AT change_NN from_IN Af_NN to_IN Af_NN is_BEZ accomplished_VBN by_IN a_AT continuous_JJ translation_NN ._. Thus_RB Af_NN is_BEZ also_RB continuous_JJ at_IN Af_NN ,_, and_CC in_IN a_AT neighborhood_NN of_IN Af_NN which_WDT doe_DOZ not_* contain_VB a_AT tangent_JJ point_NN ._. We_PPSS turn_VB now_RB to_IN the_AT set_NN of_IN tangent_JJ point_NNS on_IN the_AT graph_NN ._. This_DT set_NN must_MD consist_VB of_IN isolated_VBN point_NNS and_CC closed_VBN interval_NNS ._. The_AT fact_NN that_CS there_EX can_MD not_* be_BE any_DTI limit_NN point_NNS of_IN the_AT set_NN except_IN in_IN closed_VBN interval_NNS follows_VBZ from_IN the_AT argument_NN used_VBN in_IN Lemma_NN 1_CD ,_, namely_RB ,_, that_CS near_IN any_DTI tangent_JJ point_NN in_IN the_AT C-plane_NN the_AT curve_NNS C_NN and_CC Af_NN are_BER analytic_JJ ,_, and_CC therefore_RB the_AT difference_NN between_IN them_PPO must_MD be_BE a_AT monotone_JJ function_NN in_IN some_DTI neighborhood_NN on_IN either_DTX side_NN of_IN the_AT tangent_JJ point_NN ._. This_DT prevents_VBZ the_AT occurrence_NN of_IN an_AT infinite_JJ sequence_NN of_IN isolated_VBN tangent_JJ point_NNS ._. Lemma_NN 2_CD ._. In_IN some_DTI neighborhood_NN of_IN an_AT isolated_VBN tangent_JJ point_NN in_IN the_AT f-plane_NN ,_, say_UH Af_NN ,_, the_AT function_NN Af_NN is_BEZ either_CC double-valued_JJ or_CC ha_HVZ no_AT value_NNS defined_VBN ,_, except_IN at_IN the_AT tangent_JJ point_NN itself_PPL ,_, where_WRB it_PPS is_BEZ single-valued_JJ ._. Proof_NN ._. A_AT tangent_JJ point_NN Q_NN in_IN the_AT C-plane_NN occurs_VBZ when_WRB C_NN and_CC Af_NN are_BER tangent_JJ to_IN one_CD another_DT ._. A_AT continuous_JJ change_NN in_IN T_NP through_IN an_AT amount_NN E_NP result_VBZ in_IN a_AT translation_NN along_IN an_AT analytic_JJ arc_NN of_IN the_AT curve_NN Af_NN ._. There_EX are_BER three_CD possibility_NNS :_: (_( A_NP )_) Af_NN remains_VBZ tangent_JJ to_IN C_NN a_CS it_PPS is_BEZ translated_VBN ;_. ;_. (_( B_NP )_) Af_NN move_VBZ away_RB from_IN C_NN and_CC doe_DOZ not_* intersect_VB it_PPO at_IN all_ABN for_IN Af_NN ;_. ;_. (_( C_NP )_) Af_NN cut_VBZ across_IN C_NN and_CC there_EX are_BER two_CD ordinary_JJ intersection_NNS for_IN every_AT T_NP in_IN Af_NN ._. The_AT first_OD possibility_NN result_VBZ in_IN a_AT closed_VBN interval_NN of_IN tangent_JJ point_NNS in_IN the_AT f-plane_NN ,_, the_AT end_NN point_NNS of_IN which_WDT fall_VB into_IN category_NN (_( B_NP )_) or_CC (_( C_NP )_) ._. In_IN the_AT second_OD category_NN the_AT function_NN Af_NN ha_HVZ no_AT value_NNS defined_VBN in_IN a_AT neighborhood_NN Af_NN ._. In_IN the_AT third_OD category_NN the_AT function_NN is_BEZ double-valued_JJ in_IN this_DT interval_NN ._. The_AT same_AP remark_NNS apply_VB to_IN an_AT interval_NN on_IN the_AT other_AP side_NN of_IN Af_NN ._. Again_RB ,_, the_AT analyticity_NN of_IN the_AT two_CD curve_NNS guarantee_VBZ that_CS such_JJ interval_NNS exist_VB ._. In_IN the_AT neighborhood_NN of_IN an_AT end_NN point_NN of_IN an_AT interval_NN of_IN tangent_JJ point_NNS in_IN the_AT f-plane_NN the_AT function_NN is_BEZ two-valued_JJ or_CC no-valued_JJ on_IN one_CD side_NN ,_, and_CC is_BEZ a_AT single-valued_JJ function_NN consisting_VBG entirely_RB of_IN tangent_JJ point_NNS on_IN the_AT other_AP side_NN ._. With_IN the_AT above_JJ result_NNS we_PPSS can_MD make_VB the_AT following_VBG remark_NNS about_IN the_AT graph_NN of_IN F_NP ._. First_RB ,_, for_IN any_DTI value_NN of_IN T_NP for_IN which_WDT all_ABN value_NNS of_IN f{t}_NN are_BER ordinary_JJ point_NNS the_AT number_NN of_IN value_NNS of_IN f{t}_NN must_MD be_BE odd_JJ ._. For_CS it_PPS is_BEZ clear_JJ that_CS the_AT total_NN number_NN of_IN ordinary_JJ intersection_NNS of_IN C_NN and_CC Af_NN must_MD be_BE even_JJ (_( otherwise_RB ,_, starting_VBG in_IN the_AT interior_NN of_IN C_NN ,_, Af_NN could_MD not_* finally_RB return_VB to_IN the_AT interior_NN )_) ,_, and_CC the_AT center_NN of_IN rotation_NN at_IN T_NP is_BEZ the_AT argument_NN of_IN the_AT function_NN ,_, not_* a_AT value_NN ._. Therefore_RB ,_, for_IN any_DTI value_NN of_IN T_NP the_AT number_NN of_IN value_NNS of_IN f{t}_NN is_BEZ equal_JJ to_IN the_AT (_( finite_JJ )_) number_NN of_IN tangent_JJ point_NNS corresponding_VBG to_IN the_AT argument_NN T_NP plus_IN an_AT odd_JJ number_NN ._. Definition_NN ._. The_AT number_NN of_IN ordinary_JJ value_NNS of_IN the_AT function_NN f{t}_NN at_IN T_NP will_MD be_BE called_VBN it_PP$ multiplicity_NN at_IN T_NP ._. Lemma_NN 3_CD ._. The_AT graph_NN of_IN f_NN ha_HVZ at_IN least_AP one_CD component_NN whose_WP$ support_NN is_BEZ the_AT entire_JJ interval_NN Aj_NN ._. Proof_NN ._. We_PPSS suppose_VB not_* ._. Then_RB every_AT component_NN of_IN the_AT graph_NN of_IN F_NP must_MD be_BE defined_VBN over_IN a_AT bounded_VBN sub-interval_NN ._. Suppose_VB Af_NN is_BEZ defined_VBN in_IN the_AT sub-interval_NN Af_NN ._. Now_RB Af_NN and_CC Af_NN must_MD both_ABX be_BE tangent_JJ point_NNS on_IN the_AT T_NP component_NN in_IN the_AT f-plane_NN ;_. ;_. otherwise_RB by_IN Lemma_NN 1_CD the_AT component_NN would_MD extend_VB beyond_IN these_DTS point_NNS ._. Further_RBR ,_, we_PPSS see_VB by_IN Lemma_NN 2_CD that_CS the_AT multiplicity_NN of_IN F_NP can_MD only_RB change_VB at_IN a_AT tangent_JJ point_NN ,_, and_CC at_IN such_ABL a_AT point_NN can_MD only_RB change_VB by_IN an_AT even_JJ integer_NN ._. Thus_RB the_AT multiplicity_NN of_IN Af_NN for_IN a_AT given_VBN T_NP must_MD be_BE an_AT even_JJ number_NN ._. This_DT is_BEZ true_JJ of_IN all_ABN component_NNS which_WDT have_HV such_ABL a_AT bounded_VBN support_NN ._. But_CC this_DT is_BEZ a_AT contradiction_NN ,_, for_CS we_PPSS know_VB that_CS the_AT multiplicity_NN of_IN f{t}_NN is_BEZ odd_JJ for_IN every_AT T_NP ._. We_PPSS have_HV shown_VBN that_CS the_AT graph_NN of_IN F_NP contains_VBZ at_IN least_AP one_CD component_NN whose_WP$ inverse_NN is_BEZ the_AT entire_JJ interval_NN {0,T}_NN ,_, and_CC whose_WP$ multiplicity_NN is_BEZ odd_JJ ._. There_EX must_MD be_BE an_AT odd_JJ number_NN of_IN such_JJ component_NNS ,_, which_WDT will_MD be_BE called_VBN complete_JJ component_NNS ._. The_AT remaining_VBG (_( incomplete_JJ )_) component_NNS all_ABN have_HV an_AT even_JJ number_NN of_IN ordinary_JJ point_NNS at_IN any_DTI argument_NN ,_, and_CC are_BER defined_VBN only_RB on_IN a_AT proper_JJ sub-interval_NN of_IN Aj_NN ._. We_PPSS must_MD now_RB show_VB that_CS on_IN some_DTI component_NN of_IN the_AT graph_NN there_EX exist_VB two_CD point_NNS for_IN which_WDT the_AT corresponding_JJ diagonal_JJ point_NNS in_IN the_AT C-plane_NN are_BER on_IN opposite_JJ side_NNS of_IN C_NN ._. We_PPSS again_RB consider_VB a_AT fixed_VBN point_NN P_NN at_IN Af_NN and_CC a_AT variable_JJ point_NN Q_NN at_IN Af_NN on_IN C_NN ._. We_PPSS erect_VB a_AT square_NN with_IN PQ_NN a_CS a_AT side_NN and_CC with_IN free_JJ corner_NNS Af_NN and_CC Af_NN adjacent_JJ to_IN P_NN and_CC Q_NN respectively_RB ._. As_CS S_NP varies_VBZ from_IN zero_CD to_IN T_NN ,_, the_AT value_NNS of_IN S_NP for_IN which_WDT Af_NN and_CC Af_NN cross_VB C_NN will_MD be_BE denoted_VBN by_IN Af_NN and_CC Af_NN respectively_RB ._. We_PPSS have_HV Af_NN ,_, plus_IN tangent_JJ point_NNS ._. These_DTS s-values_NN are_BER just_RB the_AT ordinary_JJ value_NNS of_IN Af_NN ._. Lemma_NN 4_CD ._. The_AT value_NNS Af_NN are_BER the_AT ordinary_JJ value_NNS at_IN Af_NN of_IN a_AT multi-valued_JJ function_NN g{t}_NN which_WDT ha_HVZ component_NNS corresponding_VBG to_IN those_DTS of_IN f{t}_NN ._. Proof_NN ._. This_DT contradicts_VBZ the_AT preceding_VBG observation_NNS ,_, and_CC so_RB ,_, under_IN the_AT assumption_NN of_IN this_DT paper_NN ,_, we_PPSS must_MD reject_VB the_AT possibility_NN that_CS **zg_NN is_BEZ a_AT Af_NN curve_NN on_IN a_AT quadric_JJ surface_NN ._. These_DTS society_NNS can_MD expect_VB to_TO face_VB difficult_JJ time_NNS ._. As_CS the_AT historic_JJ process_NNS of_IN modernization_NN gradually_RB gain_VB momentum_NN ,_, their_PP$ cohesion_NN will_MD be_BE threatened_VBN by_IN divisive_JJ force_NNS ,_, the_AT gap_NNS between_IN ruler_NNS and_CC subject_NNS ,_, town_NN and_CC country_NN ,_, will_MD widen_VB ;_. ;_. new_JJ aspirant_NNS for_IN power_NN will_MD emerge_VB whose_WP$ ambition_NNS far_RB exceed_VB their_PP$ competence_NN ;_. ;_. old_JJ ruler_NNS may_MD lose_VB their_PP$ nerve_NN and_CC their_PP$ sense_NN of_IN direction_NN ._. Some_DTI of_IN the_AT major_JJ function_NNS of_IN religion_NN The_AT place_NN of_IN religion_NN in_IN the_AT simple_JJ ,_, preliterate_JJ society_NNS is_BEZ quite_QL definite_JJ ;_. ;_. a_CS a_AT complex_NN it_PPS fit_VBZ into_IN the_AT whole_JJ social_JJ organization_NN and_CC function_VBZ dominantly_RB in_IN every_AT part_NN of_IN it_PPO ._. To_IN some_DTI extent_NN the_AT system_NN can_MD be_BE considered_VBN a_AT Gemeinschaft_NN in_IN which_WDT ``_`` social-role_NN occupancy_NNS are_BER determined_VBN by_IN birth_NN ,_, by_IN attribute_NNS such_JJ a_CS sex_NN or_CC caste_NN ,_, which_WDT are_BER biologically_RB or_CC socially_RB immutable_JJ ''_'' ._. The_AT adherence_NN of_IN many_AP in_IN the_AT population_NN to_IN the_AT Indian_JJ background_NN in_IN their_PP$ pedigree_NN ,_, and_CC emphasis_NN upon_IN the_AT fact_NN that_CS their_PP$ ancestor_NNS had_HVD never_RB been_BEN slave_NNS ,_, becomes_VBZ of_IN prime_JJ interest_NN in_IN determining_VBG how_WQL far_RB these_DTS element_NNS promote_VB the_AT self-image_NN of_IN the_AT intermediate_JJ status_NN of_IN the_AT group_NN in_IN society_NN ._. Sanctions_NNS ._. The_AT negative_JJ sanction_NNS applied_VBN to_IN core_NN -_IN Negro_NP marriage_NNS for_IN core_NN member_NNS act_VB a_CS indicator_NNS of_IN expected_VBN adherence_NN to_IN group_NN norm_NNS ._. However_RB ,_, because_RB of_IN Church_NN law_NNS ,_, lately_RB more_QL stringently_RB enforced_VBN ,_, which_WDT forbid_VB the_AT marriage_NN of_IN cousin_NNS closely_RB related_VBN consanguineously_RB ,_, a_AT mean_NN of_IN facilitating_VBG the_AT goal_NN of_IN in-group_NN relation_NNS may_MD be_BE that_DT of_IN recourse_NN to_IN illegitimate_JJ union_NNS ._. A_AT cursory_JJ survey_NN of_IN available_JJ material_NN indicates_VBZ a_AT high_JJ rate_NN of_IN illegitimate_JJ birth_NNS occurring_VBG to_IN parent_NNS who_WPS have_HV a_AT close_JJ consanguineous_JJ relationship_NN ._. Subsystems_NNS The_AT comprehensive_JJ or_CC master_NN process_NNS activate_VB all_ABN or_CC some_DTI of_IN the_AT element_NNS within_IN the_AT social_JJ system_NN and_CC subsystem_NNS ._. Within_IN the_AT large_JJR social_JJ system_NN are_BER the_AT structural_JJ and_CC functional_JJ subsystem_NNS ._. The_AT structural_JJ subsystem_NN ,_, consisting_VBG of_IN relatively_QL stable_JJ inter-relationships_NNS among_IN it_PP$ part_NNS ,_, includes_VBZ :_: 1_CD ._. Roles_NNS of_IN various_AP type_NNS ,_, within_IN the_AT large_JJR system_NN and_CC within_IN the_AT subgroup_NNS 3_CD ._. Regulative_JJ norm_NNS governing_VBG subgroup_NNS and_CC role_NNS ._. 4_CD ._. Cultural_JJ value_NNS ._. In_IN the_AT study_NN of_IN marriage_NN pattern_NNS for_IN this_DT group_NN ,_, consanguinity_NN produce_VBZ the_AT structural_JJ system_NN --_-- a_AT system_NN of_IN affinity_NNS --_-- which_WDT ,_, in_IN turn_NN ,_, maintains_VBZ the_AT system_NN of_IN consanguinity_NN ._. Subgroups_NNS of_IN various_AP type_NNS have_HV been_BEN found_VBN within_IN this_DT system_NN ._. Each_DT family_NN line_NN can_MD be_BE considered_VBN a_AT substructure_NN ._. There_EX seems_VBZ to_TO be_BE an_AT implied_VBN cultural_JJ value_NN attached_VBN to_IN the_AT fact_NN of_IN core_NN status_NN within_IN the_AT group_NN ._. Additionally_RB ,_, the_AT proscription_NN of_IN core_NN -_IN Negro_NP marriage_NNS for_IN core_NN family_NNS ,_, discussed_VBN above_RB ,_, would_MD seem_VB to_TO act_VB a_CS a_AT regulative_JJ norm_NN governing_VBG subgroup_NNS and_CC role_NNS ._.
